Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Dzignr
Reviews.Content: One of the top hotels we have stayed in. The staff are so nice and the rooms/ suites are very, very nice. A very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “The service is the worst!”
Reviews.Author: Bakeacake28
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here multiple times, but won't ever again. The housekeeping staff is so lacking! They never left our towels/bath mats/robes fully stocked. Each time we needed something, we had to ask multiple times. The manager could not have cared less. While the rooms are spacious, the decor is run down and dated. The only staff that was attentive were the doormen and valets. Disappointing to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely new Orleans”
Reviews.Author: bobbieonthego
Reviews.Content: Hotel Windsor court was excellent with odd shaped but adequate sized rooms and ok bathrooms. We had a view of the river that was Beautuful day and nite. Beds were good, linens excellent. Lobby bar has live jazz at nite. Quite good. Upstairs bar/lounge is spacious and comfy with live music and good but expensive small plates. Staff is helpful if a bit slow. Hotel location is excellent-- walking distance to most things but not in the very center of the French quarter which is noisy and chaotic. Over all we loved NOLA ESP the music the people the spirit and the food.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, great service. Modern yet transitional setting. Low key. Close to all.”
Reviews.Author: ElviaJ
Reviews.Content: Great room service. I block from Saks 5th ave, aquarium, river walk, harrah casino. And I 10 hway,convention center, Mercdes Benz superdome. Great location away from hustle and bustle yet short walk or cab to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great French Quarter Festival Stay”
Reviews.Author: headdocs
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this property for more than a decade, and watched its decline. After Katrina, it tried to return to its former state, but never really got there. Now, for the first time, the hotel seems to be back, delivering my best stay in years. It all starts with Lauren, who contacts you before you arrive for any anticipated needs. She has been great help in requesting the perfect room, ordering flowers through the concierge for my wife, and even recommending a running route up St Charles. However, your stay really begins at the front door, and this hotel has the best doorman in the city. David is fantastic and always remembers our names, cars, etc. He is truly amazing and I hope the hotel realizes what an asset he is for their returning guests. Check-in was a breeze and our room was ready at arrival - beautiful Club Level Full Suite. We prefer the --01 rooms, as they are at the end of the halls, offer river views, and are configured well with many windows and light. The renovation of the bathrooms in the past year has made our stays even nicer. Before, water pressure was an issue, but this is improved substantially. My wife wishes the hair dryers were of better quality (the ones at the Roosevelt are the same as she has at home), so she just brings her own. The Club Lounge does a good job. I still think the NOLA Ritz Club is a little better with regards to food quality, but it is hard to beat the great river view and outside seating areas. The staff there was pleasant, as usual, and tries to help as many guests as they can. My only real criticism, as noted by other guests, is housekeeping. The daily service is fine, but the turndown seems highly variable. Sometimes the curtains were closed, other times not. Sometimes towels were replaced, and other times not. It seems like water should be left behind - at least in the Club level. If there is a checklist that the staff should follow, then they are not doing it. We had breakfast daily in the Grill Room, preferring it over the Club Lounge. The homemade granola and hashbrowns were among the favorites of the weekend. Checkout was great with a correct bill. The final goodbye was to our friend, David. We'll be back soon. Thanks for the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent NOLA hotel with a river view”
Reviews.Author: sjlm
Reviews.Content: Why the WC instead of the RitzCarlton? A room with a river view. (Note that river views are in odd-numbered rms, but not all odd-numbered rooms have a river view.) You may think a view isn't that important when you're out most of the day, but even for a glance here and there, the river is fascinating. At check-in, guests are asked what time they would like their rooms made up and, in my experience, that's when the rm was made up. Food on the Club Level is well done and you would have enough to eat and drink all day w/o spending another penny (not that you'd want to do that in NO, but it is nice not having to go out for brkfst every day or having a casual glass of wine and snacks mid-day between day and evening activities). Convenient location for walking into FQ or driving to Uptown. Pool area is very pleasant with very comfortable lounges and towels. Beds and bed linens are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “It's like coming Home and Luxury all at once!”
Reviews.Author: Lori L
Reviews.Content: It's like coming home each time we are at the WC! The new renovations (ALL floors are complete) are beautiful, comfortable and I especially love the Keurig machines in each room---a little touch of home. :) We have stayed on the Club level and it is also very beautiful but 90% of our visits are spent in a Jr. suite--not Club level. Over the last year, every room we have stayed in has been completely renovated--this even includes the hallways. The WC definitely has gone through a growing and renovation period BUT not only is the WC fabulous they are also in the process of adding a beautiful SPA and a NEW pool (now compete). YEAH! One of our favorite parts of the WC is the Polo lounge. Best cocktails and service in the city: REALLY! Roger is known for his creative drinks as well as for just an awesome glass of champagne. If you know Nola, you know this. Music, cocktails and friends--it is not so loud and crowded that you can't have a great time with friends. We love that it is a get-away weekend place that is located close to lots of city action or we may not leave the hotel all weekend. The Grill room is also an excellent place for breakfast and/or dinner. Ask for a spot out by the windows :) FYI: They are VERY pet friendly. Our little dog, Fred loves the WC. You can request a room on the pet floor! We will be spending our 5th Anniversery at the hotel in August and a daughter getting married in Nola April, 2013. I CAN HARDLY WAIT TILL THE SPA IS COMPLETE!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and tired”
Reviews.Author: CMSCLS
Reviews.Content: We have lvoed this hotel for some time. Unforutnately, depsite its recent facelift, it is tired. The service, while exceedingly friendly and courteous, is not up to the level of an Orient Express hotel. Most specifically, the housekeeping service leaves much to be desired. On TWO separate trips to NOLE, we returned at day's end, around 4-5pm, to find that our room was not made up. Once, I can live with...twice (on two seperate trips) makes for consistency! Also, the "refreshening each day of the bathroom is subpar with inattention to "detail"--there were no hand towels given. Neither of these are huge deals by any means but at this level, that should never occur! The hotel is impeccably maintained and the common rooms are wonderful--elegant with great service. Although, the margaritas at the Polo Bar were awful--really! We have stayed at the Ritz Carlton and will probably try another hotel on our next trip to NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Operation”
Reviews.Author: loulani
Reviews.Content: This is our third visit to Windsor Court, first this year. All the renovations have been completed and WOW, how beautiful. From the momemt you walk into the lobby to you enter your room, clean, crisp and quiet. From room service to luggage handlers, it was perfect. Our convention was at the Convention Center and it was an easy walk. There are not many places you can go today and have a good experience with their customer service. Here was different. The staff should be commended on a job well done. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Tainted stay by surly receptionist”
Reviews.Author: SusanHeather
Reviews.Content: Having booked the hotel room weeks in advance.Having also been assured by the hotel that a "strong request" was being put in for a river view room in writing. Having confirmed this request including date and time of arrival, sometimes things just go adrift, fair enough. A room wasn't available. Things don't always go to plan. We are prepared for that. However what confronted my unassuming gentle husband and son following their 6 hour road drive from Houston was a snappy, sarcastic receptionist. Who's main interest other than checking in two customers into a $300 night room appeared to be that they sign the waiver to say that if they had the temerity to put their own goods in the room fridge they would be charged a $35 clean out fee! No not exactly customer service at its finest. Two weeks ago we stayed in the Grosvener House in Park Lane, pleasant arrival pleasant stay I expect this of a 5 star establishment which the Windsor Court purports to be. Staff are the lifeblood of any business no matter how well appointed the building / decoration are. Problems can happen at any time or anywhere but its how you handle them that counts in the end.

Reviews.Title: “We would never stay anywhere else in New Orleans!!”
Reviews.Author: uvalaura
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed on the Club level in a full suite overlooking the Mississippi River. Beautiful accommodations and outstanding service! Excellent location!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Boombabie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! Stayed for a seminar. The suite we had was so big and spacious! Every person on staff made you feel as if you were a celebrity and a very valued guest at their hotel. Very close to the french quarter, casino, shopping, streetcars and many dining establishments in New Orleans. Hotel is very clean and quiet. Bedding is a dream to rest upon at night and with the turn down service makes it even more special! The hotel makes your stay very unforgettable from the moment you arrive. The bellman that brought the luggage to our room was extremly knowledgable when asked how to get to some of the attractions. He even offered to get us ice for our ice bucket if we wanted. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that was looking for a nice place to stay while in new orleans. Even though it may be a little pricey it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Wow. Wow.”
Reviews.Author: MelissaW10_73
Reviews.Content: I can't stop talking about our stay. We were in NOLA for my husband's company meeting which was held at the Windsor. I was impressed with everything from the minute we arrived. Super staff is at the top of my list. The hotel itself is beautiful. The courtyard is alive with spring flowers and color. We had a lovely suite which was plenty large enough for our family of 5. We couldn't have asked for more. The pool area is top-notch (again, the staff was incredible), room service was better than I could have imagined (more great staff). See a pattern? It doesn't matter where you are in this hotel, the staff truly make your stay that much better. This is the top choice for our vist to New Orleans. Loved every part of it. It's close to so many great places to eat, shop and visit.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous place!!”
Reviews.Author: WKYtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a seminar and was treated like a celebrity. I had a suite that was bigger than my first apartment. Outstanding service and luxurious rooms make this a fantastic "special occasion" hotel. Walking distance to the French Quarter, casino and shopping and dining the location couldn't be better. Quiet and clean throughout. Didn't get to sample food in the restaurant, but the food at the group lunch was better than I've had at many "fine dining" places. Don't be surprised when you don't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: JKS
Reviews.Content: We visited New Orleans with our children (17 and 12) earlier this week for a college visit at Tulane. The entry courtyard to the Windsor Court Hotel is lovely. The entance to the lobby is beautiful and you are greeted with the signature floral arrangement of 12 dozen beautiful roses. We arrived very early and stored our bags with the bellman.We reserved a full suite with 2 queen beds. There were only king beds available at the time we arrived. We explored the Riverwalk and French Quarter, had lunch, and returned at around 2:00. Still no room. We sat and relaxed in their beautiful lobby. 3:00, check-in time, still no room. We take a deep breath and continue to wait. At 3:45, still no room. At this point, after getting up at an insane hour to arrive at the airport for a 6:30am flight, we are tired and very unhappy. A bit more time passes and we are upgraded to a club level suite. This instantly makes up for the wait. The bellman meets us at the elevator and escorts us up to the 21st floor with our luggage. We are given the lay of the land as well as the hours for the club lounge. He filled our ice bucket and called for a rollaway bed so our children could sleep in peace. The suite was gorgeous. The entry had beautiful parquet flooring. To the right there was an entry table with lamp and a mirror on the wall. To the left was a granite topped wet bar area. the bar held mini bar items as well as a Keurig machine with both coffee and tea selections. The living room had 10 ft ceilings, and was furnished with a large sofa, 2 chairs, coffee table, 2 end tables, a writing desk and chair, a 42" flat panel TV, a marble table with 2 chairs. There was a floorplant in the corner and a plant in a pretty silver container on the table. There was a cordless phone on one of the end tables. The carpeting was in very good condition. The drapes were very pretty. There was an unfurnished balcony off of the living room. The color scheme was very soothing and warm. French doors separate the living and bedroom areas. The bedroom also had a 10 ft ceiling and was furnished with 2 queen beds with a bench at the foot of each and pretty wood headboards, 2 dressers, a nightstand between the beds, and a 32" flat panel TV. There was a large bay window. The blackout draperies are well done. There was an iPod dock/alarm clock and phone on the night stand. There was a dressing area with a sink, granite topped vanity and chair. The area contained a good sized closet with a laptop sized safe, iron and ironing board, and some shelving. The ceiling drops down to 8 ft in the dressing and bathroom areas. The bathroom may be entered from either the bedroom or living room. there was a vanity with a single sink, granite counter top, and some shelving. There was a vase with a black calla lily matching those found throughout the hote, There was a door at the entry from the living room and a pocket door leading to the dressing area. Another door lead to the wc and bath tub/shower. the tub surround and walls were tiled with marble. Marble flooring ran throughout the bath and dressing areas. There was a scale in the bathroom. The club lounge was on the 22nd floor and had lovely views. There were 2 outdoor patio areas. The continental breakfast and evening appetizers were set up very nicely. There were cocktails in the evening. We were not around for the afternoon tea service. There was a concierge desk in the lounge and Diana was very helpful. There was a flat panel TV and 2 computers. Wonderful artwork on display throughout the hotel. The pool deck just reopened a few weeks ago. It is a lovely area. The pool heater was out of service during our stay. We did not utilize the spa. The Polo Lounge was a nice place to have a cocktail. The Grill Room was wonderful for lunch. Our server was outstanding and very knowledgeable. This was the first restaurant we have ever encountered where the server was able to confidently answer gluten free menu questions without skipping a beat! We utilized valet parking. When our car was brought around, we found cold bottles of water in the cup holders for our drive! Once we were over the initial hiccup of checking in, our stay was absolutely wonderful. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding! Go!”
Reviews.Author: ttimeatharrods
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a restful and wonderful weekend at the Windsor to celebrate our 20th anniversary. The hotel manager even sent us a bottle of champagne. It is far enough from the craziness of the French Quarter to be peaceful but close enough to easily stroll anywhere you'd like to see. Gorgeous suite overlooking the river, decorated beautifully and exceptionally clean. Would go back in a heartbeat. =)

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm near the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Catsaver911
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel with large comfortable rooms. The hotel is very calm and the staff very accommodating. a short walk to the french quarter, warehouse district and cruise terminal. we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: TMichael2
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Court is an outstanding property in New Orleans. To be fair, the only room I saw was a suite to which we were upgraded upon arrival (at no additional charge). The room was perfect -- large, spotless, well-appointed, quiet, etc. The service was exceptional. The location is perfect for access to the French Quarter, shopping, music venues, restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: HoganHHI
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Windsor Court many times, but the last time I stayed there a few years ago I did not think I would return because the hotel had slipped in quality from the service to the quality of the decor. I became stuck in one of their elevators and it took 15-20 minutes for someone to get us out and never received an apology. This visit was fortunately just the opposite.. The hotel has been renovated and the furnishings were 1st class. We stayed on the club level and the club is extremely well furnished and the breakfast and evening hors d'oeuvres are very good. The personnel there and in the entire hotel were excellent. They seemed to have taken a cue from the Ritz Carlton: "We are ladies and gentlemen serving ladies and gentlemen". We checked in and were given a corner suite which is the largest with a balcony. Unfortunately, the wifi does not have a strong enough signal to reach this room and we were immediately given a new more central suite. This hotel is back and we will certainly stay there again whenever we are in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Excellence in a service minded hotel”
Reviews.Author: TryitYoullLikeIt
Reviews.Content: We greatly appreciate the personal touches of the Windsor Court. The staff was friendly, the rooms excellent and we were called by name everytime we needed assistance or had a question.

Reviews.Title: “Multiple Problems”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Windsor Court for four nights and were very disappointed. We picked it based on a recommendation from Frommers (said it was best in North America prior to Caterina and still very fine). I think it must have fallen very far since then. Perhaps my expectations were a little high. The rooms and hotel in general are nice, comforatable, and clean. The staff is pleasant. However the service leaves a lot to be desired and the hotel is technology challenged. Some of the problems we ran into: - The TV was fuzzy and the wireless connection was so low that we couldn't keep a connection. - The hotel was kind enough to give us another room (and moved our luggage for us), but gave us a room that wasn't quite as nice (a little smaller, desk didn't have plug in or AV connections, motel 6 soap instead of the nice soap in the previous room, etc. - nothing major just a slight down grade). - The second day there we came back from a day wandering around and found that they didn't clean the room. We had booked the cleaning to be between 2 and 5 pm as we planned on sleeping in - somehow that translated into not cleaning the room (it did work the next day) - On the third day we came back and found there was no toilet paper. We called for someone to bring some, but after an hour no one showed up. - The kids wanted to watch a movie on the second night, but the Hotel doesn't have any type of pay per view or netflix capability. We were going to connect our computer to the TV, but our new room didn't have the connections our first room had. The staff did't know where to look for cables and said they would find some in the morning (not a lot of help when we have kids wanting to watch something before bed). The staff did look the next day and got the cables that were in the previous room. - The rooms are dark, but did have a reading lamp. However there are no plugins near the bed to use it. That didn't really matter as it didn't work. We swaped light bulbs with another lamp in the room to get it to work (but only turns off by unplugging it) - The concierge was very helpful in getting us tickets for a river boat jazz cruise. However when we showed up, we found that he didn't give us the proper paperwork. We still got on, so it wasn't a big deal, but could have been if the river boat was fully booked. - The room has no plug ins near the bed or easily accessable by the desk. We had four computers, four iphones, and a few cameras to charge - but no place to plug things in. Most lower end hotels have already figured this out and provide connections. - Wireless is free, but you have to log in after each time you turn off your computer or leave the room with your phone. A minor thing, but still a pain that most hotels have figured out. - The tub felt like I was standing on a layer of soap scum A few good things: - We needed spoons for ice cream we bought on the way back to the Hotel and they brought them. - We forgot sunglasses in our car and they went and got them - We needed help finding a cruise and the concierge found one for us

Reviews.Title: “Babbaloo”
Reviews.Author: Maxmo1
Reviews.Content: My wife,children and I have stayed many times at this great property. It simply is one of the best high quality luxury hotels ever. Large enoughto have all the amenities you would expect yet small enough to have a real connection with. We have stayed both per Katrina and post Katrina and the hotel and staff seems to continually improve. I continue to recommend it to family and friends and quite frankly is the standard I judge all other hotels by. Please keep up the great work.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old world hotel”
Reviews.Author: MiamiviceMiami
Reviews.Content: First thing first.....if you haven't been to New Orleans..... YOU MUST. What a great city full of energy. The hotel offered a lovely relaxing environment. The bar was especially enjoyable. We stayed on the executive floor where there is complimentary breakfast and cocktails later in the day. At the weekend the breakfast was really good with a station for having eggs cooked as you liked. During the week, it was not so good, but adequate. We had a couple of problems while we were there which were quickly sorted as soon as I mentioned trip advisor! Our suite was well equipped with very comfortable bedding. All together, even with our few hiccups, we had a fantastic long weekend. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Class!”
Reviews.Author: cupcakelady1
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about our stay at Windsor Court; We had booked a last minute trip, and got the room at an unbelieveably low price; and when we got there-treated like royalty!!! I can't wait to be able to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Mary B
Reviews.Content: Staying at the newly renovated Windsor Court was an exceptional experience. The rooms are extremely comfortable as are the beds. If you can, try the Club Level; it truly was an experience. The morning service was friendly and hospitable with true New Orleans hospitality! I'll be back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: time4avacation30
Reviews.Content: Just got back from New Orleans last week. I stayed on the 21st floor of the Windsor Court so we were able to take advantage of the club level experience. It was nice to be able to go to the club level for a light breakfast or if we didn't want to eat there we could get a voucher from the front desk to eat in the dining room and have the value of the club breakfast deducted from whatever we ordered in the dining room. We would also head up to the club level every night to have complimentary drinks and appetizers before heading out for the night. Our room was very spacious, two queen beds, a bathroom and then sort of a powder room outside of the bathroom so more than one of us was able to get ready at the same time. I loved the complimentary mini scones we were given at breakfast in the dining room and if you go for tea time you'll get a few large ones there, they were better than any I've had in NYC so far. The hotel offers a 3hr tour of New Orleans twice a day and we did that on our first day. I would say its worth the time and the money if you know very little about New Orleans. We took the trolley to Parkway Bakery for Poor Boys and the fried shrimp one was extremely good, towards the end I just ate the shrimp because it really didn't need all the fixings. The trolley is very slow at least in the French Quarter area because it stops at pretty much every block but once you get further away it can be faster. My favorite meal was at Bayona, I had the crispy quail salad and the lamb loin. I would also suggest going to August and going somewhere that offers Sunday Jazz Brunch. As far as jazz goes, we went to Snug Harbor jazz bistro on a night Charmaine Neville was performing and boy was she bad. When we arrived we took a seat in the back of the first floor in case it might be took loud upfront as its not a large venue. When the band opened they sounded great and we thought we were going to have a great night, they had Davell Crawford on the piano for the opening with one of his songs and he had everyone into it. Then Charmaine got on stage and put a damper on the night. She did one song and then said she heard there was a bunch of student volunteers from Newbury College in the house and that one of them was a singer. She went on a rant about how we need to nurture the young folks in music and made the audience member come on stage, he asked if he could bring a friend and she said alright. She then started a song and had them sing the same words every now and then but you could tell they were uneasy. She then wanted him to choose a song and sing it for everyone so that took a while because he had to try to think of something they might know how to play, luckily they decided on a gospel song but he didn't know all the words and warned he would just stop when he needed to. I don't know if he was nervous, which you could tell he was, or if he just isn't as great a singer as someone told Charmaine. His girlfriend that he had come on stage with him had a better pair of lungs than him and Charmaine, I almost wished she just performed because her voice caught your attention. After they were finally allowed to head back to their seats Charmaine went on a rant about god and even a local next to me said "come on now, I already went to church on Sunday, I want to hear some jazz". He had all of us laughing and I found him more entertaining throughout the hour and a half than Charmaine. Her next song involved her opening a bag full of small instruments like a tambourine, cowbells, maracas and I don't know what else. This is where I was glad we were sitting in the back because she started handing out these instruments to the crowd and having the people come on stage. There was at least 7 audience members now involved and everyone was strumming to their own beat. It was like a circus and went on for so long that the audience members involved were less enthusiastic about it by the minute. Charmaine finally did a solo act for about two songs and then invited her son onstage and wanted us to support us song on Amazon that's titled something like "New Orleans, Hot". It was a rap song about New Orleans and by that time there might have been 15min left of the show because people would need to start coming in for her 10pm show. We left while her son was still performing in hopes to find some real jazz and thought we would checkout the Spotted Cat until one of us realized we lost a credit card and had to head back to the hotel to cancel it. On a different night we went to Irvin Mayfields which was a nice spot and it's free, I would try to get there on a Wednesday when Irvin performs. I almost forgot to mention the beignets at Cafe du Monde, they are worth waiting for and they are open 24/7. We went on a Sunday afternoon and only had to wait about 5min for a seat and its really cheap. There are a bunch of places to eat in the French Market I would check out, when I walked through I wish I didn't have different lunch plans. What I also enjoyed about the area of the French Quarter is there are a number of musical street performances that you can stop and listen to. I would like to go back with friends as opposed to family to check out more of the scene on Bourbon St. at night, it's nothing special during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: PimlicoTram
Reviews.Content: I fled here from the woeful Doubletree next door. The Windsor Court is professionally run by friendly people and has good staffing levels. My room was spacious and I'll go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Buisness Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BRLS
Reviews.Content: Its one of those business hotels where you don't know if you wake up in Tokyo, DÃ¼sseldorf or (in this case) New Orleans. The view of the Mississippi is intriguing though. Everything works from bell service to reception and beyond. There are old pictures on the walls. The connection between the paintings and New Orleans or Louisianna is, at best, highly unclear. If you donÂ´t want local flavour, but a convenient place to stay, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is highly overrated.”
Reviews.Author: Sidneysider60
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for me by my travel agent. I stayed there 4 nights. It is on the outer edge of the French quarter and there are a number of other hotels of the same standing that are right. In the quarter. On the first morning, there was no coffee maker ( or at least I couldn't find it) so had to run out and buy coffee. There was a cupboard that had no handle, but I couldn't get it open without the handle. After 3 nights I pried the cupboard open and found the dirty, broken coffee maker with other rubbish that had been left in the cupboard. I called the concierge to have the coffee maker replaced, and while they had said they would send someone immediately, 2 hours later , it had not been replaced. There are sensors in the mini bar, so if you take anything out to look at it, even if you put it back, you are charged. The shower in my room did not turn off properly and constantly dripped. While the nightly turn down service is nice, I think I would have preferred better service wit the things I mentioned earlier. There is no ice machine on the floor either.

Reviews.Title: “In The Lap of Luxury”
Reviews.Author: poolqueenAppleriver
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Windsor Court Hotel in New Orleans was a little bit of heaven in a busy place during Mardi Gras. The flowers in the lobby were the most beautiful roses we have seen in along time. The protected courtyard was also beautiful with the azaleas and pansies blooming everywhere. The harpist and violinst in the lobby relaxed us after a hectic day of traveling. The suite was more than we expected and was luxuriously laid out.I would highly recommend this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place in New Orleans for us”
Reviews.Author: janet g
Reviews.Content: From the time we entered the protected courtyard rimmed with planters of colorful azaleas to our departure, my husband and I felt so fortunate to have chosen the Windsor Court. We appreciate its quiet elegance, just a couple of short blocks away from the "action". The comfortable lobby and lounge areas made it feel like home. Â The fitness room was very well equipped. Â Our room was very beautifully appointed and peaceful with generous drawer and counter space. Â I cannot end this without giving credit to Adam at the concierge desk who responded almost immediately with the most thorough information each time I emailed or called with any questions. Â We travel well and often and will remember this as one of our most enjoyable stays."

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Mardi Gras!”
Reviews.Author: proftnman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Crown Plaza and Queen & Crescent, downtown. This hotel tops both of them! The staff was exceptional! Everybody was helpful. Customer Service at its best! Well worth the price considering Mardi Gras. This will be my first choice when I go back.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: DSullivan94
Reviews.Content: This was my first time coming to New Orleans, and the Windsor Court Hotel proved to be a fantastic stay over Thanksgiving weekend. This hotel has great decor, with a beautiful lobby and especially well-furnished rooms with phenomenally comfortable beds. It is located just a few blocks from canal street and the heart of the French Quarter, which makes this hotel a good stay for anybody (like me) visiting New Orleans for the first time. When I stayed here, there was some renovation going on on some of the upper floors, and the floor my room was on smelled a bit like paint. The pool wasn't open either. However, because of this, the rates were low when I stayed, making such a luxurious hotel a great value. I am sure that the renovations will make this hotel even better in the future. All of the staff members were extremely courteous and helpful, creating service that was top-notch. This hotel provided a warm, comforting stay in the heart of New Orleans and I would certainly recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: sweetgirlSt_Louis
Reviews.Content: My husband is a native of New Orleans and we have been "coming home" to NOLA for over thirty years. Our first visit to the city following Hurricane Katrina was Thanksgiving of 2005. Very few hotels were open at that time but the Windsor Court was one of them. It had a skeleton staff and no room service and only a buffet for meals but we were warmly welcomed and made to feel at home. For over three years, until we bought our new vacation home on the Mississippi gulf coast, we stayed at the Windsor Court on a fairly regular basis. We loved the W.C. then and we still continue to consider it our "home away from home" whenever we go to the "city." Our most recent visit was during Christmas week 2011 and our one night stay was much too short. The hotel, which is undergoing renovation by its new owner, has retained all of its wonderful ambiance. A before or after dinner drink at the Polo Bar is still one of my favorite things to do on a visit. Our suite on the 14th floor had been remodeled and it was beautiful, comfortable and luxurious. I can't say enough about the staff - they are loyal and dedicated to their clients and it was wonderful to see many familiar faces, particularly Jackie Doise. Thank you to everyone for making our all too short visit to the W.C. so enjoyable. Anyone making a trip to the Big Easy for business or pleasure certainly deserves at least one night at the Windsor Court. You will not be disappointed and you will want to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dave m
Reviews.Content: Located across the street from Harrahs, (it you like to gamble), and a few blocks from Bourbon street, makes this a great location. The rooms are large, with all the creature comforts, the carpet could stand to be replaced, in our room it was pulling away from the wall. This is an older hotel, with tons of charm, and the best staff I have met anywhere. The food is pricey, but quality is wonderful. Of course its almost impossible to find a bad meal in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Price, Local Flavor”
Reviews.Author: NycFamilyof4
Reviews.Content: This eclectic hotel is a New Orleans gem. It is a well maintained, updated hotel with large rooms that incorporate old and new. They have actual bells on the doors that the staff turn to let you know that they are there. The hotel is owned by prominent local businessmen. The staff are very attentive and not like the 20 somethings that you typically run into at the global luxury chains. These people are polite locals who appear to have been working there quite some time. They are pleasant to speak to and offer advice about things to do. The business center is a bit lacking, but other than that I think that you will like your stay here. The rooms service is fast and the portions are huge, try the ruben, it reminds me of a Carnegie Deli sandwich. The bedding is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Everything & everyone was great!”
Reviews.Author: soundslikeseattle
Reviews.Content: Very well kept, great service and attention to detail. Great location. I'll be back with my better half to enjoy a long weekend soon.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steven P
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Windsor Court was exceptional. Our suite was beautiful, the beds very comfortable, and the staff extremely helpful. Every employee is trained well. The valet even had bottled water waiting in the car for us for our journey home. We would highly recommend this centrally located hotel and will be staying there the next time we are in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Pristine Mirror of the City_DvB”
Reviews.Author: Kaiser_D
Reviews.Content: We all know that if you are in New Orleans proper, only the Garden District really seems â€œclean,â€� and much of the attraction ties to the history and traditions. Windsor Court as a hotel is a model of New Orleans with its classic decorations and design, maintaining the allure of the past. This is not a modern property by any stretch and visitors should appreciate his/her/their taste if selecting this property. The afternoon tea is one of the most beautiful and serene activities in the city, and a perfect close to a vacation of indulgence. Like the pleasant and attentive, yet maintaining the distance appropriate for private conversation, staff of the tea service, the entire hotelâ€™s staff truly provides a harkening to bygone days where staffs were friendly but aloof enough not to share life stories with guests. I really like it overall and suggest you stay at least once.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: marcelproustnyc
Reviews.Content: Expensive but worth it. One of a kind in New Orleans. Stay here if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “A pefect layout for a hotel room”
Reviews.Author: CincinnatiKid97
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Windsor but the first since the room renovations have been completed. I continue to be impressed by the layout of the rooms. I had a one room suite with a bar area, living and dining area, and a separate bedroom. There is also a dressing area, another sink/washing area, and a separate shower/commode area. The overall impression one gets is of an elegant one bedroom apartment (although there is no kitchen). The roominess feels delightful and makes going back to a standard hotel room somewhere else a difficult adjustment. The new furnishings fit in perfectly with the old world elegance of the interiors. The staff was very courteous and low-key. Wifi was free although slightly slow. Like many high-end hotels, there were no ice machines for the guests (a minor annoyance) but ice was freely provided by housekeeping. The turn-down service provided delicious pralines every other night (alternating with chocolates).

Reviews.Title: “The Best in New Orleans!!!!”
Reviews.Author: maximus217
Reviews.Content: It is with great pleasure to report that our stay at the Windsor Court Hotel was beyond what we have imagined. We have have read some good and bad reviews about the hotel, but after staying here I could not believe why some people would write bad reviews about the Windsor Court Hotel. This hotel is amazing and grand. The location of the hotel is perfect. If you are planning to attend a conference at the Convention Center and would like to feel like royalty, there is no other place to stay in New Orleans but the Windsor Court Hotel. Shopping? The shops at the Canal Place and Riverwalk Mall are few blocks away. Fine dining? The Windsor Court Hotel has one of the best in the city - The Grill Room. A block away from the hotel you will find August by Chef John Besh. Things to do? The Aquarium of the America and Insectarium are also few blocks away. Gambling? The Harrah's is a across from the hotel. You will also find the New Orleans Trolley a few feet away. The staff at the Windsor Court Hotel are all courteous and greets you with a smile from the doorman to the bellman to the concierge to the front desk and everyone else you meet in the hotel. You can feel their pride in working in this hotel. The lobby of the hotel is magnificent and grand without being pretentious, and there are several works of art in the hotel We have booked the full suite. Let me say the room is far more grandeur than the Waldorf Astoria in New York. The room was magnificent, and the view is spectacular, having the backdraft of the Mississippi river. There is a butler's pantry in our room. The bed is comfortable, and there is enough space for our clothes. For the ladies, there is a make up table. There is no bath tub in our room, but who would like to use one where everybody else had laid down in it and scrub their body. The shower space, however, is wonderful, and the water pressure is the best I have seen in any other hotels, considering our room is in the 16th floor. There is no problem getting the hot water. The towels are soft, and they provide Molton Brown in the bathroom. Overall, the room is fantastic, they did a wonderful job in remodeling the rooms. TIP - Call housekeeping if you would like your room clean right away. This alone separates this hotel to any other hotels we have stayed. Regarding the facilities of the hotel, the gym is adequate to what you would need in your daily workout. There is enough machines and free weights. Towels are provided. The pool is currently being remodeled, but I am sure it will be grand once completed. In conclusion, the Windsor Court Hotel truly deserve the Four Diamond award. It is the best hotel in New Orleans. There is no other hotel better than the Windsor Court Hotel. We will surely come back to the Windsor Court Hotel in our next trip in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “None better in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: KenFLevin
Reviews.Content: We are tough critics, travel a great deal, not used to having hotel stays that are across the board exceptional. We stay in New Orleans frequently, trying this place or that, and keep going back to the Windsor Court. After our last stay we will be there again next time. Extremely attentive and knowledgeable staff. Excellent kitchen. The property and location have always been first rate; the renovation has maintained the old school tone of the hotel while bringing it up date. Someone at the Windsor Court Hotel is a stickler for detail and has imparted that to his/her staff, and has a great eye for hires -- these people, and there are a lot of them, are officiously competent and yet unfailingly warm. A really wonderfully run property.

Reviews.Title: “Very Large Suites!”
Reviews.Author: HcKeith
Reviews.Content: The Windsor presents classic elegance! Although it is not in the French Quarter, it is very close and convenient to walk to just about anywhere. Additionally, the Windsor is perfect if you have any business at the Federal Courthouse as it is just a couple of short blocks away. The rooms were recently renovated and still have separate living rooms and large bathrooms. This hotel is very nice if you are in NOLA for any extended period of time. The bar area/lounge is somewhat formal and there are no TV's in the lounge or in any other common hotel areas so there is no where to gather with other guests to watch sports. Of course, the bar/lounge area usually has nice jazz or piano music. The flowers in the lobby are always spectacular! Currently, the business center and pool areas are both under renovation but the gym is still available for use. I've stayed here numerous times and will continue to do so; however, they did have a recent price increase after the renovations and the weekend rates are a little too steep!

Reviews.Title: “Great Updates at the Windsor Court”
Reviews.Author: JacksonTraveler59
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Windsor Court twice in the last month and the new updates to the rooms and public spaces are wonderful. The rooms are almost all complete with new carpet, curtains, fabrics and decor. Everything is fresh and has the gentility you expect at the Windsor Court. Le Salon now has cocktails and live entertainment in the evenings and is a delightful spot to relax after dinner. The Polo Lounge is "The Standard" for hotel lounges. If you have not been in a while or never stayed at the Windsor Court, I encourgage you to make it your next destination in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Keeps getting better and better”
Reviews.Author: cajungirl728
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay here often. We are only a short drive to New Orleans and we stay in the city at least 5 times a month. We used to always stay at the Windsor, then we started venturing out and trying other places...but guess what, We're back at the Windsor. They are remodeling and i've had the pleasure of staying in one of their remodeled rooms...and they are fabulous! They are in the process now of remodeling the pool area and I hear they will be getting a spa. The staff is always so friendly and helpful. I truly feel like i'm at home when i'm here...no point in venturing out for us anymore, we're staying here everytime now because the grass wasn't greener on the other side.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing tea”
Reviews.Author: dgbanderson1
Reviews.Content: Tea at Windsor Court Hotel used to be so special. Yesterday the sandwiches were scarce, stale and small. The tea was cold and weak. Service was mediocre at best and the furniture was literally falling apart. The entire place smelled of heavy scented air freshener which hung over the place like a cheap cloud. It is still quite expensive though. That has not changed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: bsballbabe
Reviews.Content: This must be how the other half lives! Only blocks away from the action, Windsor Court is a beautiful hotel. My suite was spacious, the turndown service was a nice touch and the staff helpful, friendly and courteous. The fitness center was better than most. I was there for a business conference and our company sponsored breakfast & lunch at The Grill offered some healthy alternatives (credit should be shared by our company's astute event staff) with some New Orleans favorites. The lounge appetizers were also tasty. There was some construction noise during our breakout sessions which the hotel staff addressed quickly when notified. Otherwise a fantastic stay!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Debra W
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay just steps away from the French Quarter but within walking distance, this wonderful service oriented hotel is for you. I would stay there again. Extremely spacious suites. There was only a little noise in the late morning from the renovation but this should be complete by now.

Reviews.Title: “Classy!”
Reviews.Author: Tool9031
Reviews.Content: This was my wife and I first stay at the Windsor and we hope it's not our last! We are frequent visitors to the New Orleans area and have always wanted to stay here but the price was always a bit out of reach. This past weekend it wasn't and we took advantage of it. Let's just say it lived up to its reputation. We felt like a part of royalty while staying here. Everyone from the hostess to the maids treat you as first class citizens. The rooms were HUGE! We had a junior suite and in that room was 6 separate rooms! Our room also had a balcony. Location was great for our weekend itinerary. You literally walk out to Harrahs. I gave value a 4 because it is not normally that cheap but based on the rate we paid I give it a 5. Valet was the normal $35 but they let us keep the car in the garage as long ss we wanted the next day no extra charge There was one downside I noticed. It might have just been the location of this particular room, like I said this was our first stay so I can't judge on any other suites, but the noise from the party patrons on the street was really noticeable from our bed. We were on the eleventh floor and I could hear entire conversations. Yes those conversations were being yelled at the top of their lungs just to clarify. But it just made it a little hard to stay asleep. Other than that it was a wonderful stay! Also regret not making afternoon tea at Le Salon. We arrived a little late due to road construction. The Grill Room had an amazing breakfast selection as well. A definite recommendation if it's in the budget.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but consider other hotels”
Reviews.Author: Jonesfab
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a recent stay overall but were disappointed with our "suite." Our room was described as a suite but in fact was a junior suite--a bedroom with king bed at one end and sofa at the other. Since we were traveling with children and wanted an adjoining room, we were unable to find a substitute. We called several other hotels but it was a holiday weekend and we were stuck with our "suite." Worse of all, we were directly across from a bank of elevators that ring loudly every time the door opens and closes. We had to order a large fan for the room to drown out the elevator noise. We stayed on the club level and enjoyed great breakfasts, to include omelets made to order. The appetizers at happy hour were fantastic--all with a stunning view of the Mississippi River. The club level lounge includes many floors resulting in crowds at breakfast and happy hour. After a cold reception, the rest of the staff were extremely nice. Maid service is frustrating. Our room was not serviced until 4 pm on the first day and then attempted turn-down service at 9 pm. Both mornings she ignored our "do not disturb" sign and newspaper hanging on the door and rang the doorbell at 8 am. Impressive lobby with great concierge service. Overall--we had a nice stay but will select another hotel on our return.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MiMi1026
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Windsor Court in New Orleans. It was our first time at the hotel, and we were extremely impressed with the hotel. The hotel is undergoing a renovation floor by floor, but there was no noise from construction. Our room was a suite with a large living room and bedroom. The bathroom had a separate dressing table plus a large bathroom. Everything about this room and hotel speaks of first-class. Also, the Windsor is only steps from Canal Place--a great shopping centre anchored by Saks.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel for a perfect holiday”
Reviews.Author: VaDigby
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Court in New Orleans is one of those hotels that each time you depart, you wish you could have stayed longer. We have been staying at the Windsor Court once a year for the past four years. Over Christmas 2011 we again revisited the hotel, staying in a one bedroom suite on the Club Level. The suite, a river view which we have stayed in on prior visits, has been totaly refurbished since our visit in 2010, with fresh paint, new carpeting, new furniture and new beds. Our only complaint was a rather ratty bath mat by one of the sinks, something houskeeping should have replaced. Overall, the hotel service is truly top drawer from the time you pull up in the courtyard and you are greeted like an old friend and your luggage is quickly dispatched; to when you are quickly checked-in by a welcoming staff. The Concierge staff is particularly helpful and Travis, the concierge who has helped us many times, is a true asset to the hotel. The hotel amenities are many and varied and the Club Level provides a wonderful breakfast in the Club Lounge, plus snacks in the afternoon and free cocktails, wine or beer with heavy hors d'oeuvres to pick on in the early evening. Dinner in the Grill Room is something everyone should experience once. In a city known for its excellent dining opportunities, the Grill Room stacks up with the best of them. The total experience of staying at the Windsor Court is as close to perfect as a hotel came make it.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: vwporsche1996
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New Orleans. We decided to stay here because of it's elegance and the location. Let me tell you, this was an awesome hotel. We were lucky enough to be on one of the higher renovated floors with a view of the Mississippi river. The room was spotless and elegant, complete with living room, sleeping area, and entry area. Everyone at the hotel, especially the concierge and bell-hop people were extremely nice. Maids cleaned the rooms every day (And turn down service, complete with pralines!) We did NOT here any construction going on while we were here as it is currently on floors 4 and 3. While the pool is being constructed on as of this review, it looks very big (Especially compared to the W next door). All in all, I totally recommend this hotel, you will not be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Town, in my opinion.”
Reviews.Author: TravelLarry
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times, most recently last weekend. The club floor lounge has been impressively renovated. The club level suite was also very nicely redone. They finally got rid of those TV's that rise up from a cabinet at the foot of the bed and have nice flat panels on the walls. The suite is HUGE. Having stayed in Jr. Suites in the past, I think I can safely say that all of the rooms here are bigger than you might find elsewhere. The thing I like about this place it that they know who they are. They don't try to be the George IV in Paris, but they do try to be the best in New Orleans. And it works. The location is ideal. Walking distance to French Quarter, etc. Near (but thankfully not on) busy Canal Street. Walking distance to Convention Center, Warehouse District, etc, and certainly easy enough to get anywhere in town by car, cab, etc. The bathrooms are spacious, but not perfect. I would prefer glass doors on the shower instead of a curtain. Extremely comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, surprising stumbles in service. Beautiful hotel, pricey.”
Reviews.Author: ShadyBusiness
Reviews.Content: I think the management would like to give excellent service but at every turn it seems the staff stumbled. Housekeeping failed to answer the phone on multiple occasions, turn down service and other request were asked for and never received...then there were little things that were so out of place like the size of the glass you would drink water from...nice looking and real glass but incredibly small. The Windsor Court mouthwash is beyond aweful!!! How could anyone think this is what they should have for their guest. Even a glass of milk didn't tame the awfulness. Really, unbelievable. It's like what you would use on an episode of Punked.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant restoration”
Reviews.Author: luv2eatMaryland
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed 3 days over Christmas at the Windsor Court. The lobby was beautifully decorated, the service attentive, and the refurbished 15th floor elegant. Due to the holiday, there was no construction intrusion. The health facility is reasonably sized and well furnished. Family members enjoyed the nearby pool as the Windsor Court pool is being refurbished. Other family members enjoyed well made cocktails in the lobby bar. Appreciated the Molten Brown toiletries, complimentary slippers and pralines at turn-down. Our suite was generously sized and elegantly furnished in pale grey/blue and antique gold with white accents.

Reviews.Title: “Sunday Brunch”
Reviews.Author: Candice K
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at this hotel, but I had Sunday brunch there on Christmas Day. Oh, it is pricey but oh, it is so worth it! No scrambled eggs and link sausages in a buffet! Amazing courses of shrimp, ribs, duck, salads and desserts. I don't even know what I ate, but it was all fantastic. Accompanied by mimosas and dessert wines and lots of strong coffee. Not to mention, the jazz trio was wonderful. The one complaint: the duck wasn't great. But everything else melted in your mouth. Like I said, very pricey--especially on Christmas. But, sometimes you just have to treat yourself before you die. :)

Reviews.Title: “The absolute best hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: HappyRetiree023
Reviews.Content: From the moment we drove into the courtyard until our departure two days later, we received world class treatment. We were greeted at the front door, efficiently checked in at the front desk, and escorted to our suite by an obviously well-trained staff. We felt that everyone was interested in us and was engaged. Our suite was spacious and decorated in tones that assured us of a soothing visit. While there we took High Tea which is a must have experience - both for the tasty courses and the atmosphere. Later we enjoyed a visit to the Polo Bar - the bartender was very attentive and personable. Lastly, we ordered room service breakfast (delicious!) which was delivered by a very efficient and courteous waiter. When needed, our vehicle was ready for us. I appreciated the ease with which I made our reservations and the follow up correspondence. If we would have had any issues, I feel that the staff and management would have properly resolved them. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best!”
Reviews.Author: sf24
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Court was my favorite hotel in the world before the renovation, as courtesy and intangibles will always make or break a trip. The WC has a cocoon-like feel. If you drive, they park your car right in the hotel valet-only garage. If you need to go to your car for something, no problem. From year to year, the bellman remember me by name. I would run to the Windsor Court for any of the following ALONE: Bell service, front desk,restaurant wait staff, location, housekeeping staff, location, balconies over river, sunrise over river, sunset over river (Yes, both if you are in the right area) and location. If I haven't mentioned it, I prefer the WC location to the Quarter and like to walk everywhere I can. The year before, I went for a Federal Sentencing conference in the heat of summer. On the last night, I just decided to stay in, have a drink at the bar and dinner in the Grill Room. You see, the only problem I have encountered is that the Windsor Court is so comfortable/wonderful, I sometimes want to just stay in, but I love New Orleans and want to get out too! This hotel is elegant, but not stuffy. The Windsor Court and New Orleans are the perfect combination for an excuse to get away, especially from cities that have a non-stop flight to MSY! This is the one indulgence to which I treat myself, because it makes my favorite city even more special. When the Windsor Court is sold out, I like the Loews, but New Orleans is a great hotel city. If you are there for a Tulane weekend and will be driving around, the Hampton Inn on St. Charles (near Louisiana Ave.) down by Tulane is a wonderful choice. I still stop by there when in town to say hello to the friends I met during my son's college days.

Reviews.Title: “One of the top hotels in the United States”
Reviews.Author: tyoung9966
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Court Hotel New Orleans has just completed a complete renovation and the results are over-the-top. You will experience beautifully furnished and large suite rooms, world-class customer service and five star quality restaurants. Perfectly located near the river, casino and French Quarter - this is a quiet gem in the heart of New Orleans. I have no connection to this hotel other than a frequent stayer and promise you will be glad you decided to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: JPax
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Court rooms are all newly renovated. We had two rooms while visiting our son who is attending university. Both rooms were full suites. The suites were very spacious and extremely comfortable. I can say from experience that these are the nicest rooms in the city. We did experience problems with the hot water as mentioned by a previous guest. The front desk was rather dismissive. I with they had been more forthcoming about the problem. We hope this is due to the renovations which are supposed to be complete within a month. Running the water for long periods prior to showering did work. The service is excellent. I have stayed at the Ritz, Roosevelt, Loews, etc. None can match the service at the Windsor Court. Room service servers could use a bit more instruction--how to lay a table for starters, i.e. remove plastic, open the leaves, etc. Valet and bellman were fast and efficient. You are not left waiting for either. I hosted a breakfast for 25 local clients and catering did a great job with wonderful food. Christian Crocker is to be commended. I had a small problem that was very well handled by the GM, David Teich. His actions were appreciated and appropriate. He runs an excellent operation. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm, Modern Conveniences”
Reviews.Author: lsmbklyn
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Court is a beautiful grand hotel located in the heart of New Orleans. From the minute you enter the courtyard you feel like you've been transported from the rest of the busy world. It is perfectly located a block from Canal Street which is the central part of downtown. The fabulous French Quarter begins on the other side of Canal as does the Mississippi River and the streetcars that can take you to other parts of the city such as uptown and various cemetaries (a must see if you've never been). Harrah's Casino is directly across the streets, the acclaimed Mother's restaurant (think Diners, Drive-ins and Dives) is down the block perfect for breakfast and John Besh's Restaurant August is also across the street for a wonderful French dinner. The rooms are beautifully decorated and clean, the bathroom large with all the amenities you need, and the staff is there to make you comfortable and provide you with lots of information to enjoy this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “No Hot Water/No Water at times”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn D
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Windsor Court New Orleans, a 4 diamond hotel, was one of the worst stays we have ever had. Being at the hotel for a conference, we were here for six days. The first day was ok with a nice hot shower. Unfortunately, that was the last day of hot water. When we inquired about the lack of hot water, we were told to run the water for 15 minutes; that just resulted in more cold water. We were told for three days in a row that there wasnâ€™t really a problem, yet everyone else in the hotel knew that anything below the 14th floor had intermittently no hot water. On the fourth day we received a letter letting us know that they had a â€œunforeseen plumbing problemâ€� that would necessitate shutting off the water from 10 AM to 12 PM. Therefore they provided us with 2 complimentary bottles of water (16 oz each). We are not sure if we are to shower or flush the toilets with such a supply. When we have mentioned these problem to the staff; they just say we are sorry but donâ€™t do anything to address the situation. We had looked forward to staying at such a highly rated hotel, and now were wishing for the comforts of something much more simple. We are hoping that all the conference people and meeting planners that we tell this story to will listen to all us as we ask them not to use the Windsor Court as an approved hotel in New Orleans for future conferences.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, poor bath”
Reviews.Author: MarjD
Reviews.Content: Comments based on a five-day stay in a one-bedroom suite November 2011. (Most of the hotelâ€™s rooms are one-bedroom suites.) The good: â€¢ Hotel located on a quiet street one block from French Quarter. (Casino across street not intrusive.) Beautiful public spaces and nice view of Mississippi River from south-facing higher floors. â€¢ Suite is spacious and well organized. Bedroom has comfy bed, two dressers, desk, LCD TV, and adjoining large dressing area. Huge bathroom. Living room with LCD TV, sofa and dining table. Alcove with wet bar off entry. â€¢ Coordinated high-quality traditional furnishings in pale blue, cream, and light brown. â€¢ Twice daily efficient maid service. â€¢ Free WIFI in room (although a pokey 829 kbps download, 995 kbps upload) and plenty of accessible electric outlets. â€¢ Grill Room restaurant for breakfast and dinner: delicious, well-presented cuisine; professional and attentive service. The bad: â€¢ Low water volume (non-adjustable) and low maximum temperature in shower-in-tub. Non-ergonomic temperature-control lever is painfully difficult to operate even by those with strong hands. Poorly-designed drain plug leaks, making a bath impossible. (Drawing a bath at max temp for a half hour with the plug closed produced two inches of tepid water.) Conditions existed throughout five-day stay. Such drastic water economization seems odd, given the hotelâ€™s investment in other areas and the bathâ€™s marble floors, nice shower head, high quality towels, and Moulton Brown products. If you require a hot shower or bath with normal water pressure, choose a different hotel. â€¢ Other than check-in/-out, lobby staff rarely greet or even make eye contact with guests entering or leaving the building, even when not assisting other guests. Such courtesy wouldnâ€™t cost the hotel a dime, and is expected by those accustomed to the warm respect extended by the staff at luxury hotels. â€¢ Valet car service to the adjacent garage, costing a moderate $35/day, isnâ€™t reliable. On two occasions, after phoning the valet desk from our room and allowing 20 minutes, car was not produced, although staff were standing around. Both times, a second request had to be made in person, necessitating an additional 10 minute wait. â€¢ Pool area undergoing renovation and not available for guest use until early 2012. Was not notified at time of reservation. Fortunately, did not notice any associated construction noise, nor from ongoing street repairs on Tchoupitoulas St.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite New Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kristina M
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that I may be a bit biased because this hotel holds so many special memories for me. My first stay here was the weekend that I became engaged. My next stay was my honeymoon night. The strength of this hotel is its customer service. When the staff found out that it was my honeymoon night, they immediately upgraded me from regular suite to a suite on the club level and had champagne waiting for my husband and me. Another time that I stayed there, there was something covering one of the vents. A simple phone call inquiring about what it was was treated as a very serious matter and I was promptly moved to a much larger room and offered sincere apologies. The next strength of this hotel is the entertainment. I can't remember the singer's name who performs in the Polo Lounge on Friday and Saturday nights, but she is superb! Many nights I intended on going out into the city, and decided to enjoy the entertainment that was already at the hotel. She is excellent, as is the band that accompanies her. The only criticism that I have of the hotel is that it is in need of renovations, badly. However, since I understand that they are in the process of this, I'll return when they are finished. It's a charming, beautiful, slightly aging hotel that I recommend for its service, entertainment, and Polo Lounge.

Reviews.Title: “**WARNING** Stay away from floors around renovations”
Reviews.Author: Mike N
Reviews.Content: Room smelled of stale smoke and renovations till 12:30am in the morning on the room above mine. This has the makings of being a very nice hotel. The staff were friendly and the location is great. The room I was in was very large. I have traveled to many hotels over the years which range from a Holiday Inn to Villa d'Este in Italy. In all my time I have never experienced what this hotel is doing. They are trying to improve the hotel quality and I do applaud their attempt. However, they are also hedging their bets that guests will not complain too much to maximize the amount of work they can do in a day and still bring in as much revenue as possible. I just checked out today of room 405. When I originally checked in a few days ago I was never asked for any type of room or smoking preference. Apparently when you call to make reservations they warn you that they are doing some renovations on the "pool." This just happens to be on the floor they put me on which is or was a smoking floor. (I am not a smoker). I can deal with the pool renovations. However, what they strategically neglect to tell you is they are also renovating many other sections of this property. This includes the room directly above mine. I woke up just before 8am on the first day to what I can only described as a wrecking ball sound on the ceiling right above my bed. I thought I was having a nightmare and fully expected the ceiling to be cracked and caving in. I promptly got up, showered, and left the room and didn't think about it much more. However, I got back to my room around 11:30pm that night and couldn't believe they were drilling and sawing still right above me. I tried to ignore it but after about 20 minutes I couldn't take it anymore and contacted the front desk. The person that answered was nice and said that this should not be happening and told me they would take care of it and call me back. Well, everything finally stopped about 25 minutes later just before 12:30am and I never got a call back. In the morning it all started again around 8:15am. I tried to turn on the TV to focus on some other noise but the remote power did not function and so I gave up (my room has older TVs so I assume it had not been renovated yet). I showered, packed up everything, and checked out. I was asked how my stay was and at that point I brought up my experience. The front desk attendee was nice and apologetic but couldn't explain to me why they would occupy a room right below the construction. I got the impression (although it was never directly confirmed) that many others have complained about the same thing. Needless to say this is not a common practice at a 2 star hotel nor should it be one at one trying to be at the rating the Windsor is going for. I doubt I will ever stay here again based on how my situation was handled and the fact that they knew exactly what they were doing when they placed me in this construction zone. I know others have commented on this before and I read another review that indicated a RItz Carlton would typically give at least two floors buffer between renovations and rooms that are occupied. Last night I would have been happy with just one floor buffer. Windsor Court Hotel you hedged your bets with me and lost. I hope that others can read this warning and avoid my nightmare. Apparently this same thing happened to at least another one of the guests in our party earlier in the week. They complained the next day and were moved to a higher floor. Since I know the hotel manager will probably read this my last point is this. Just because someone doesn't complain does not mean they did not have a poor experience. You might be increasing your revenue through this practice but reviews like this and guests who have a poor experience will kill your reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: Theonlyduck
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel only steps away from the French Quarter. This hotel is pure luxury. Newly redecorated rooms in lovely soothing colours, beautifully appointed, comfy beds. The staff was friendly, quick and extremely helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone I know. I look forward to my next stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Windsor Court is back!”
Reviews.Author: Texas Family Travelers
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Court is just finishing up multi-million dollar renovations, and it's looking wonderful! Our room was freshly renovated, with quality materials and beautiful colors. We have loved visiting this hotel over the years, but noticed that our room looked a bit "tired" when we were there in the spring. Hotel management assured me at that time that they were launching a major renovation. When we returned to the hotel recently to attend a wedding, we had high hopes, and were so pleased with the improvements. The hotel staff is still nice and efficient, and very welcoming. Most of the rooms are suites, but we had just a regular guest room, which was perfect for our needs with its new flat screen t v and comfortable sofa and chair. The Windsor Court is in an enviable location, just across Canal St. from the French Quarter, close to high-end shops and the casino (the casino is not a draw for me but, hey, if it floats your boat, it's right across the street from the hotel, so you can't get any more convenient than that!). The hotel is close to some great restaurants (Mother's for breakfast, Bon Ton for lunch or dinner, John Besh's August for an upscale dinner) and the impressive World War II museum, too. The hotel bar is lovely, and serves an array of interesting cocktails. If you are planning a trip to New Orleans and you want comfort, luxury, a friendly welcome, and a great location, the Windsor Court is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel feel at large venue”
Reviews.Author: SFGreg
Reviews.Content: Very upscale, boutique hotel well situated between Convention Center and French Quarter. Being re-modeled, so ask for one of the updated rooms. Suites are spacious and well-appointed with flat screen tvs, wireless, wet bar. No bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant oasis in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: pete827
Reviews.Content: Instead of the nearby conference hotels, we stayed in this wonderful boutique hotel. What a lucky choice!! You still have the conveniences of Canal St and it's an easy 10 min walk into the French Quarter. We had booked a double room and were upgraded into a suite, with large living room, small kitchen, dressing room with a vanity and a balcony overlooking the river in the distance. All of the staff members were so helpful; the doormen were friendly without making you feel you needed to tip them every minute. The concierge was very accomodating about offering directions, suggestions for breakfast off-site (the Ruby Slipper right around the corner) and he took care of Fed Ex-ing a package for me on Monday after I left NOLA. The lounge was filled with huge, comfortable couches and the server was very attentive and spot-on with wine recommendations. The lobby is huge and decorated with azaleas so perfect it was hard to believe they were real. WIndsor Court is not any more expenisve that many of the big-name chain hotels. Abandon them and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Make this your home in NOLA!”
Reviews.Author: bettibiz
Reviews.Content: Put it on your bucket list. Seriously, this is easily the best hotel experience Iâ€™ve ever had. We stayed in a junior suite (renovated), which had a wet bar, sitting room with balcony overlooking the river, large bedroom with another huge window on the river, separate dressing area with vanity, and marble bathroom with a large shower and separate WC. Other amenities included two flat-screens with HDTV, and a Keurig coffeemaker. The room was stunning. Expensive? Itâ€™s on par with other quality hotels in NOLA, but there are three differences that were important to me. First, the customer service is above and beyond. The concierge had booked a service for me, and there were a couple of glitches that were not in any way the fault of the hotel. However, the concierge not only comped the service, he sent a complimentary cheese and fruit tray to the room as an additional apology. (Thanks again, Adam!) Room service was prompt, the food arrived hot and delicious. Anything I requested (bucket of ice, extra creamer for my coffee, etc.) arrived with 10 minutes. These folks are serious about service. Not only is there evening turndown (complete with either chocolate or pralines â€“ yum!), but they fill your ice bucket and set out your slippers (provided compliments of the hotel) and your robe. The room was spotless when we arrived and housekeeping does a pretty good job. They do miss a spot here and there â€“ I think our wet bar area went several days without being wiped down â€“ but the bathroom is kept spotless and the towels replaced daily. The toiletries are top-notch spa quality, and while we did have to request refills when we ran out (as opposed to having housekeeping monitoring for that), when we did request they were replaced immediately and in double quantity. The second thing that was important to me was proximity to the French Quarter. We stayed over Halloween, and while I wanted to be close enough to have fun, I also wanted to be far enough to have a retreat when I needed it. The Windsor Court is ideal in both respects. Just a block or so off Canal, itâ€™s an easy walk to anywhere in the Quarter, and the nights were blessedly quiet (and that includes no noise from the air conditioner, which I used every night â€“ I like my room cold). You will hear the whistle from the ships on the river and the occasional traffic noise, but I donâ€™t think youâ€™ll find a much quieter street than Gravier (thatâ€™s this close to the Quarter). Noise from other guests was minimal as well. As for the construction, yes, itâ€™s happening. But I worked in my hotel room every day until noon, and never once did the construction noise interfere with my concentration. Let me reiterate â€“ I stayed on the 16th floor, and theyâ€™re working on floors 12-15 and on the pool, which was outside my balcony and down maybe 12 floors. Sure, I could hear it, but itâ€™s just not that much noise (and anyway, who besides me is going to actually stay INSIDE their hotel rooms in the Big Easy?). I was up between 6 and 7 each morning and donâ€™t remember them starting before 9 or so. Finally, my favorite difference about the hotel wasnâ€™t really one I was actively looking for; the folks here are not just interested in serving you, theyâ€™re interested in YOU. When I walk through the lobby, I say hi to Antonio the doorman/bellman, Adam at the concierge desk, Kyle behind the check-in deskâ€¦and they know my name.
