They know me well enough to laugh together, to ask how this or that restaurant or activity worked out. Sure, not everyone behind the desks is gregarious and vivaciousâ€¦but theyâ€™re all friendly and polite and ready to help. And Iâ€™m not a business executive or a high roller, just a high school teacher from Washington State. They care about their customers here, and you just donâ€™t find that much anymore. I canâ€™t recommend this hotel highly enough. Try it and see. I tried three times to post pictures but TA kept hanging up so I'm giving up. If you want to see photos, contact me through TA and I'll be happy to email them.

Reviews.Title: “a first class experience!”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence C
Reviews.Content: Made the grade on every level. Superb room, excellent service, delicious food. Only problem-wifi in my room was spotty

Reviews.Title: “The Best of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: IRONMANTENNESSEE
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in October 2011. We had a 1 bderoom suite which had been recently remodeled. We requseted a remodeled room since some of the rooms have not been remodeled yet. They are in the process of updating all the rooms. If you make a reservation be sure to request a remodeled room. This is a first class hotel. It is not cheap but you get what you pay for and and it is worth every penny. One note,while in New Orleans we had a cab driver named Guru. He was super and took us to dinner every night. Safe and slow driver,clean cab,very nice. The doorman at the hotel knows him and can hook you up with him during your stay. If you have to get a cab request Guru. The room service was fast and the food very good. Great bar upstairs-quiet with refined service. Hotel is very clean. The only thing I did not like was the parking charge of $30+ per day. With the price of the rooms I felt the parking charge was a little out of line.

Reviews.Title: “Windsor Court is tops!”
Reviews.Author: JacksonTraveler59
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Windsor Court Hotel when in New Orleans. The Polo Lounge is the best lounge in the city. Many of the staff members have been there for many years and are on a first-name basis. It is truly like home away from home. Service is tops at the Windsor Court. I heartily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay. Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: mikedespo
Reviews.Content: Not my first time at the Windsor Court Hotel, but have not stayed at the Windsor Court in a while (having stayed elsewhere since my last stay). I can't imagine why (except for price). Yes, the Windsor Court is expensive; however, it's well worth its price when you want to feel completely relaxed. My room was incredible. Separate living area, small balcony, large bedroom, and big bathroom with separate room for sink and another separate changing room with another sink. The club room (if you take the added splurge) is again well worth the expense. It offers a great series of sitting areas (inside and outside) overlooking the city and the Mississippi River. Plenty of snacks and drinks. On the weekend, eggs were made to order. All included in the price of the access to the club floor. Room service was delicious (having ordered a soup and Caesar salad) and prompt. Drinks in the Polo Lounge every night was elegant. The bar staff was amazing. The next night the staff immediately remembered all of our drinks which is the sign of an attentive and professional staff. People are a bit dressed up (not casual, no shorts and t shirts). The fitness center is a bit small and lacking the necessary or expanded equipment. Overall decent, but considering the hotel is first rate with everything it does ... it could be better (what can I say they set the bar high for themselves). The floral arrangements are stunning (this coming from a guy whose family owns and operates a garden center). Staff is all accommodating and friendly. Our first night had the hotel not have water available from 11:00 PM to 5:00 AM. I think the 11:00 PM shut off was a bit too early. I know these things can't be helped sometimes but it's inconvenient and surprising. Considering the price (which wasn't discounted off rooms) the hotel should offer a discount without having to be asked (which we did and received). Some light construction started at 8:00 AM! That's a bit crazy considering New Orleans is NOT an early city. Everyone is generally passed out at that time and nursing a hang over later. Not sure how the hotel could justify banging on the walls at that hour. It wasn't full on constant construction but it still was something that jolted me the first morning. Room service is the only thing which I really take issue. The rooms are immaculate; however, the staff will knock early in the morning to try and make your room (if no do not disturb sign is posted and then came back to some of our rooms but not others). With turn down service I turned away the housekeeper around 5:00 and she never came back. Same or the next day. I didn't think much of it but then another in my party said when the housekeeper walked in their room to do turn down service, they were told if they didn't get it done at that moment they were going home and not coming back to do it later. Understood but you're paying over 400.00 a night and I can't believe they just don't say ... if you still want turn down service call housekeeping later. I thought the comment was a bit out of line with how the hotel operates but the room service seems to be spotty. We waited until after 4:30 PM on a Wed because housekeeping was not able to clean the rooms (we tried to check in at 2:00 PM). So there does seem to be issues with housekeeping but when they clean ... they clean and do a great job. It seems to be a drawback but let me state the hotel is fantastic. It just stands out because the hotel is such a class act and stellar place. I'm going back most likely this winter with my folks coming along, too.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Elegance New World Ambience”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGirl500
Reviews.Content: Four day trip to NOLA with five gilfriends. We took three full suites. The hotel lobby is gorgeous and the staff are truly helpful and attentive. I don't think I ever opened a door for myself. The full suites had a separate living room, bar area, balcony overlooking the city or the Mississippi, the bedrooms were spacious with comfortable queen beds, marble bathrooms with separate makeup and dressing room. We had cocktails in the bar each evening and it's dark and luxurious and the drinks were generous. The beds were heaven, truly one of the most comfortable I've slept in, including my own! There are renovations going on right now so the pool area was closed although they'll send you to the W or Loew's. The noise level of the construction didn't bother me but it irritated my friends in the other two rooms. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities, but recommend staying after renovation”
Reviews.Author: shamrockcb
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Windsor Court on business and it was fairly close to the convention center, and directly across the street from the casino. The rooms were a little bit outdated, but very spacious and clean. My hair dryer broke on the 2nd day, and the tv remote in the living room didn't work, but minor inconveniences that were easily overlooked. The staff were all friendly and welcoming, and we ate a nice breakfast in the restaurant on the premises. The only reason I gave this hotel a 3 rating is because of the annoying jackhammers and ongoing power tools throughout my stay. The first day I experienced it at noon, and again at 3pm- so I chose to relax by the pool instead (which was closed halfway during my stay for renovations). The most disappointing day of my stay was the last day where I was actually able to sleep in, but was awoken by hammers right above my head at 8:30 in the am. I understand the hotel is under renovation, but I emailed the concierge ahead of time who explained that the only inconvenience would be the closed pool. I also called the front desk to complain about the hammers and they said they would try to do something about it, but it went on for at least another hour so needless to say, one cannot sleep through such a disturbance. I would not recommend staying at this hotel for a leisure vacation if you want to be interrupted by power tools during your stay. I'm sure everything will go back to normal after the renovations, but I don't think the Windsor Court should knowingly book rooms near the renovation process. One other note is that when I was reviewing my bill, there was a $200 bar bill from the Polo Lounge. Seeing as though I never stepped foot in the place, the staff researched the issue and it turned out to be an error. I completely understand that mistakes happen, but just a reminder to all of those traveling to review your final bill carefully to make sure all of the charges are accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: Swmag
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend and were quite pleased with the hotel, it's staff and the service they provided. We had a refurbished suite so some of the comments about dated or worn rooms didn't apply. Will comment though that the refurb seemed inconsistent in some of it's execution. We did encounter some issues in service, however, where they occurred staff was unfailingly polite as they took our input and corrected them.Staff was helpful in helping us plan our activities and recommendations seemed thorough and complete. Pastries are to die for! Hotel Manager provided free champagne and card to help us celebrate (reason for trip) which was greatly appreciated. Afternoon tea service was very good (pastries again!). Grill Room dinner was good but not great. Would definately stay again

Reviews.Title: “Southern charm and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: butravel
Reviews.Content: I passed by the striking motor court several years ago on my first visit to New Orleans and stopped in for breakfast. I knew this would be my choice on my next visit, which happened to be last week. My recent visit was in a refurbished room which was very comfortable and full of designer appointments. My wife and I thought their food was special for breakfast, afternoon tea, sunday jazz brunch, and dinner one night. If you are there in September through November, take in the wednesday night harvest event at a close by park. Irma Thomas was on stage that night. Thank goodness for Itunes. We ate at Commander's Palace, having been familiar with their Las Vegas location before it closed. The proprietor and her restaurant oozed that special something that New Orleans is famous for. Of course a generous pour of bourbon enhanced our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Should have stayed next door.”
Reviews.Author: Mvl30
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few months back and I decided to share about my stay. At first sight the room looked very nice. Until I walked into the kitchen, which was very dirty. The coffee seemed to be used when we got it because there was a used napkin and a used mug. No cream or sugar. (I had to call refill service 3 times before they came.) I walked into the bathroom and there was someone else's urine in the toilet! Talk about gross! Later on I had some leftovers that I wanted to reheat and they're was no microwave! So I had to go downstairs to get a plate because I didn't feel like waiting 3 hours for one. I heated it up in the oven and I had to use a towel to get it out because there were no oven mitts.(I also burnt myself.) The rooms look like they haven't been updated since the 1980's! The windows were filthy too! This hotel just isnt what it used to be! Honestly. Ive had better stays in motel 6's for a 4th of the cost! If you want a hotel in this location, I would recommend the W next door!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: OutkastBCN
Reviews.Content: Windsor Court is a good choice for a stay in The Big Easy. The city is amazing and the hotel is extremely well located, in a quiet area close to the Casino and Riverwalk. French Quarter is a 10 minute walk and you are close to Canal Street where you can easily catch the tram to Garden District or Magazine Avenue shops. The hotel has quite an standard faÃ§ade but the interiors are truly boutique, elegantly decorated with and english twist. We were staying in a Club Guest Room. The Club floors have been recently refurbished and look great. You can acces the Club Lounge. The views over the Mississipi are amazing, sunrise over the river a real treat. Service is very good. All staff members were friendly and effective. We did not try it but The Grill offer fine food options. There is an outdoor pool in the second floor though is quite small and only does get sun for a couple of hours.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: pmul35805
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Windsor Court last weekend to look at colleges and celebrate my daughters 18th birthday. I carefully checked the reviews from trip advisor and when making my reservation was specific about wanting a room that had been refurbished. Wow, it was gorgeous. The concierge was very helpful in having flowers sent to my daughter and the evening of our arrival we received two beautiful cards from the GM and our concierge. They also sent a chocolate plate with "Happy Birthday" scrolled in chocolate. What a lovely surprise for my daughter. The staff couldn't have been nicer and we loved the jazz in the Polo Lounge. Can't wait for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Threadbare and irritating”
Reviews.Author: Freak77
Reviews.Content: Hard to know where to begin. Will start with the good. Nice building, nice bar and dining area. Room was decorated in the 70's. I would have liked this if it was well maintained but it wasn't. Carpets threadbare, sticky light switches, black stains on the bathroom ceiling. Yuck. The killer was that the internet went out the evening I was staying there and when I called to ask I was transferred to an IT tech based in....NEW HAMPSHIRE!!!!!. He tried to be helpful but couldn't diagnose the problem. I was traveling on business and needed very much to catch up on my work from the room. No go. The next morning the problem was not rectified, my calls to the front desk were responded to not with rudeness but with disinterest. Add to the the excitement of being awakened by the sound of jackhammer from the room above (due to renovations) and you have the perfect mix. I was supposed to stay 3 days, left after 1 and moved to the Ritz Carlton, which is clean, has working internet and has a 2 vacant floor policy between the rooms they are renovating and the ones that are occupied. Thats more like! I've noticed that the manager of the Windsor responds to these reviews. Don't bother with mine. I'm never coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Run Down and High Priced”
Reviews.Author: fairtravels
Reviews.Content: Sadly, The Windsor Court has seen better days. We had fond memories of staying there when it was considered New Orleans' finest hotel. Recently, we book a room to celebrate a special occasion and found a highly-priced, run-down property. We had to look at five suites before we found one where the upholstered furniture was not stained or ripped, the carpet was not soiled, the refrigerator wasn't dripping water, or the balcony wasn't littered with cigarette butts. We settled, only because the bellman was friendly and apologetic but at $300 - $350 a night we should have turned around and walked out. My husband sent a letter to the management when we returned home, but it has been a month and we've never received an answer. With New Orleans coming back from Katrina, there are plenty of other places to spend your money. Don't leave it at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and sophisticated hotel right near the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: NYCjetsetter-girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Windsor Court for 3 nights during our first, but definitely not last visit to New Orleans. We were originally booked in a standard room but were upgraded to a renovated Club Level room (Thank you Windsor Court Management!!!) due to ongoing renovations in the hotel. I was very nervous about the room we would have gotten based on all the reviews saying how worn the older rooms were but our room was so brand spankinâ€™ new that it still had that new carpet smell. The room was not huge but tastefully decorated with very comfortable beds and a large marble bathroom. I do hope once the rest of the hotel is upgraded, the prices wonâ€™t go up because although our room was lovely, I absolutely do not think it is worth the amount they are charging. In addition, I found out after my stay that there is complementary breakfast and hors dâ€™oeuvres for club level guests, which I would have taken advantage of had known about it, but since I wasnâ€™t actually paying for club level Iâ€™m not that upset about it. Another key factor is the terrific location of this property. It is only a 5 minute stroll to the French quarter in a clean, quiet spot. It was so wonderful to be able to enjoy peace and quiet at night after leaving the non-stop party of Bourbon Street. Some of the things I loved: 1) Amazing staff: Especially the concierge (Adam) - very helpful and patient. The doormen and bell-hops were also great, getting you a taxi in the blink of an eye and welcoming you back every time you walked through the doors. 2) Renovated room was great â€“ I hope this hotel finishes their renovations quickly so others can enjoy it (and stop writing negative things about the older rooms to bring down the rating). 3) Marble shower was an awesome touch â€“ There was no guard or delineation between shower and the rest of the bathroom so water splashed on the floor but I liked it anyway. 4) Lovely bar / lounge on the 2nd floor with a grand atmosphere and live jazz music! 5) Nice relaxing pool area (Just wish there were drinks served at the pool â€“ though you can get one at the bar and bring it up â€“ A couple saw me grab a nice glass of wine to enjoy while reading by the pool and went to do the same). 6) Absolutely delicious fresh made New Orleans Pralines left on your bedside table during turndown service in the evening. I think my review would have been very different if I didnâ€™t get to stay in the renovated room, but Iâ€™m sure the upgrades will be done soon and then staying here will be great. I did hear some banging but it wasnâ€™t a major problem and will obviously not be going on forever. The only surprise we encountered was that we could hear the people next door talking so the walls must be fairly thin, but again, not a deal-breaker. If a 4.5 star rating existed, I would have used it for this hotel, deducting half a point for not being told about the club level benefits, the high price for the renovated rooms and thin walls, but Iâ€™m going to round up to a 5 star rating based on my overall enjoyable stay, great staff and nice, clean room. P.S. While staying in New Orleans, you MUST go to Commanderâ€™s Palace and take a swamp tour!

Reviews.Title: “A really great experience”
Reviews.Author: Mockahoey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at Christmastime and liked it so much we went back for French Quarter Festival. Tony Sear, the Club Floor concierge was the best. He knows everything about New Orleans and can get you into every restaurant. We had the best oysters ever in the hotel restaurant. Great drinks too.

Reviews.Title: “A fallen 5 star property”
Reviews.Author: Robbinwood
Reviews.Content: Windsor Court has always been known as a premier property in New Orleans. We had a girls weekend there September 8 & 9. We booked a suite and were thrilled to be staying at such a highly rated hotel. As soon as we stepped into the lobby we knew we were in for a "blast from the past" stay. The lobby was dark and full (and I mean full) of pink potted flowers. Our suite, while large, was sooo dated...old worn out carpet, old worn out sofas, bath fixtures that were probably 25 years old, dripping faucet, painted doors in bathroom had faded to old yellow, no slim line TV in living room, an old worn out kitchen with nothing in it but a hard to use coffee pot and and old musty full size regrigerator! Front desk insisted they had nothing better to offer unless we wanted to pay additional $150 per night for renovated club level room. Go somewhere else until Windsor Court gets these old rooms renovated. I feel sure they are working on the rooms as the jackhammer started at 8am Friday morning....thank you Windsor Court for the 8am wakeup call!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: charhar2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Windsor Court several times and have always loved it. One of the fantastic things about this hotel is the concierge lounge, located on the 23rd floor. The lounge was closed for renovations earlier in the summer, but according to the website was open for my stay. Only it wasn't. When we arrived, we were given a letter informing us of the hours of operation of the Concierge lounge, including breakfast. But when we got there for breakfast, it was locked. I called the manager and he said that there was an "internal problem". Yes, the Windsor paid for us to eat at their restuarant, but the views from the 2nd floor over the entranceway aren't the same as from the 23rd floor overlooking the river. Which means I didn't benefit from a concierge level room. I complained and the manager discounted my room (a junior suite) to the same rate as a non-concierge level room. But there were other issues. A friend called and was transferred 3 times before she got to my room. The coffee maker in the room didn't work (and when I was reported it, the person on the front desk didn't seem to care). The iron was beat up and snagged the dress I was ironing and it leaked water profusely. (Yes, it was changed after 3 phone calls). This is a wonderful hotel but the service this time was awful, not at all my experience in the past. What is happening to one of my favorite hotels?? Not sure I would stay here next time I'm in town. I'll save the money to buy another hat from Fleur de Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The Club level is the best!”
Reviews.Author: kristi r
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend for a bachelorette party. We stayed in Club level suites. I have to say that the new rooms are so awesome. The decor is fabulous. The club level lounge with its breakfast, appetizers, and drinks makes the Ritz's club level look like they don't know what they are doing. We had one minor problem with our reservation, but the manager of the hotel took care of it immediately. This is what great hotel service is all about. I will never stay anywhere else when I come to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Blast from the past! 1975 decor”
Reviews.Author: jmg9951
Reviews.Content: I have been a travel agent for 18 years....travel frequently. Spent two nights at Windsor Court on Sept. 8-10, 2011. THE GOOD: Courteous staff. Suite with large room with seperate living room, two dressing areas, good location. THE BAD: Totally outdated hotel....from lobby with pink azaleas EVERYWHERE...looked like a scene from 1975. At check in I requested a renovated room but was told that the hotel was almost fully booked.....only saw one person on my floor during my stay and only encountered two or three people in lobby. Fully booked? Where were these guests??? The room had old stained, worn out carpet, wallpaper and bedding from many, many years ago. Bath had leaky tub faucet, peeling ceiling above tub. Still had old style TV's, etc. I could go on but I think this gives you an idea. If you are a "luxury type" traveler I would suggest that you only stay here if you are sure you will have a renovated room. Sad to see a lovely hotel go down the tubes. JMG

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel and Location to French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: twins1_11
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel!! Greeted by the largest bouquet of pink roses, the staff were friendly and charming. The hotel is walking distance, in the august heat, to the French Quarter and the Marketplace. Get a 1 bedroom and its palatial with 3 sinks (perfect for 4 people). When I do return to New Orleans, I'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Old World Charm steeped in Luxury”
Reviews.Author: LouisianaGirl1965
Reviews.Content: My family visited New Orleans for a Saints Game that my daughter was performing in with the Saintsations. A friend recommended Windsor Court and we enjoyed the charm of New Orleans and the amenities that only the Windsor offers in New Orleans. From the old world bricked courtyard to the spacious luxury of the Penthouse, our weekend was one to remember. We will never stay anywhere else when visiting New Orleans. We were one step from all the great eateries and shops that we've visited for years and never needed our car until we departed. The penthouse offers spectacular views as well as privacy. Our children's rooms were on one side the the penthouse and my husband and I enjoyed the quietness on the opposite side.....both with wonderful views. The mini kitchen served us well for snacks and leftovers for midnite snacks. In fact.....I think I will check into some Saints tickets really soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: Uptown3168
Reviews.Content: Once you stay at the Windsor Court Hotel you won't stay anywhere else. The staff is so friendly and accomodating. The rooms are very comfortable. The atmosphere is awesome. This is the only hotel we stay at when we visit New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “The new club suite rooms are TERRIFIC!”
Reviews.Author: TBSmall
Reviews.Content: The new club suite rooms, as of two weeks ago, have been renovated- and they have done a wonderful job. The rooms are fresh and clean with updated colors and furnishing- like the old days of the Windsor Court...not the tired hotel it had become over the past several years. The dressing and bathroom areas are clean and spacious...tow sinks and a separate area for the toilet and shower, you can close a door for privacy!! Nice lighting and nice fixtures. The rest of the hotel is also undergoing renovations, and i look forward to staying here in the future. It is nice to see the owners finally putting money back into this property- it was once a very elegant hotel- hopefully it will again be soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: ncav4
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel in a great location. We stayed the week prior to Mardi Gras, and I was a little disappointed with the soundproofing ability of the windows. But really, New Orleans is LOUD. We stayed in a gorgeous suite with a wonderful city view. It was larger than my first apartment and very quiet when the parades were not running. We had a completely separate living room with office area, dining table, sofas, and tv. Very home-like. Admittedly, New Orleans is not my cup of cafe du monde, but the hotel was beautiful. Room service was great, housekeeping was prompt. Loved the location; just on the edge of the business district, but easy walking to all the sights, sounds, and smells (yikes) of Bourbon Street. There is no spa, but the concierge can set up an in room visit from a massage therapist. I did not elect, however, to take advantage of this service (a little creepy to an old fashioned girl). Had TONS of trouble with our room keys even though we followed all the room key 'rules'. Perhaps just a bad keying system? The front desk was always very speedy to make a new key card, but it was a little annoying. Overally, a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and delicious food.”
Reviews.Author: denise b
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at Windsor Court and we were very pleased. Can't wait to see the renovations. Very large suite with vanity. A big plus for us. Afternoon te exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and even better service!”
Reviews.Author: zhidee27
Reviews.Content: Windsor Court knows how to make a trip very special! Went there this past weekend on a girls trip. The location was perfectly located where walking was the only method of transportation needed and the Conceirge (specifically Adam and Travis) made it even better knowing where to send us, making reservations, and always remember who we were no matter what time of day we walked through the lobby! Then there was the room service...I recommend the bacon for breakfast, a definate must. The pool was quiet, peaceful, and clean. The workout facility was loaded with everything you need. The housekeeping staff was friendly and the desk staff very helpful. This hotel played a very special part in making this trip the best and most memorable girls trip ever.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amy V
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Windsor Court for a girls weekend trip to New Orleans, and this hotel was the best part of our stay. Every employee we came in contact with was so warm and welcoming. They knew our names and treated us like royalty. The hotel itself is amazing. So old world charming and beautiful with wonderful artwork everywhere you look. The tea service in the lobby is so lovely and the lounge is relaxed with great service. The concierge service, Adam and Travis were AMAZING! They were able to help us with suggestions for places to go and directions. They took such good care of us, we didn't want to leave. The room was spacious and very well appointed. The housekeeping and turn down service was perfect. We had a great view from our room. We met Sarah the Sommelier, and her knowledge and enthusiasm for all things wine was absolutely infectious. It is a fantastic hotel with a staff that really knows how to take care of people and make everyone feel welcomed. They really understand the word hospitality. If you ever get the chance, you want to stay here in New Orleans!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the classic tradition”
Reviews.Author: Allan G
Reviews.Content: We were booked by our travel agent and had a Virtuoso package. At check in, we were upgraded for free to a suite which was larger than some apartments! The bed was so comfortable we did not want to get out of it in the mornings, and the room was so quiet, even though it was next to the elevators. The food and staff at the Grill room were absolutely perfect, both for breakfast and dinner. All in all, a great hotel staffed by great people in a great city!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: JFrancesShreveport
Reviews.Content: Large well appointed rooms which are basically suites. Our 13 year old son had a roll away at no charge . Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Frank45607
Reviews.Content: One of the finest hotels at which I've ever stayed; we go to New Orleans often, and Windsor Court is a major reason why. The service is without compare.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: TexasWD
Reviews.Content: New Orleans, LA is the most unique city in the US. I have never lived in New Orleans or the state of LA but I have been going to NO for 40 years for business and pleasure. I saw the building of the Windsor Court Hotel about 25 years ago. I have lost count but I have stayed there more than 5 times, less than 10 times. When my wife and I arrived last Monday, we had a brand new room with HDTV, new carpet, bathroom AND jackhammers. They are redoing the upper 2 floors. Before we unpacked we asked to move to another room and we were moved down 5 floors to the other end of the hotel. That room had an old TV, carpet and the bathroom had not been redone. The lobby is still the most beautiful you can imagine. The service is top notch. My only disappointment was the dinner at the Grill Room. I have had dinner at least 5 times in the Grill Room. The room is stunning but our meal was not good for the price. Maybe it was an off night. The food highlight was Restaurant August which is 25 feet out the back door. I have stayed in more than a dozen New Orleans hotels but next time I will go back to Windsor Court.

Reviews.Title: “Star Struck!!”
Reviews.Author: Tonya531
Reviews.Content: "Oh boy! What a trip". I will remember this trip forever. This is one of my favorite trips I have enjoyed. On this trip, we stayed at the Windsor Court. The Windsor Court is perfectly located between the convention center and bourbon street. Also, it is not to far from the super dome. As my family and I were walking around our hotel, we visited the gym and low and behold we saw The Crew's Family (Rebecca and Terry Crew) walking on the treadmill. Rebecca said, "She was walking off her beignets". What a treat! And then later, we saw the whole Crew Family even their granddaughter "Miley" inside the pool from our room. Also, we got to see Steve Harvey and his wife(she is very beautiful) in the lobby, as they were getting ready to go out and enjoy the night. Also, we saw Mathew Knowles (Beyonce's dad) in the lobby get ready to get on the elevator. Other people said, Tina Knowles was staying there too, but we did not see her. This hotel has a club level which was being rennovated and they moved the club level to the lobby and closed off space for the people who were part of the club level. This is why we are hanging out in the lobby and seeing stars come and go. Next year, the club level will be back up on the 21st floor and you can see Louisiana and the Mississippi River. This hotel has an assortment of flowers all over the low level of the hotel. It smells divine. The workers are very nice at this hotel and very helpful. Also, we saw alot of other stars on this trip up close and in-persons at the Convention Center, like the Basketball wives and ATL Housewives. Can you guest why we saw so many celebrates? THE ESSENCE FESTIVAL!!! We would differently recommend this hotel to our family and friends. A lot of stars stay here doing the Essence Festival. Now, you can understand my title.

Reviews.Title: “In need of repairs”
Reviews.Author: aracne63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a junior suite, which was very large but needed some updates. The window treatments collapsed when we opened the curtains. The kitchenette's appliances and utensils have been there since the 70's! The sad refrigerator was so loud it woke me up a couple of times. The public areas are nice and the restaurants and room service were good. Snobby front desk staff. Not worth the price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hidden Hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: kbvmcrae
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice for business within a 4 month time frame. It is fantastic. The rooms are huge, spacious and comfortable. The hotel is beautiful and the staff is the kindest I have ever known. The location is great for convention center or Cafe Dumonde! The have a fantastic restaurant and bar onsite and the pool area is amazing too. I have only wonderful things to say about this hotel. While I was traveling for business this hotel met all my needs, but I loved it so much I would go back with my family as well.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mommabulldog
Reviews.Content: My husband was in New Orleans for business and I went to relax, do some shopping but mainly hang out by the pool and read! We absolutely loved this hotel! The staff treated us like royalty. When we checked in were were told be would need to change rooms in a couple of days due to renovations. We were told we would be upgraded. We were put in a three room suite and come "moving day" we were put in a five room suite! Plus we were given a $100 discount. The staff was very friendly and eager to answer our questions. By far the nicest hotel we have stayed in and we travel quite often.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated Ambiance, Understated & Attentive Service and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelers77007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three fabulous nights at the historic and beautiful Windsor Court (our first visit and hopefully one of many more in the future). It's understated sophistication and style and always attentive but not bothersome staff reminded us of the best of the European gem hotels in which we have been fortunate to stary as well as the Mansion on Turtle Creek in Dallas. A sense of calm and contentment was felt immediately upon entering the front door and it never ended during our stay. All guest rooms/suites are in the midst of extensive rennovation (expected to be completed in December, 2011). As to be expected, construction brings challenges to staff and some inconvenience to guests. To the great credit of management and staff, the inconveniences were recognized and minimized and our needs were accomodated without question. When in New Orleans, we will not consider staying elsewhere. We have only been home one day and already miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, But Overpriced and Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: 2GJA
Reviews.Content: If you like overpriced hotels stuck in the '80's, then this place is for you. I cannot express how disappointed we were with the quality of the room-definitely overpriced. It looked like the only thing that had been updated since the '80's was the Keurig coffeemaker. This property is in serious need of renovation. Two positives-it was very clean, and the valet staff was efficient and friendly. There are too many quality hotels in New Orleans to waste your money here.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly poor”
Reviews.Author: ontheincline
Reviews.Content: Needs renovation of building and management. The carpets in the room were frayed. We had paid for a full suite with a kitchen, so imagine our surprise when we realized that there was no dinnerware save for 3 forks and 4 glasses. Furthermore, the warming oven did not work. When we complained the staff offered to send up a microwave oven. We never got the microwave, nor did we receive more dinnerware, as the manager on staff had promised. The manager stated repeatedely that the problems with the physical plant were because the previous ownership had not invested in the building. If that was the case, then the rooms with frayed carpets should not have been rented out until the carpets were replaced. Could the prevrious owners be to blame for the lack of plates and broken promises on the part of the current management too? I've stayed at the WC before, and can say that this stay was a big disappointment. For $305/night, I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Locals love it”
Reviews.Author: jackie112745
Reviews.Content: There is nothing not to love about the Windsor-the lobby always has fresh flowers, the Grill Room is outstanding and the service always excellent. We live in NOLA but always try to stay there at least once/year for a special event.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: cnyaesiago
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel! I went there for Essence Festival and each year we stay at a new hotel in New Orleans. This hotel has been the best by far and I am looking forward to staying there next year. The only reasons I am not giving them a perfect score is for a couple of reasons. The room was still being cleaned when we arrived around 5 ish and we were on a timeline. Also, the valet parking was not as organized when we first arrived. Maybe they were changing shifts or they were trying to accomodate the celebrities staying there. Not quite sure. We stayed in a full suite and the room was very nice and spacious. They are in the process of renovating and I would like to stay in an updated room also. The staff was very friendly. I loved the fresh flowers and overall decor. The hotel was quiet and upscale. I also enjoyed the pool. Rooms were very clean and overall had a pretty good experience.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: dhodges103
Reviews.Content: Only a couple of blocks out of the French Quarter, but well worth the extra short walk. Staff was wonderful, the hotel was quiet, and the rooms were in great shape. We received a complimentary upgrade to a full suite. A very nice, full service hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Feel the Love this time around”
Reviews.Author: soonrman1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Windsor Court last weekend and was a bit disappointed. I have been attending the festival and staying at the Windsor Court since 2000. I have been told since 2008 that renovations would take place and updates made. I was not happy that I saw the same decor, the same furniture, the same mildew smell as last year. I dont like feeling like I wasted $800 to $1000, but I definitely feel that way. As a loyal customer, I expected more but got less. I went to other hotels in the surrounding area and saw much better arrangements for less cost; This was very disheartening. The Windsor Court is supposed to be a 4 to 5 star hotel with superior appeal. IT IS NOT THAT WAY RIGHT NOW.........The only reason I gave it a 3 is because I was able to see how the renovated rooms are supposed to look. If they arent renovated by next years festival, I will not be staying at the Windsor Court.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Elegance”
Reviews.Author: sethleger
Reviews.Content: We booked a one bedroom suite with concierge service for a mid-week stay for 3 nights. The hotel was beautiful, the staff were amazingly helpful and our overall stay was phenomenal. I had a few trepidations concerning the dated nature of the rooms from reading some earlier, unfavorable reviews regarding the condition of the hotel. I spoke with the General Manager who allayed those fears and assured me that my stay would meet my expectations. But in fact, our time at Windsor exceeded my expectations. Our room was quite large and classically elegant; the pool area was beautiful and had an attendant on site; the bathrooms were large and the shower head rejuvenating; our balcony and bedroom views were of the beautiful N.O. skyline; the beds were quite comfortable, and the sheets and bedding were plush; turn down service was a nice touch after having been out about town. The valet, porter, maids and room service staff were extraordinarily helpful and prompt without being overbearing. The hotel is being renovated from top to bottom, and there are a few dated items in the hotel. But really, that's nitpicking and minute and pales in light of the stellar service and comfort and overall beauty of the hotel. Plus, that's all about to change soon with the remodel. If you are considering a stay at the Windsor even before the completed renovations I would give my highest and most heartfelt recommendation to this classic Lady of a hotel. We have stayed in many hotels in New Orleans over the years including ones held in the highest regard, and I have to say that the Windsor Court Hotel is our new and absolute favorite in the line of luxury options in the City.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: Caseyvtb
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Court has always been an elegant, lovely, comfortable, stylish hotel. We go back with every firm intention of having a lovely stay. But we hadn't been there in a few years. Alas. The two main problems are the physical condition of the hotel and the attitude of management and staff. Physical, just the room -- grease stains on the sofa and threads dangling; carpet either worn-and-dirty or just *really* worn. When I got to the room, the A/C was blowing hot. The button that raised and lowered the TV from its odd little box and the foot of the bed didn't work. But the TV was old and clapped out and the colors weren't right. Bathtub and fixtures with chipped porcelain. Both lamps in the bathroom flickering so badly you could hardly stand to stay in there. The sink didn't drain properly. Cherry on the sundae? When I got to the room and lifted the cover on the toilet, it hadn't been flushed since the last user. Ugh. I had to raise some of these issues and nobody apologized, nobody did anything to make things better (other than the engineer who did get the A/C working). All anybody in the hotel said was "you should come back after we do renovations next year". Well, that doesn't help this stay. Elsewhere in the hotel, things were no better. I had to attend a meeting where everybody was complaining about how cold the room was -- temperature set on 60 degrees and even though they told me that the organizers complained repeatedly, it never got better. And I just have to say that the fancier staff you dealt with -- bellmen, phone operators, desk people -- were somewhere between indifferent and clueless. The housekeepers, waiters, and engineers just fine, but the others, no. It's really sad to see the hotel fall down like this. Nothing they did or said will encourage me to come back. Farewell, Windsor Court.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in NOLA!”
Reviews.Author: Jdgiannis
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Windsor Court many times and I find it the finest hotel in New Orleans (I have been to New Orleans 20+ times).. It Oozes distinction and luxury without being pretentious. The staff is very friendly and will go out of their way to make your stay in New Orleans very special.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: terribeverley
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Court is a great place to stay when visiting New Orleans. The location can't be beat as your between the beautiful garden district and the fun and energetic Bourbon Street area. Although the rooms are slightly dated, they are luxurious in their own right. The staff is excellent and put a lot of attention on detail. For instance, AC is always turned up, no skimping on the towels and traditional turn-down service. We were upgraded to a suite that provided wonderful space and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “In Dire Need of Renovation!!”
Reviews.Author: beauoli
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at Windsor Court about 10 years ago and we enjoyed it...I still think the hotel - lobby, courtyard and location are great!! However, the room was a dump!! It was very run down and musty and everything was old!! The price was cheap....so I guess you get what you pay for..When the hotel is renovated I am sure it will be beautiful once again.

Reviews.Title: “Windsor Court was the Best”
Reviews.Author: katbx
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at the Windsor Court. We love staying there when we visit new Orleans. Everyone is so nice and helpful..especially Adam. He helped me when I was there alone on a previous trip to New Orleans. You must make a stop in the lounge. On Sunday night there was a combo that played...great music. One of the musicians, Mark, came over to say hello to us after the set. Nice and friendly..asked if we liked the music. Our suite was nice...a great view overlooking the river. Next time you are in New Orleans, visit the Windsor Court. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel really showed what is meant by Southern Hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: sbellan_11
Reviews.Content: From the lovely flowers in the lobby to the well appointed rooms, the Windsor Court Hotel did not miss any details. The staff was welcoming and gracious, and was there to take care of any little need that we had. The views of the city are spectatular from the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Windsor Court is as gracious and inviting as New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: cekd
Reviews.Content: From the azalea lined courtyard to the personal greeting by the staff, Windsor Court is always warm and welcoming. It's elegant without being stuffy and has an old world charm without being dated. The spacious rooms are clean and comfy, and I look forward to the evening chocolate that comes with turn-down service. The location is perfect--a short hop to the river, casino, French Quarter, great shopping, and of course, world-class restaurants. I am always happy to arrive at and sad to leave the Windsor Court. Make sure to say hello to David at the bell desk--he's a treasure!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant with service to match”
Reviews.Author: UK-USAUnited
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were fortunate enough to stay at the Windsor Court this past weekend and we both loved it. It is such a pleasant change from the typical modern day downtown hotel and the service from everyone we came in contact with was outstanding. The location is ideal whether you want to visit a casino, the French Quarter, good restaurants or watch the river go by. From the moment we gave our car over to the valet to the time we picked it back up two days later we were treated like VIPs. Don't stay here without enjoying afternoon tea.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel in NOLA! Worth the $$$!”
Reviews.Author: geckogirlVirginia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Windsor Court for 3 nights during JazzFest. The hotel room was amazing - I was upgraded to a full suite. The room was huge, clean (great housekeeping), and so quiet. I was on the 8th floor and never heard a sound from the street. It is only a few blocks from the French Quarter. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in New Orleans. They also have a great wine list in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: schwartz336
Reviews.Content: Have been here many many times as well as having stayed at other N.O. hotels. This is our favorite - gracious staff, terrific breakfasts, perfectly located, beautiful lobby. Don't miss.

Reviews.Title: “If in New Orleans, stay at Windsor Court. Great hotel and SUPERB Service”
Reviews.Author: HotelAdvisor69
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great location and comfortable. Beautiful property with historic paintings, lobby full of fresh roses and if you can, stay at the club level.

Reviews.Title: “Not The Best Hotel in North America, but . . .”
Reviews.Author: BlindTom
Reviews.Content: Still a pretty good hotel (but probably not in the New Orleans top 5). The location is about as good as you can ask for if you are not a college student. Close enough to the Quarter area, but in the much quieter, but still interesting, Warehouse District. The rooms were quite large, but are badly in need of updating for a hotel of this reputation. Our room also had a troubling moldy smell at times. Tea in the lobby is quite nice, but the bar upstairs is probably the hotel's best feature. The perfect place to share a drink or meet friends. The staff is gracious and helpful, as they should be. The pricing is also attractive, and less that you would pay for similar quality in other cities. A good hotel, just not world class.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel staff anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: travelmom2323
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend in New Orleans-our first getaway without kids in many years. The weekend was wonderful and a big reason was the staff at the Windsor Court. Everyone we encountered was fantastic: from the manager David Teich to the housekeeping staff that gave us our nightly turndown service and everyone in between! The hotel is beautiful, we also did not see any of the worn down conditions that have been mentioned. If you go to New Orleans, you must stay at the Windsor Court!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Johniehank
Reviews.Content: This package was 500.00 for two nights including a lavish four course Easter brunch which i8ncluded a full bar and all gratuities.We stayed in a REAL suite and the package cost was inclusive of everything, including tax. The bill came to a flat 500.00, no hidden costs are tag ons. And the hotel is one of the finest in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: comill
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay in New Orleans for our anniversary and stayed at the Windsor Court. Everything was what we expected in a five star hotel. It was elegant and the staff was very courteous attending to every minute detail. We were very impressed and will definitely return when visiting the Crescent City!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, elegant and grand...”
Reviews.Author: canoftomatosoup
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from 4 days in New Orleans. We had gone down to visit Tulane University and I was trying to decide if I wanted to stay downtown or closer to the university. I chose downtown at the Windsor Court and I could not have made a better choice. When it comes to hotels, I can be a bit of a prima donna. Come to think of it, so can my daughter! So I was a bit taken back by the negative reviews on Trip Advisor. Our experience at the Windsor Court Hotel was fabulous from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. In fact the great service was evident prior to our arrival., I communicated with Pam Lambert at the hotel for our booking and she was wonderful to deal with. The hotel has a quiet elegance - a wonderful respite from the hustle and bustle of Bourbon Street. We had a full suite and it was beautiful. It wasn't worn and tattered as previous reviews had said. Perhaps our room had been updated. I don't know. I just know that we were extremely comfortable and well rested. My daughter said that she slept better there than at home. We ordered room service a few times and the service was spot on: friendly, efficient and the food was delicious. They thought of everything including the white linens and flowers. We dined in The Grill Room one evening and one morning and both meals were amazing. Our server at breakfast was Adam and he was knowledgeable and extremely professional. He even gave us a card entitling us to complimentary sparkling wine with dinner later. As for dinner, I have a nut allergy and my daughter cannot eat meat and they were wonderfully accommodating. The amuse bouche was foie gras and topped with crushed cashews and because we were unable to eat it, the chef made us a special combination of fresh peas, pea sprouts, morels and fiddleheads. Delicious! The restaurant is very elegant but not at all stuffy. Our servers Mary and Billy were friendly and so very nice and of course the food was lovely. Lastly we lounged by the pool for a few hours and again the young lady who worked the deck was great and the loungers and pool great. I can't stop burbling about how wonderful the Windsor Court was and I am secretly hoping that my daughter chooses to attend Tulane so I can get back to NOLA and to the Windsor Court Hotel again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: DC2128
Reviews.Content: To put this review in perspective, I've stayed at the Windsor Court for Mardi Gras every year since Katrina. As a member of one of the large Krewes, we travel to N.O. every year and have previously enjoyed the Windsor Court. We've overlooked the "oldness," things like the exhaust vents having an inch of dust on them and the worn carpet because it's a great location and the rooms are normally large. For further perspective, my friend and I have been responsible for referring multiple people to stay at this hotel. When people join us at Mardi Gras and fly in we've always said stay here. My friend had just brought his family there over Christmas as well and has stayed there several other times on business. There has been untold dollars spent at this hotel based on our stay. This year we arrived as usual, payed $320 a night not including fees and walked into our room and it literally felt like a closet. We didn't even know they had these rooms at "an all suite hotel." That is a quote from one of the staff when we inquired about our room and how we ended up in something smaller than the La Quinta at double the price. Our inquiries were met with a complete indifference mainly from the manager on staff who even went so far as to question whether I had stayed there every year since 2005. They plain and simple, did not care that we had spent our hard earned money there and been very loyal customers. Here's the rest. As has been mentioned many times already, the TV remote could change channels on the very outdated "Motel 6" TV, but it could not turn the TV on and off. You had to get out of bed to do that. In room free coffee was never refilled at this "4 star hotel." We asked three times and finally someone brought it. The plunger in the sink would not close when my friend wanted to put in his contacts and didn't want to lose one down the sink. He pushed it down and then it wouldn't open so the sink later filled up with water. When the maid came in, she pulled the plunger out completely and left it sitting on the sink until we checked out 2 days later. It would have been easy for the management of the Windsor Court to make us feel a little better about a very substandard stay for a very expensive room. Access to Club Level, discount next year, dinner or whatever. They could have done something but they couldn't care less. Two different managers on two different days. We asked about the room professionally and respectfully and were met with complete indifference. We are the type of people that are loyal but expect the same in return. If not and as you can expect, we will never stay there again. They could have had 20 more years from us and our friends.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with excellent services and amenities, if you can afford it”
Reviews.Author: MiCasaEsSuCasa
Reviews.Content: My friends and I wanted to stay in a higher-end hotel for 2 nights in New Orleans and the Windsor Court Hotel delivered. What was nice is that we booked a room with 2 beds (just doubles) and they upgraded us at check-in to a suite, where we could fit a rollaway comfortably. The hotel's pool was excellent and they were renovating the fitness room. All in all a good choice and decent price for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Long past its prime”
Reviews.Author: Travelteam69
Reviews.Content: This facility has declined in physical plant and service and is far below what it once was. On arrival, the deskpads used for registration were frayed and tattered (something easily corrected). From there it was downhill. The elevator to the room rattled, and hummed during its ascent. After arriving in the suite we noted most of the electricial wall plugs were unstable and falling out the walls (simple screws would have tightened them). While lampshades were old, one had a frank hole through it. Bathroom fixtures/tiles were old, but the pockets of black mildew in the corners were inexcusable. Housekeeping took hours to respond to requests for missing items in the room. The coffee table in the room partially collapsed. Room service delived several meals that were only of minimul quality in warmth, preparation and presentation. We can excuse the gaping and yellowed seams in the wallpaper and the air vents covered by multiple coats of paint in a hotel with purported plans to renovate. What is difficult to excuse is the absence of pride and the lack of attention of management.. We've stayed here many, many times over the course of multiple decades but have no plans to return until changes are made. The staff is polite, but their demeanor cannot make up for the lack of product.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: heartlander50
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Court Hotel is elegant, perhaps in need of a little updating in the rooms, but the amenities were top-notch. The door staff, concierge staff and front desk staff were all extremely helpful, professional and friendly... even with a sense of humor. I can't stay enough about the type of people who work for this hotel. I left a pair of jeans in the room, the housekeeping staff reported the loss and the jeans were promptly mailed first class. The beds were very comfortable, the sheets were 'hotel quality' and our room was quiet. The Hotel is located just a couple blocks from the French Quarter, but key is that it is NOT located in the French Quarter. The Grill Room restaurant located in the hotel is one of the top-rated restaurants in New Orleans. The concierge staff recommended places for breakfast, lunch and dinner and they were always terrific. The bricked courtyard and gracious lobby are impressive with an old world flair.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: Kkkkelly
Reviews.Content: I was expecting far more from the Windsor Court Hotel based upon the reviews I read. My one bedroom suite was certainly spacious, but showed its age and a lack of care. The a/c vent was covered in dust and the carpeting looked worn. In my 5-night stay, I had to call housekeeping on numerous occasions because items were not replaced with any regularity. Used drinking glasses were left in the sink but not replenished. Shampoo and toilet paper were not restocked when completely used up. I had to request more coffee and creamer, etc. I would expect to not have to concern myself with these details and a fine hotel, these are taken care of with ease at even a budget establishment. Next time, I will choose a property within close proximity to the convention center that offers better value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Destination Hotel for Mardi Gras....”
Reviews.Author: EIcamina
Reviews.Content: My husband and took our two boys ages 4 and 11 to stay at the Windsor Court for Mardi Gras this year. The service was impeccable and although it is a swank hotel, they were great with the kids. The price couldn't be beat and the room size was excellent, allowing us all enough room to have the necissary space. There were a number of parades that passed right in front of the hotel and the crowd on the parade route was very family oriented. It allowed for the safety, secuirty and privacy that we weren't sure we would find in a downtown New Orleans hotel. It was a great family trip and we will be booking again for next year.

Reviews.Title: “A classic in need of a few updates”
Reviews.Author: HalleAndTheWorld
Reviews.Content: Dressed in ripped jeans and t-shirts, we certainly didn't look like the usual Windsor Court guest. But in true southern hospitality, we were welcomed into this old-world (and ginormous) hotel. While our suite was spacious with beautiful views of the city, we couldn't help but chuckle at the few things that felt off. First, there was the kitchen from the 70s that someone would bang on our door every morning to come check in on (something about the mini bar). Then there was the TV from the early 90s that sat at the end of our bed, rising up and down with a touch of a button. And the bathroom was simply outdated with chipped porcelain and weak faucets. That being said, the bed was absolutely heavenly. And I wish I had more time at the gorgeous pool. But the central location lent itself to much time outside the room-- as we were just steps from downtown and a few blocks from the French Quarter. I'd definitely come back, especially after they upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “When I travel to New Orleans in the future I will be staying at the Windsor Court.”
Reviews.Author: nola12345646290
Reviews.Content: This was not my first choice. Most of my party was at another hotel but I am delighted that that one was sold out. I stayed on a "Club" floor and it was a pleasure. The staff, service, comfort and amenities were outstanding. The only criticism would be that the sliders to the deck and closets along ith a noisy AC/Heat unit all obviously needed to be replaced. I travel to New Orleans often and will without doubt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “As good as I expected”
Reviews.Author: theresita61
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, elegant, tasteful hotel. Great quiet location within 5 min walk to French Quarter. The service is impeccable and all staff really make you feel special. The room was spacious, nice amenities and bathroom and the King size bed was extremely comfortable. I slept very well which I often do not do in a hotel. We had drinks and bar menu one evening which was very good. River and pool view from the balcony was enjoyable...it was nice to open the sliding door in March! As for any reviews stating that the hotel or furniture is shabby...I think these guests would prefer a brand new property with "IKEA" style furnishings. This hotel is old world elegant and we would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This grand old lady is beginning to show her age.”
Reviews.Author: 43josie
Reviews.Content: Everyone raved about Windsor Court, and I wanted to like it more than I did. There were many positive aspects of our stay there. The people at the front desk were efficient and friendly, and the concierge service was great. The courtyard and lobby were attractive, with lots of fresh flowers adorning each. The location was great, within easy walking distance to the French Quarter and many good restaurants in the Warehouse district. We chose a full suite because three adults were sharing a room. The room was spacious, and we loved looking out at the river from our balcony on the 16th floor. The person in the living room slept on a rollaway bed and had his own entrance to a shared bathroom. Too bad I woke up stiff each morning. The sheets were silken, but the bed didn't support my back. The room needed improvement. There were ugly chips in the porcelain sink. The sofa in the living area needed better cushions. The toilet sometimes kept running; we'd have to return to jostle the handle. The floor in the kitchenette was sticky. Housekeepers did not always clean the coffee cups we left in the sink, and they didn't replace the creamer and sugar when they ran out. We contacted the front desk twice about items such as facial tissue and note paper that needed to be refilled. Once we got an immediate response, but the second time we had to call again to get the service we requested. If the price had been more moderate, I wouldn't gripe about some of the things I mentioned. But at $350 per night on a weekend, I expected more.

Reviews.Title: “It's all been said before but......”
Reviews.Author: shikster
Reviews.Content: After now reading the previous reviews, which ironically, I had not done prior to my visit, there is nothing more to add. This trip exceeded our expectations. From the moment you are greeted from your cab to the personal, prompt, efficient check-in, to the sigh of relaxation upon entering your suite.... It was a wonderful visit. The magnificent flowers in the lobby, the deliciously comfortable bedding, invigorating rainshower head, great sazaracs (worlds better than Galatoire's!) at the Polo Lounge.... Just terrific. Thank you Windsor Court for holding on to that old-world graciousness. Look forward to returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay during busy Mardi Gras season”
Reviews.Author: LondonWeThree
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Windsor Court over many years when in New Orleans and highly recommend this hotel and we have tried quite a few hotels in New Orleans. The professional and well trained staff have also been there for years and nothing is too much bother for them. The hotel is nicely appointed with a fantastic art collection and large comfortable and quiet rooms. The club level is especially nice with breakfast/drink lounge. The Polo bar is atmospheric and the drinks spot on. Even during busy Mardi Gras the stay was perfect. The location could not be better as you are at the edge of the quarter and near the art galleries and fine restaurants of the Central Business District. In warmer months the pool is a lovely respite from the heat, especially after a long day at Jazz Fest. The concierge staff are very knowledgable about restaurant/music/gallleries and are happy to assist. You can't go wrong staying at the Windsor Court while in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Philly180
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the Windsor Court Hotel. The full suite is very spacious with a great layout. The bathroom and dress area is oversized and the butler pantry is just right. The beds are comfortable also. From the 17th floor balcony there is a great view of the city at night. Everyone in the hotel is extremely friendly and helpful. You are treated like royalty 24/7 during your entire stay. The hotel location is close enough to walk to everything downtown New Orleans has to offer. The best thing about this hotel is that you pay more to stay at a very nice place and you check out feeling like it was worth it. A very big thank you to your staff.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Sophisticated Elegance”
Reviews.Author: LenM
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose to stay one night at the Windsor Court enroute to Florida from Texas. After a twelve hour day on the road, we were looking forward to a good nights sleep and an overnight to recharge our batteries to hit the road again in the morning. As we drove into the city there were motorcyle police everywhere with screaming sirens escorting buses through the city streets. I thought there was either a sports event or some political dignitary and his entourage arriving. I guess we were the only people on the planet who didn't know that it was the first day of Mardi Gras (which we were informed of when we reached the hotel). We checked into the hotel at a discounted rate arranged the prior evening by a direct phone call to the hotel's front office manager. Our GPS guided us into the labyrinth of downtown streets and to the hotel. we drove into a beautiful walled courtyard (it had the feel of arriving at a private mansion) and were greeted at our car door by friendly staff. Valet Parking in a secure garage with an overnight charge for the parking. The hotel is older, but elegant and sophisticated. The same manager who I had spoken to the previous evening greeted us upon arrival (he had a very unsual first name - the same as our favorite cruise line). He gave us a beautiful corner room, despite our discounted room rate (and no doubt a full hotel). In retrospect, I am amazed we were even able to GET a room during this annual event. Somehow, arriving clueless turned out to be an advantage. Sleep would have to wait as there was a Mardi Gras parade right outside our 5th floor window - we watched in comfortable night clothes. The parade went on for hours and provided a superb experience. We've avoided this world famous festival - thinking about all of the debauchery touted by the media, it just wasn't my style. I was surprised by the reality of what we saw. Little kids and families on the side of the street, dressed up in carnival outfits with funny hats, adults (fully dressed) and enjoying themselves, high school and military bands, it was one of the best parades we've ever seen. The rooms are spacious, the beds and linens finest quality and comfortable. The bath was spacious, marble and had two sitting/sink areas (one in the bath and one outside of it). the hotel is a short walk to the tourist areas of New Orleans - the french quarter and their beautiful waterfront. Other comments at this site have discussed the televisions. True, they are not flat screen, high definition sets that you might expect - in fact the television sets are ancient. The kind you might expect a coat hanger for an antenna, Faces were green - it was comical - but my answer to that is - who comes to New Orleans to watch television. I think the televisions are probably the only flaw in the armor of this superb hotel. We were tired from our trip and chose to order room service. They have a restaurant in the hotel. thinking there might be a larger choice I called room service and requested a menu from their restaurant. Within minutes the Room Service Supervisor, dressed in a suit and tie, showed up at our door with the menu and let us know we could order anything we wished from either the standard room service menu or from the restaurant menu. We chose the restaurant menu and were not disappointed. it was an Incredible meal. Rack of lamb, creme brulee. I was concerned that ordering only one meal and splitting it would bring an inadequate amount of food. So I also ordered a Margherita Pizza (we were unable to finish the pizza as there was just too much food). Excellent taste, large portions. In fact, the meal was one of the finest we've ever had in a hotel from room service. During our week long road trip we spent time in many of the cookie cutter, omnipresent hotels that populate every interstate exit. The Windsor Court was like stepping into a Mercedes after driving a Yugo. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Experience”
Reviews.Author: gallerygirl09
Reviews.Content: We went with friends that usually stay at another hotel closer to Royal Street . My brother had eaten at windsor Court years ago. Another friends mother had once stayed there . So decided to take a chance and stay at the hotel. It was luxurious and yet had an old school charm. Although our friends had their neighborhood joints that they liked to go for breakfast, my husband and I slept in and started our day each morning eating in the hotel's lovely dining room. It felt as if you were in an enclosed dining room. It actually felt from European! We loved the hotel. It was classy yet not cold or too reserved. The concierge was helpful but our well seasoned traveler friends knew so many hot spots for restaurants that we had the time of our lives! Rooms do vary in size so spend extra and get a superior room. You will live like a queen!

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: cindela
Reviews.Content: I must say I was very impressed by the caliber of the Windsor Court. The lobby is brilliant and clean and the hotel staff is ultra-friendly and helpful. Unfortunately it rained 2 of the days we stayed here, but the doormen stood right outside the lobby, handing complimentary umbrellas to all guests leaving the hotel. We lost most ours somewhere on Bourbon St, which was, I'm sure, to be expected. Our room was huge. Walking in there's a small wet-bar and then a grand sitting area with couches, a table and a balcony. Make a right through double french doors and you find the bedroom- a desk, a giant bed, a pop-up television and another balcony. Turn right from there and you find a small closest area with room for a dresser and some ironing, and through there is the bathroom. The room was awesome and the bed was so comfortable that our first night at home left us stiff and honestly we are now shopping for a new mattress and pillows that would somehow compare to the luxe ones we had at Windsor Court. I have 2 small complaints. First, they have a lovely Keurig coffee-maker in the room but the coffee was never refilled. I didn't find it important enough to call anyone about though- I'm sure they would have brought more coffee if I had- but at the same time I feel the cleaning staff should obviously check and refill a wet-bar, same as they would the soap in the bathroom. Second, I found showering here to be a huge pain. I don't know if it's the hotel or the city itself, but the water is so soft it took 5 extra minutes to wash the soap off my body. Also, the drain was kinda clogged which is never any fun, but again, I never called down about it so I can't really complain. All in all, this hotel is wonderful. Everything is walking distance, everyone is nice and helpful, and the rooms are luxurious and well kept. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely suite, great location, attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: Scotton52
Reviews.Content: Had a suite with a magnificent river view and balcony which was terrific. Bell and concierge staff were fantastic and check in and out a breeze. Hotel location is terrific, close to the Quarter but not too close and also close to access points for many other attractions. The lounge and food in the lounge were above average and the bar staff very friendly and attentive. Only issue during our stay was the replacement of wine glasses by the housekeeping staff but a quick call rectified the problem. Had a great stay overall, the suites are huge and well worth the extra tariff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: mkaymchugh
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this elegant hotel. It is expensive but worth the splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Windsor was WONDERFUL!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JDS2010
Reviews.Content: I needed to travel to New Orleans for a business trip. I was looking for a hotel that was walking distance from the Conference Center and The French Quarter. Windsor Court definitely met that initial booking requirement however when I arrived it far exceeded my expectations!!! I was impressed the minute we pulled up. It is tucked away behind a private brick wall. It felt like we were staying on a private exclusive compound away from the city ......but the minute you walked beyond the brick wall you had many New Orleans activities within walking distance. It was the best of both worlds. As you approach the entrance you are treated like a queen. Car door was opened, bags were handled and the entrance to Windsor Court was open. All the employees were extremely helpful. The bell boy met me in my suite with my luggage and walked me through the details and ammenities of the room. He even gave me a brief history of the hotel and the hotel's goals for the near future. Our room overlooked the Mississippi River and Harrah's Casino......beautiful both night and day! We ordered breakfast for the room and felt like royalty. They set up the table in our sitting room with linens and a beautiful food presentation. Other mornings we took advantage of the Club Level breakfast.....fritattas and lox/bagels! The view from the Club was even more impressive. At night we would enjoy having a drink in the hotel bar. The enviroment very relaxing and comfortable. Fresh flowers were filled throughout the lobby/1st floor. My favorite part was receiving the nightly turn down service and walking around with my complimentary Windsor Court slippers! :) Windsor Court was definitely a highlight to the trip! We thoroughly enjoyed our spacious suite, view and customer service. During previous visits we stayed at The Ritz Carlton. Windsor Court will definitely be where we stay when we return!

Reviews.Title: “The Windsor Court was not up to its usual standards!”
Reviews.Author: Trypome
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay in two years at this hotel. The first one was fabulous! But when we stayed this time, we found many details dropped. In a three night stay, they lost our car because of their sloppy handwriting, brought the wrong car another time, no shampoo one day, no washcloths another, paper delivered two days but not third, sent to restaurant to eat by front desk when it was closed, turndown service forgotten one night.... I know all of these are little things but such lack of detail was not expected at the Winfsor Court.

Reviews.Title: “In need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: kk1204
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Court is in a great location and is filled with friendly staff. But, the property is overdue for a renovation. My room, a club level suite, had shabby wallpaper, scuffed doors, no water pressure in the shower and a television on a cart that I had to wheel into the bedroom to watch in bed. The bedding is also in need of a rethink. Instead of a duvet, the bed is dressed with a blanket sandwiched between two sheets. The blanket comes loose from the sheets and it is off putting as I doubt the blanket is washed between guests. It is not comfortable at any rate. The gift shop closes much too early so that if you need a toiletry item, etc. you have to walk over to Canal Street. Finally, the hotel could not arrange for a manicure in the hotel, which is a basic service for a hotel of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Service Oriented Management”
Reviews.Author: adl8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Windsor Court Hotel for 3 nights for a conference last week.
