While there were a few minor issues with the room, the manager was most attentive and gracious in not only fixing them, but in ensuring that I left with a most positive view of the hotel's service. He went above and beyond in addressing my concerns, and I appreciate his prompt attention enough to recommend this hotel to anyone. I would certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable Anniversary Experience”
Reviews.Author: channy626
Reviews.Content: Full Suite Room was exceptional. Treated like royalty on every level. Did not have to lift a finger for anything. Room Service for breakfast the next day was very persoanl and exquitsite experience. Fine dining as room service is A+. Spacious very quaint hotel that you really feel the quiteness of a hotel. You don't hear doors closing, toliets flushing next door, or people chating in the hall.

Reviews.Title: “Windsor Court”
Reviews.Author: umich3
Reviews.Content: This property is just not my taste. It was so highly rated that we booked our stay there. The suite's furnishings were not my taste. Our suite overlooked what looked like an airconditioning shaft. We did have a 'water view'. I just don't remember anyone being over the top nice or helpful. We were snowed in and had to stay one more night in New Orleans and chose to stay next door at the W. Next time we go I think we will choose either the W or the Westin and get a suite there. Just not overly impressed with the old stuffy place. The city on the other hand, which is why we went was INCREDIBLE!!! What a fabulous city. The people everywhere are over the top friendly. The restaurants are extraordinary!!! We went on a food weekend that happened to be the same weekend the Saints won the NFC Championship. Try Irene's cuisine, the Gumbo shop, GW Fins and Red Fish. Eat a muffaletta (Serios' Deli), a po boy at Mothers and a beignet at Cafe Du Monde!!) Take a walk on the waterfront if you have time.

Reviews.Title: “There is only one hotel in Downtown NOLA, as far as we're concerned.”
Reviews.Author: Sampaw004
Reviews.Content: It is difficult for us to describe how it feels to be treated like an elite, because we aren't elite. I'm sure happy, however, we spent a few extra $$ to get the treatment. From the moment we drove up, until the moment the staff closed out car door with best wishes, we were in the A-crowd. That's how we felt. By the second time some staff saw us, they knew our names. The hotel runs like a well-oiled machine. There is maid for bedding, one for bathrooms, one for the in room mini-bar, and another watching your back. All of the maids, regardless of race or culture, spoke clearly, were polite, and were genuinely happy. No street talk or unintelligible accents. Even though they had no idea I was in the room, they always knocked and made themselves know. Once, one of the maids ducked out to get something and knowing I was there, left the door open. She wasn't gone 2 minutes, and an older, elegant lady, knocked made herself known. Turns out, she was the Housekeeping Manager, noticed the door was open, and was just checking to make sure the door wasn't inadvertently left open. The maid returned at that moment, and I made it clear that it was all good and there wasn't a problem. THAT WAS A SATURDAY! We felt very secure and extremely comfortable. I have enough grey hair to know that means Excellent Management. Kudos to David Teich, and his staff. He has created an environment were each employee obviously feels valued and takes ownership of their work. The exact same holds true for the 2nd floor Bar/Club, which had better entertainment I've seen anywhere in my hometown - AUSTIN, TX! The waitstaff is cogent, polite, fast, and super friendly. Why? Look around, you'll see an older gentlemen, dressed to the nine's running around with a huge, genuine smile on his face, working right along side his staff. That shows distinctive, first class, flawless service and style. Absolutely first class!

Reviews.Title: “Experience what luxury is at a unbelievible price!”
Reviews.Author: racingchef
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel you stay for business or pleasure and you come back for no other reason than you just want to stay at this hotel again. I have made trips back to New Orleans just to have a weekend of great food, pampering and the feeling that they are truly glad to have me as a guest!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: APT2011
Reviews.Content: Beware of the Windsor Court Hotel!!! We were ROBBED in our room We arrived two days before Thanksgiving 2010, looking forward to our stay. We went out to dinner and a little music Tuesday night and when we returned at 11:30, our adult daughter who was staying in our suite with us, ran into a friend and decided to stay out a little longer. When we went to our room, which was at the end of a hallway on the 18th floor, we decided to leave the door ajar for her to come back. At 3am, two unescorted "women of the night" were seen coming into the lobby and they proceeded to go to the elevators and up to our room. Our daughter was still out, but did not tell anyone where we were staying, or that the door would be ajar for her upon her return. The hotel has erroneously said our daughter is at fault and she was not. When she returned, she went right to the front desk to get a key, not knowing we had left the door ajar, she didn't even know the room number we were in! The hotel has tried to blame us for being robbed in our room in the middle of the night while we were asleep, but in truth, their security is severely lacking. Someone should have stopped the women before they went to the elevators. They have their story completely wrong and they have conveniently said our daughter "told everyone" where she was staying and she repeatedly told the head of security that was not the case. These women were in our room for 10 minutes and we never woke up, it is the most creepy feeling. I will never stay there again. They stole our cell phones, our ipod and jewelry, about $1700 worth of goods and the hotel has refused to reimburse us...shame on them. No one should be allowed to go up the elevators who are not staying in the hotel. They have said the in room robbery was our fault! Needless to say, I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful staff; large comfortable rooms which could use some updating.”
Reviews.Author: kgk44
Reviews.Content: The service from the moment we arrived was warm and gracious. All the staff we encountered were warm, gracious, courteous and helpful. We enjoyed our room, it was spaciousness, bright and quite comfortable. The beds were very comfortable as were the pillows. The hotel lobby is quite nice but the halls and the rooms could use some updating. I understand that renovations are about to begin. This should make the hotel just about perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Where to start? The worst thing about the Windsor Court is”
Reviews.Author: DLH-KKB
Reviews.Content: having to leave it. The Windsor Court wraps a stress-free cocoon around its guests. If forced to describe the grand Windsor Court in one word, it would be PERFECTION. The spacious rooms are thoroughly lovely and beautiful. The staff is unparalleled in our vast travel experiences. Courtesy, courtesy, courtesy: but what else would one expect at a hotel with Windsor Court as its name? The Windsor Court at Christmas time is magical- across the board, guests responded to it all with wonderment. The WC spares no detail or expense. We also loved to people-watch when the guests, dressed in there splendid finery, arrived for the formal teas. Problems almost invariably arise over the course of lengthy stays at hotels. Problem? What problem? No problem. As soon as staff were notified of any concern we had, they immediately responded by resolving the matter beyond (high) expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Overall”
Reviews.Author: JCrewBaby
Reviews.Content: Although I only got a taste of the Windsor (I had a very short stay), it was yummy! Everyone was super courteous and the guests are treated with the utmost respect. My only criticism would be that the rooms could use some updating....not much, otherwise it would lose it's character; however, the decor would more likely attract "older" guests. It is definitely worth a shot. Oh, one more thing-- I loved the location! Lots of good stuff around and everything was pretty much in walking distance (and that's coming from someone who doesn't do much walking!)

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Dated But Still Grand”
Reviews.Author: MegamomSeattle
Reviews.Content: In NOLA for both biz and pleasure. Made reservation via phone directly with hotel after reading reviews plus husband had often stayed there for work. Reservations was very professional, had that southern charm and sent a reminder with info as to our stay prior to arrival. The courtyard is filled with courteous valets and doormen. My friend, who shuttled me around, was greeting by name, her car held, while she came up to see our room and the hotel. She felt special. We had a corner unit with an entry, doorbell, small kitchen with sink, refridge and over! Our living room had 2 sofa's, a comfy chair, table, desk and console TV. The sperate dressing area had it's own sink with the closet and another sink in the large bathroom (shower/tub, magnifying mirrors in both areas). Our bedroom had some river view (9th floor). TV in the dresser, King bed. Quiet and on an HVAC system vs. the small units in some places. Turn down service with treats and the front desk asked our preference for housekeeping daily and we never saw them, but always had a clean room. The suite and hotel for that matter,is dated and they are going to remodel, so carpets, paint, decor is not modern and I sensed years of when smoking Was allowed in their rooms. Pool and workout area was wonderful. Warm pool, full bath facilities for showering there. Loved having the coffee served poolside after our workout, laying in the sun and they added 2 biscotti to our pot of coffee order, how nice! Location is close to river, mall, Starbucks is IN Harrahs, across the street. Great restaurant just across the street and in the hotel, I hear. PS Free WiFi and daily local paper!

Reviews.Title: “Windsor Count - Nice but no hot water”
Reviews.Author: LAB019
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Windsor Court Thanksgiving week in a Club Level Suite - Suite 2103. While it was nice, on many days we never really had any hot water; it was tepid at best. Our friends staying in a different suite on the same floor did not have any problems. One afternoon we had to take a cold shower. We reported the issue to the front desk they said they would notify maintenance. We never heard any response after than. The next morning we again had no hot water. and called the front desk and were told, 'let the water run for 10 minutes'. I don't think it's too much to ask when you are paying for an 800+ sq ft suite, to have hot water! At checkout, they didn't even ask how are stay was. I would like to point out there were many positives to the our stay and the hotel - The lobby is beautiful and the fresh flowers all around the hotel were amazing. - We ate in the Grill Room one night and the food was very good. My husband's Waygu Strip steak was to die for. The jazz band playing was great. They even played 'Linux and Lucy' by request. - Loved the location of the hotel. It was perfect for us; close but not too close to the French Qtr. - Room was quite. We did not hear any noise from the hallway or adjacent rooms. - David in the Club Level Lounge was outstanding! He was very friendly and went out of his way to make sure we had everything we needed while in the lounge. - The Christmas tree in the lobby was put up during our stay. It was gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Celebration of "AT HOME".”
Reviews.Author: Lincoln6
Reviews.Content: It was a beautiful hotel with roomy and airy suites. The service was impecable. Twelve of us sat down at the bar and needed dinner, the waiters were graciuos and accomadating and fast! The dinner was perfect! I could live there, because, the backdrop was New Orleans which is absolutely amazing. Life, Action, good people, wonderful antiques, fabulous food and lots to do and see. I casn't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Run Down”
Reviews.Author: LiveAmused
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of nights at this hotel. It is rated as the only 5 star hotel in New Orleans. But as we all now, sometimes star rating are truly outdated. Windsor Court needs a complete face lift from head to toe. The staff, although polite, are not much help. The rooms are 70ish look with Laura Ashely style of furnishings. On the second day, I left the room from 9 am and found it not serviced when I returned at 4 pm. It took a couple of phone calls to housekeeping and front desk and a 20-minute wait for someone to come and attend to room. I had to leave and come back after 45 minutes to finally be able to take a shower and get ready for dinner. On the first day, we ordered room service for breakfast. The only hot thing was coffee. The eggs were non-descriptive and cold and breakfast for one cost almost $40. I would recommend the Ritz Carlton over any larger hotel in New Orleans. We have stayed there a couple of times and each time have enjoyed our stay. They were sold out this time so we chose to stay at Windsor Court.

Reviews.Title: “Windsor Court is my home in New Orleans.”
Reviews.Author: RalphArmstrong
Reviews.Content: From the valet who greets us at the courtyard drive in to the doorman and the check in desk, the well-trained and courteous staff make us feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Divajazz
Reviews.Content: We spent a lovely weekend at Windsor Court and found the accommodations very comfortable and charming. Ample room size with king bed and a sitting area all with a lovely full wall view of the river.Nice toiletries in the bathroom with abundant towels, We enjoyed a lovely high tea in the Salon one aftrenoon and a special dinner in the Grill Room. The meal was exceptional in a beautiful setting - but the added bonus was a sophisticated jazz quartet that could be enjoyed as we dined. All staff members went out of their way to be friendly and accommodating and repeatedly followed up with us to see if there was anything they could do to make our stay more enjoyable. The location is wonderful - accessible to shopping and the French Quarter, as well as other major attractions. I would not hesitate to revisit!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!!!”
Reviews.Author: donnell1
Reviews.Content: If ever you get the opportunity to visit New Orleans, you must stay at The Windsor Court. Everything - the staff, the accommodations, the food, the service - everything exceeded our expectations. Our room was beautifully appointed (and huge) and overlooked the Mighty Mississippi. I suggest you spend the extra money to stay in the Club Level suites. Like most husbands, my spouse could not leave his work behind. He really enjoyed taking his laptop to the Club Lounge, grabbing a drink, a snack, watching the big flat screen tv and attending to e-mails. We are going back in the Spring (if not earlier). Thank you so much Windsor Court Family.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and dowdy rooms”
Reviews.Author: southerntraveler1989
Reviews.Content: For work I have stayed here often. Recently I have started staying elsewhere, and walking to the conference facilities. The rooms need updating, as they are very dated and dinghy looking. The staff while being nice are not that helpful. Requested a 12:30 or 1:00 checkout, due to conference ending time, and was told that was not possible. But someone directly behind me was given a 2:00 checkout. Rude. Unless it is unavoidable, I will choose to stay elsewhere when I come to New Orleans. This is definitely not a 5 star hotel. I have traveled extensively and stayed at numerous 5 star hotels, this hotel's staff could take some lessons. Additionally we had to wait until 5:00 for our room, which was no big deal. But there was food in the fridge and trash on the bed. For the price you would expect much much more.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: rhd66
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just wonderful. The staff was amazing and provided help at the drop of a hat. We ate both lunch and dinner in the restaurant; I recommend it also. The hotel is conveniently located, and if you want to take a small van tour of the city, the concierge desk will arrange it cheerfully.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like we were special”
Reviews.Author: CFBAKB
Reviews.Content: It had been years since we had been back in NOLA and it was a special getway for my husband and I. We knew that we did not want to stay in the Quarter but wanted to be close to it. Most of hotels on Canal street did not have the character that I was hoping for, the Windsor Court did. It was a special treat and the staff really went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Windsor Court Hotel New Orleans, LA.”
Reviews.Author: qmansd
Reviews.Content: The Club level service was excellant and the staff was professional and very attentive. The rooms were spacious, elegant, and comfortable. The hotel amenities are outstanding. Wonderful pool area and fitness center. The entire hotel staff was warm and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “â€œ Windsor Court - Needs a Touch of Leona Helmsley â€�”
Reviews.Author: Delaw
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here over the years for business and pleasure. I like the location and the hotel rooms. This time we booked a suite (traveling with friends) with an adjoining room. The arrangement is perfect: there is a door that shuts off the end of the hall and the suite is on one side and the very spacious double room on the other. This was perfect. The suite comes equipped with a full galley kitchen: fridge, sink and stove. The bed was very comfortable and on the first night, the room was equipped with lovely linens and extras like a linen mat on each side of the bed. BUT, for having booked a suite and paid full rack rate ($550 per night), there were odd omissions that were just annoying. For instance, despite a full convenience bar, there were no bar glasses, or bar napkins. There was a full kitchen, but no kitchen towel. I was told by room service that I should have ordered breakfast with the door tag menu instead of calling but there were none in our room. There was a king size bed but only three pillows. The pillows in the sham covered pillows didn't have any cases on them. On the second night, housekeeping had not replaced wash clothes or bath mats. The little linen bedside mats were missing and we still didn't have drink glasses. Shampoo was not re-stocked. This all seems like trivial stuff; however, it was just annoying given the overall cost of the room. The room was clean and the bed and overall layout very comfortable. But, it's a bit like putting out only a B effort when with just a bit more effort, the experience would be exceptional and not just good. I felt as if we were housekeeping's forgotten stepchild at the far end of the hall. My husband reminded me that maybe the other rooms got even worse attention!

Reviews.Title: “Sourthern Charm”
Reviews.Author: PatWisconsin
Reviews.Content: This has been our 10th stay at the Windsor Court. We love the location and the ambiance of the hotel. The suites are so large, you could make this into a condo! Our room was lovely with a great view of the Mississippi, but it did need some renovation-especially the carpet and the furniture. But the price is extremely reasonable so we can overlook that, at least for now. We were celebrating our 37th anniverary and since my husband mentioned that when we booked, we were presented with a bottle of champagne and a fruit and cheese plate upon arrival in the room. I would go to this hotel when ever I visit Nola!

Reviews.Title: “Worth It”
Reviews.Author: ktp098
Reviews.Content: First let me say this hotel is not cheap. Second, let me say you get what you pay for. Windsor could stand to be updated in a few areas, like the suite bathrooms and kitchenette area. But the complaints are minor. This is probably one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed at. And we travel often. The staff were incredibly friendly - and not in the way folks are friendly as part of thier jobs. They actually were friendly in that old southern charm way. That was really refreshing. The ambience, decor, room service, on site restaurant - all wonderful. We will be back as our kids are hooked on this place after one stay. You should be proud Windsor. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Windsor Court”
Reviews.Author: missmags
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at Windsor Court for over a decade whenever in New Orleans--not only best hotel in town, but one of best in country. Quality and friendliness of service is always excellent--and rooms are always clean, spacious and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel - but with some flaws”
Reviews.Author: jechho
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights, in a suite on the 10th floor. The location of the hotel is great, and the whole hotel has a luxurious feel (fresh roses in the lobby every day etc.).. However, the hotel does not get a 5 star rating from me. Having stayed in several top-notch hotels in the US, I expected more from a hotel that is supposed to be one of New Orleans finest. First of all, the suite I stayed in was rather outdated. From the other reviews here, it seems that only the Club floor suites/rooms have been refurbished the recent years. I do not see how a 5 star hotel can operate with this kind of difference (club vs. non-club rooms). The kitchenette must be from the 70s or so, the sofa horribly dated and worn and the hot water system did not work well in the evenings (had to wait ten minutes before the water was warm enough for a shower). Secondly, I understand that prices on everything on a hotel like this is higher than usual. But charges like 5.50 dollar for a black coffee at breakfast is IMO just too much. Valet was 32 dollar, which is acceptable I guess if its quick and efficient. But at least once during my stay, I had to wait outside for my car for like 15 minutes, even though I had called well in advance from my room. All in all, there is a lot of positive things to say about this hotel, but it need some improvements to stand out as a real top-end hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: Beanaboo
Reviews.Content: Love the Windsor ! From the moment you drive into their courtyard to the time you leave - you feel welcomed, appreciated and like family. Rooms are comfortable, food is great,Polo Lounge is exceptional - service, libations and snacks. Can't beat the location - near everything - and safe entrance and exit.

Reviews.Title: “Still nice”
Reviews.Author: aragornsgirl
Reviews.Content: I found out the hotel was purchased by new owners last year. The rooms are in need of updating and the desk clerk said they were going to start that in January, 2011. That said, it's still my favorite hotel. The service is still impeccable. The afternoon tea is still worth enjoying.

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE BEST..... A REAL FIND”
Reviews.Author: cindiaustin
Reviews.Content: Celebrated my daughters 16th birthday....Wanted a great place and read revews online. I was so pleased with the hotel and the staff and the food was also delicious. Our overall stay was superior. I would highly reccomed this hotel to anyone. My daughter decribed it as beauiful and ritzy. You will certainly enjoy this... It's at the top of our list..... Enjoy JDP Austin

Reviews.Title: “Delta Sigma Theta Sorority”
Reviews.Author: WFHBS
Reviews.Content: On a scale of 1-10, I give Windsor Court 10++++++ My stay from July2 9-Aug5,2010 was superb. Everything and everybody involved with the hotel were great.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in NOLA. Easy.”
Reviews.Author: Silent Crow
Reviews.Content: There are very few occasions where I'm thrilled to check into a hotel. The Windsor Court is always one of those great exceptions. The rooms are glorious. Large. Decorated with old-school New Orleans luxury charm. Sweeping views. Great beds. Balconies. It is NOT a modern (sterile) hotel with super-modern rooms. It is instead, an older hotel with the kind of charm that makes an impression. When you wake up, you don't wonder which Hyatt you've been sleeping in. You know you're at the great Windsor Court. The service is always friendly and attentive, from management, concierge, wait stafft, valet on down. On my last visit I had booked MANY (like 40) rooms, and as one might imagine, I was worried there may be some unhappy campers for some unknown reason. Not a single complaint. Quite the contrary. Everyone was thrilled. I would wager to say, our group likely pained the hotel far more than they would ever be kind enough to let on. They were simply gracious in every regard, all the time. The restaurant is expensive, but truly fantastic, with a world-class wine list. The hotel is off the quarter, so it remains far quieter than the other high-end hotels, though it's a comfortable walking distance to whatever trouble you wish to get in... I stay in hotels all the time, and the Windsor Court remains one of my very favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: edwardsteena47
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Court Hotel is the most guest-friendly hotel we have ever enjoyed. The afternoon teas are not offered anywhere else that we know of. The art, decor, and warmth of employees exceeds all in their field.

Reviews.Title: “1st class hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsLifeofRiley
Reviews.Content: I knew I was on vacation as soon as I walked in the door. The staff is incredible and very willing to help in whatever way they can to ensure you have the best possible stay. We had a 2 bedroom suite on the Club Level that was awesome with both city and Mississippi River views and balconies. Loved going to the Club Lounge for (free) cocktails and hor d'oerves every evening. (for those staying on the Club level. Also breakfast.) It is a luxury hotel with elegant and traditional interiors. It is not your hip, trendy, contemporary hotel. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: marksanchez6
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently went to NOLA for a quick little getaway. The hotel is in a great location and exudes old school charm. The staff was helpful and they had a nice bar serving cool cocktails which we enjoyed before going to to dinner. The rooms are a great size but could use a little updating but overall a wonderful experience and the price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Delightlfully surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: zuzu35
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a last minute to New Orleans on Memorial day weekend. We booked online using a search engine, and got a great rate. When we checked in, we were worried that our rate would be frowned upon by the staff, but have to say we were delightfully surprised by our guest room. We had a new tv, with dvd player, balcony, totally beautiful bath. Our view from the bed looked out on the river! We were treated like guests in the presidential suite. We have since stayed at the Ritz and will choose Windsor Court for our upcoming visits. Don't be intimidated by the luxury!

Reviews.Title: “What oher hotels strive for....”
Reviews.Author: ThaFonz
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Court is what others strive for. Sure, many New Orleans hotels have similar appearances, but what the WC offers excells at every level. My wife, who accompanies me when traveling, is very particular and has a keen eye for detail. Elegant , personable and above all clean and comfortable. It does not get any better than this for luxury accomadations in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “WOW What an excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 56003Pat
Reviews.Content: My family and I celebrated my 60th birthday in New Orleans and we stayed at the Windsor Court Hotel. What a great experience, from the manager to the staff, it was a great experience. Everyone went out of the way to make our stay the best. I don't think you could find a better hotel anywhere. We will return with pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “For us, the biggest asset of the Windsor Court is its staff.”
Reviews.Author: WR-Arkansans
Reviews.Content: We like everything about this hotel. For us, the location is ideal. Itâ€™s a quick walk to the French Quarter but far enough away from the crowds and noise. The pool and fitness center are tops. The lobby is beautiful, and it is worth an hour to two just to stroll around the lobby, second floor and other public areas, including the elevators, to view the beautiful artwork. The suites and rooms are spacious, and while they may not be newly redone, we have found them to be elegant, traditional and clean. We have read that plans are underway for updating televisions, bathroom fixtures and the mini-kitchens. We have stayed on the club level and non-club level. While accommodations are nice at both, the club lounge and perks are a real treat if itâ€™s in your budget. We have also taken advantage of specials in the summer that made the hotel an affordable value. For us, the biggest asset of the Windsor Court is its staff. Whether it was a manager, concierge, housekeeper or bellman, each of them went out of their way to make our stay extraordinary. We were treated like royalty. While no place is perfect, we have little to complain about at the Windsor Court. We would have a hard time staying anywhere else in New Orleans and hope to return again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Picturesque”
Reviews.Author: WendyBBroussard_LA
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, quaint hotel located within walking distance to most major attractions. Suites were very spacious and the service was excellent....in particular... the concierge desk.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Brockwiser
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay here it had been many years since my last stay. The hotel was elegant and the service staff very attentive. We had a full suite and it was nice, was expecting the dated formal furnishings. The only down points were the nightly parking fee of $32 bucks and they should really upgrade their televisions. This is a good spot, close to Harrah's. Always feel like a VIP when I am at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrm3
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and had a wonderful time. The rooms were beautiful and very clean, and the service and staff were exceptional. The location was convienient to the French Quarter and right across the street from the casino. There is a large pool and fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Royalty"”
Reviews.Author: virminator
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the Windsor Court in New Orleans. We were treated like royalty. Everything surpassed our expectations. The staff was courteous, professional, friendly, helpful, and very accomodating at all times. Our full suite had a magnificent view of the Miss. River. It was very spacious and well-appointed. Afternoon tea was a delight! Having Mother's Restaurant nearby was an added bonus as well as being close to the Shops at Canal Place and Harrah's. The pool was clean and had comfortable lounge chairs. Also, the poolside service was very nice. Breakfast was delicious both days. The Polo Lounge was an added pleasure at the end of the day and was very cozy!! We look forward to our next stay at the Windsor Court.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time and they made us feel special”
Reviews.Author: mapd
Reviews.Content: The service was wonderful and the manager was there on hand ready to help in any kind of way. The room was very clean and they kept it clean during our stay. The location was perfect for the event were in town for. Shopping is just across the street and the trolley is not too far. The think I liked the best was the service the staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “If you want "cookie cutter" luxury-don't stay here-”
Reviews.Author: quinnsgal
Reviews.Content: but if you you are looking for rooms that feel more like home than a hotel room, than this might be the place for you . I do agree that some of the rooms could use some updating and some modern touches(direct cinema, newer tvs), however, I liken the Windsor Court to your favorite great aunts house-the one who has the beautiful home that you have been going to since you were a child. As you were growing up you loved going to visit and loved the rich fabrics, lovely furnishings and warmth it all conveyed. As you grew older, the furnishings all still stayed the same-the lovely drapes, the one of a kind artwork-and while your own taste evolved, you still loved visiting your aunts home-even though some would call it dated-but to you it was warm and comforting. Some travelers prefer their" luxury" to be more along the lines of downright gaudy or more minimalist-I consider it a luxury to be somewhere that it makes it feel like you are at home. To me, the Windsor Court does that. The staff have always been nothing but courteous, and the facilities are always extremely clean. I have stayed here with children, a dog, and also with just my husband-and enjoyed my stay each and every time-

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel with attentive service”
Reviews.Author: RoadFoodWarrior_1994
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is convenient (especially for gamblers), the rooms are huge and the service is delivered with courtesy and style. The bed and bedding is luxurious. The decor is comfortable and subtle - the hard-edged and colorful expressions found in a modern boutique would be inconsistent with stately posture. Having written that, it could use a refresh/modernization (i.e. the TV console that would elevate from a box at the foot of the bed).

Reviews.Title: “Sorry rooms, poor service. Really did...”
Reviews.Author: busorap
Reviews.Content: Sorry rooms, poor service. Really did bot feel like a very premium experience. Very unclean place. Thy didn't even do our beds without us calling.

Reviews.Title: “The Windsor Court, an outstanding hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Flyingdutchman7442
Reviews.Content: Overlooking the Mississippi River at the edge of the French Quarter, one is greeted in a bautifully planted courtyard by a small cadre of attendants who garciously provide a warm welcome That welcome is followed by what appears to be standard VIP treatment for the average guest at the reception desk. My suite lacked no amenities and the housekeeping staff from room preparation to turndown was very efficient. The luncheon buffet topped anything I have previously experienced in a hotel. It is spectacular. Upon departure the doorman asked if we wanted a taxi. When a limo appeared I paid little attention to it until called by name by the driver. The charge to go to the airport was the same as it had been for the traditional taxi when we arrived. I am telling all my friends headed to New Orleans, do not miss staying at the Windsor Court. It deserves five stars without a five star price..

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasonish elegance and spaciousness-excellent value”
Reviews.Author: emergencyvacation
Reviews.Content: Delighted with the decor and spaciousness of the full suite. Stylish and comfortable common rooms including bar and tea room on main floor. Great pool and deck. Great location. We walked to almost everywhere we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Service is top notch”
Reviews.Author: mellykins153
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Windsor Court is the reason why I consistently stay in this hotel when I have business in New Orleans. On my most recent trip, I left an item in my room when i checked out and was completely unaware that I had done so. The staff tracked me down and mailed it to me. This is but one example of their willingness to make their guests feel special. The lobby and grounds are beautiful. The room is well appointed and comfortable, although the kitchenettes need to be modernized. Best of all, turn down service includes chocolates and pralines.

Reviews.Title: “not so much”
Reviews.Author: erdocmdca
Reviews.Content: Inconsistent and dated. First, we explicitly requested a king bed and were given two doubles on arrival -- we said no, so with a little waiting, they moved us into a king bed. Very spacious room; living room area, separate bedroom through french doors, powder room, bathroom with toilet/bidet, tiny kitchenette (no coffee making supplies or equipment). The good: if you like old-south style with floral curtains, fabrics, antique-looking furnishings, hunting-scene paintings, etc, it's great; charming even. The hallways are very elegant and the entry is garnished with a huge floral arrangement -- probably 200 roses in a giant vase. The room was also quiet, despite the fact that we were on the third floor. The one exception was when the maid woke us up at 9am on Saturday by ringing the bell. We couldn't have put out a do not disturb sign, because there wasn't one in the room. Had to ask for one. The bad: the heavy curtains missed about 2 feet to close the gap, so the room was never dark. Old cheap giant-tube TV's (we had to ask for a remote). Although charming in some ways, the room was extremely dated, frayed around the edges with sorely needed upgrades. When we needed a remote control and a do not disturb sign, there was no answer at either the front desk or operator, so we finally called the concierge. Sunday morning, the coffee service ended at 9am! The restaurant wasn't open yet, so there was no option for coffee! On a Sunday morning! The good part was that when we found kitchen staff, they graciously put together a tray with some leftover coffee and sugar/cream for us. Location is good. Two blocks to the quarter; almost directly across from Harrah's, if you're into gambling. Kudos for FREE Wifi! Any hotel that charges more than $200/night should never nickel-and-dime you for 15 bucks for WiFi. All in all, we paid a premium for a very mediocre delivery. Needs work.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: kiddoc1940
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in a suite on the Club Floor. Our accomodations were beautiful and spotless. The staff was uniformly pleasant and helpful, particularly the club concierge. We had a great buffet lunch in the hotel dining room. The swimming pool was spotless and much larger than most hotel pools. We could see the difference between it and the pool at the "W" next door from our room. Highly recommend the hotel. We'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, stately old-fashioned class and truly magnificent service!”
Reviews.Author: Travelmaestro77
Reviews.Content: Four days in this magnificent and classic older property left us feeling pampered, relaxed and full of appreciation for service not often discovered in the hospitality industry. Do not anticipate inexpensive deals. This hotel is for the discerning and affluent traveller who appreciates the finer things in life! The suites were roomy, elegant with large and well-equiped bathrooms. The bedroom, with hidden TV and elegant 4-poster bed, was beautiful and very comfortable. The staff took care to ensure our safety as we were exploring the French Quarter. It was a treat to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bauer80austin
Reviews.Content: Carpet in our suite was filthy. Blood on one of the sheets and we are pretty sure it was not ours. Just not as nice as I expected. Called for ice and it took 45 minutes to get it. Staff was very friendly though.

Reviews.Title: “update it!”
Reviews.Author: Tahloola
Reviews.Content: The decor was dated. The staff was friendly. They need to update the decore and furniture and it was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “You would think a club level room in a...”
Reviews.Author: izzafoodie
Reviews.Content: You would think a club level room in a luxury hotel would be a luxury experience. Not at the Windsor Court. Room not ready at 3 pm check in. Ice bucket with leftover water from the last guest (forget ice!). OLD tv that is on a cart that has to be moved. Flat sheets that aren't even tucked in well. And a general "I don't give a rip" attitude. REALLY?!! And Why should I pay you this kind of money for this room??

Reviews.Title: “we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: LizEllicottCity_MD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Windsor Court for a long weekend last week. We had a beautiful suite and enjoyed excellent service. Our request for a tub mat and an extra blanket were met with great speed. We also appreciated the turn down service in the evening, accompanied by chocolates or pralines. We enjoyed drinks in the Polo Lounge and appreciated the soothing piano music in the lobby greeting us after the bustle of the French Quarter. We love visiting New Orleans and will definitely make the Windsor Court our base of operation in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel and Responsive Management”
Reviews.Author: skpke
Reviews.Content: Terrific hotel. Close to all the action and very quiet room with spectacular view of river. Small problem with reservation - my fault.. David T. Manager was entirely gracious and accommodating. I look forward to my next stay @ Windsor Court.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sandyoconnor01
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 48 hour trip to the Windsor Court Hotel in New Orleans, Louisiana. I had been a long time fan of the Windsor Court having stayed there numerous times before and since Katrina. A double bed suite was reserved on the Club Level. The first suite (at almost $400 a night) had a filthy carpet with visible dirty shoeprints. After complaining, we were immediately offered another suite. While the carpet was cleaner - the mold on the walls near the ceiling in both the living room and dressing room was disconcerting. The wallpaper was peeling and the bathtub took forever to drain. The cover on the wall to the airconditioner repeatedly kept falling off. Housekeeping was spotty. Sinks were not cleaned and replacement toiletries ignored.How sad. We found the Windsor Court "tired" and run down (allthough the lobby and Club Level are lovely)and definitely not worth $400 a night - even on the Club Level. My next trip to New Orleans will not be spent at the Windsor Court.

Reviews.Title: “They Need to Make Some Major Adjustments”
Reviews.Author: Mimi060
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a Birthday celebration with several girlfriends and stayed at the Windsor Court. This has always been one of our favorite hotels since it is so close to Harrah's Casino. We were very disappointed this trip with the condition of the rooms for the money that we spent. We paid extra to stay on the Club Level and expected a certain degree of amenties. The 1st room we were given was a mess. The carpet had muddy footprints, the bathroom was not very clean, the walls were scratched up and the wallpaper was peeling off. We were given another room that was not much better. There was very noticeable mildew on the living room ceiling and in the bathroom dressing area, the wallpaper was peeling off here too and the bathtub did not drain properly. We were told there were no other rooms to choose from on the Club Level with 2 double beds. The public areas of the hotel are lovely and the staff friendly but unable to address our concerns. Upon checkout I inquired when the hotel would be undergoing a renovation that would refresh and update (most rooms do not even have flat screen TV's). Was told maybe toward the end of the year that plans were still being discussed. Don't think I would return until it is! The rates don't warrant the experience!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review-some good, some not”
Reviews.Author: jennrn
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I just got back from NOLA and we stayed at Windsor Court for the last 2 nights of our stay. I was really excited to stay here and we booked through the Amex Platinum Fine hotels and resorts program. This got us a late check-out (which we didn't use, due to flight times), free breakfast each morning, and tea in Le Salon. The breakfasts were good-one day we went down to the Grill and one day we did room service-food was good both times. We did go to afternoon tea at Le Salon, which is always fun. We stayed on the club level with a river view suite. We liked the club lounge, which had great hors dourves and drinks in the evening. I know some people have said the rooms look tired or old, and I didn't find that to be the case-the decor is just more formal, and not as modern as some hotels you may see. The location is right across the street from Harrah's if you like to gamble (we do) and right off Canal street, and it's a very short easy walk to the Quarter. The location is great because you're not on Bourbon, but you're not far from it either. Here were my drawbacks about the hotel-we arrived on Sunday around noon (we stayed at Royal Sonesta with friends for the first part of the trip), and were not surprised that our room wasn't ready-it was 3 hours before their 3:00 p.m check in time. We were checked in, and told that a rush would be put on the room to be cleaned, they'd call us when it was ready, and in the meantime they would hold our bags. No big deal, we left and got some lunch and drinks in the Quarter. We came back to the hotel at 3:00 pm and were told that the room still wasn't ready, but that they would go ahead and put a rush on it to be cleaned. Exuse me? That should have already happened. It's not unreasonable to assume that at standard check-in time the room would be ready. We told them that this was supposed to have happened 3 hours ago-and we had a 4:30 reservation to get ready for. They did apologize and said that again, they would call when the room was ready. About 10 min later, it was, so I calmed down. Got to the room, and it was nice-but the conditioner in the shower had already been opened and used, and the ice bucket had melted water in it from whomever used it previously. Hmmmm.... The next day we left around 9:30 a.m. and got back into the room around 3 p.m.-and again, it hadn't been cleaned-we did ask the front desk what time that normally happened and they had it taken care of. So there are ups and downs to this hotel. Any issues we had were taken care of quickly (which is good), but at $310 a night, I felt like we shouldn't be having these problems.

Reviews.Title: “First class service”
Reviews.Author: Romrin
Reviews.Content: from the entrance of the hotel to the Club attendants service and amenities/ great location, and professional outstanding service

Reviews.Title: “Mostly positive experience”
Reviews.Author: edmondtraveler
Reviews.Content: Husband, teenage son and I stayed 4 nights, full suite club level. I booked this level due to the previous reviews of the older floors, and saw that these rooms have been renovated in 2007. The room was spacious, clean and there were no issues with any of the fixtures, furnishingsor housekeeping. The TV is the old square analog type, but I assume that is more due to the type of furniture it is in, that wouldn't hold a widescreen, therefore, not cost effective to replace furniture as well as TV's. Not there to watch TV, so not a big deal. Club level had coffee, soda, bottled water (still & sparkling) free all day, as well as evening hors d'oerves and breakfast. A couple of nights, this was our meal, as we had eaten so much during the course of the day. We selected this hotel, in the hopes it was quiet, and we didn't hear late night partiers arriving, etc. and we heard nothing, not even the rooms next door or hallways. Quietest hotel yet!! Our only issue was at check in. I knew we could not check in upon arrival at 10:30am, so we left our bags, and cell # to be reached when the room was ready. Returned at 2:30 pm and having received no call, I simply asked if the room was ready. The woman at the desk asked if someone called me, to which I said no, and she stated well, then it isn't ready. Fine, we sat in the lobby, right in front of the desk, and waited until 3pm check in time. No call.......waited until 3:45pm , watching others arriving and checking in, so when the woman walked away a moment, I sent my husband up to ask again. They told us it had been ready for 10 minutes! After all that, I asked if I could have an hour later check out (we had one of the most expensive rooms for 4 nights), and was told we could not. Fine,they are busy, however, while sitting in the lobby, I saw numerous people checking out well past 1 pm, so had I not been up front & asked, I guess I could have done so. This did not keep me from enjoying my stay, the location was perfect for us, and the other staff was friendly and gracious.

Reviews.Title: “great service, tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripindicular1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Windsor Ct for three of six nights planned and then decided to move to a fresher more recently updated hotel. We had a one bedroom suite on the club level. The club was used actively and there was a helpful concierge there as well. Our issues were primarily that the hotel is outdated. We were disappointed b/c we stayed here many years ago and were impressed at the time. In our room the make-up mirror was hanging off the wall revealing a gaping hole. The light switches had to be turned on and off manually on each lamp. There was a VHS and an older TV. We asked for a DVD player b/c we needed to watch a DVD and they did bring one. Carpeting was worn in public areas. There is no spa. There were no pay per view movies. We had to call housekeeping to clean at 5:00 after leaving the room at 8:00. On subsequent days they improved on this. Just things that you expect from a 5 star were not up to par. This hotel still has the reputation as the place where dignitaries stay. It is one of if not the most expensive in New Orleans. The location is convenient to both the French Quarter and the Convention Center. It definitely has character and the feel of New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Why wouldn't you like it?”
Reviews.Author: spillersm
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Windsor Court for a business function. From the minute we checked in until we left, we were at awe in the service and room we received. The rooms were like an elegant one bedroom apartment. Each day, the room was cleaned and the bed turned down. Staff was friendly and helpful. Plus, this hotel is about a 10 minute walk to the French Quarter. Close enough to walk, but far enough away from the rowdy crowd. Loved the hotel. Plus, I saw Whoopie Goldberg in the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in New Orleans Without A Doubt”
Reviews.Author: kecoco
Reviews.Content: Myself and 14 friends recently visited New Orleans to celebrate a 50th birthday. Eleven of us stayed at the Windsor Court in a total of 6 suites. Everyone loved this hotel. The accomodations were perfect..................great beds, comfortable furnishings, and very quiet for sleeping. No, the hotel is not decorated like a W or trendy South Beach hotel and yes the furnishings are not new but they are beautifully maintained and of the highest quality. The hotel dining, bar and service was outstanding...............and that comes from all 11 visitors who are pretty worldly travellers and have stayed in some of the finest hotels in the world. Windsor Court ............you are the best in New Orleans and thank you for making our trip so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel, elegant service and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Enterprise1401
Reviews.Content: My two daughters and I had an excellent stay at the Windsor Court Hotel in New Orleans. In-room dining is first class! The Windsor Court is located in the very best place and is close to everything. Our suite was quite large and comfortable. Also, it was wonderful to look over the city skyline from the balcony at night.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: company771
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be the gem of New Orleans, Its has really gone down since katrina. the rooms and hotel are very dated and in need of a serious make over. I feel im qualified to make that assement since i used to work their full time in the early 90's nothing has changed since then, the same carpet in the hallways, and the same paint on the walls the rooms are exactly as they were 20 years ago. the water pressure in my room for my bath and shower was very very week. one cheap flat screen tv in one room and a outdated box televison in the master bedroom with limited cable channels with no pay-per-view movie selection. i was there for the saints suberbowl final and im so glad they won, it helped ease the pain of my stay. the staff and service was great but they can only do so much.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite -- accommodations, staff, service, location.”
Reviews.Author: Expectant
Reviews.Content: I recently returned for my fifth stay at this lovely hotel. The Club Level rooms and the club lounge make for a truly special experience, whether for business or leisure. The service provided by the club lounge staff, in particular, was exceptional. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: frodomom
Reviews.Content: I really used to love this hotel but must say it has really gone downhill post Katrina. My friend arrived first and checked in and was given a horrible little room that was filthy with paint peeling, stained bedding and a dead plant in it (and I mean dead). Having had past lovely experiences with this hotel, I was shocked at the room she was given and complained to the front desk. I must say that they did accomodate by resettling us in a much better room with a nice view. Upon checking out, I discovered a mistake on my bill (overcharge) and called it to the attention of the gentlemen at the front desk and he requested my credit card again to allow correction. Unfortunately, he never gave me my card back and I had to call 3 days later once I had retraced my steps. Security had my card and offered to FedEx to my home which was agreed. A month later Windsor Court hit my friend's credit card with a $49 charge for the FedEx. When she complained, they removed the charge. Today, I noticed that it was charged to my account - Ridiculous. This was an exclusive, beautiful luxury hotel in New Orleans but is now a dirty, sad and dilapidated version of itself with to say the least, questionable customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: queen of belize
Reviews.Content: We stayed in New Orleans for new year's eve 2010 and chose the Windsor Court from a few high end hotels with rooms still available at time of booking. We stayed at the Windsor Court when it first opened in the 80s but during this stay we were able to better appreciate the Hotel's aesthetics. It is a very elegant and traditional hotel. Decorations are very English and in keeping with the theme. Holiday decorations were excellent. One of our party who stayed elsewhere was not even interested in seeing the hotel because she was not interested in what she perceived to be the decor. For the price, it was a great value. Easily worth three times the price in NYC. Service outstanding. My biggest complaint about the Windsor Court was the fact that I could not get coffee the first morning once I left my room. It is unacceptable that coffee cannot be had inside the hotel in the morning if you fall between the restaurant's breakfast hour and lunch hour. I ordered room service the next morning which I guess was the hotel's intent. In my mind there is no excuse for not having in-room coffee available. If I'm at this hotel I will spend enough money in the hotel so that in room coffee is not a concern. Very disappointing. Location used to be good but now is so-so because of the ginormous Harrah's casino smack dab across the street. Some will find this convenient but the casino is not an attraction for me. Morton's nearby was excellent and the French Quarter is an easy walk. The World War II museum is not far and a visit there is recommended. Also walked to Superdome for the Sugar Bowl and was easy walk. However, taxis are always available at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Huge rooms. Nice View. Terrible shower pressure.”
Reviews.Author: NoWhoDatHere
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the first time at the Windsor Court for three nights after Christmas. New Orleans was jumping as New Years Eve was approaching and the hotel was busy too. However, room service was delivered promptly, doormen were always there with a smile and an umbrella (nice touch). The rooms are very spacious and nice. We had a suite with a nice view of the river. The rooms are dated somewhat but that is part of the charm. However, the shower/tub combo needs an upgrade. The paint was peeling and the water pressure was so light that I could not get the shampoo out of my hair and I am a 40 year old man. It was the only drawback to an otherwise wonderful stay at a great hotel. We are returning in February 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Positive Experience Christmas week”
Reviews.Author: WAStraveler
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel and particularly professional, courteous staff. We had one of the regular hotel rooms -- not a full suite -- but it was lovely with a terrific large bathroom. While the decor was not "cutting edge", it was very handsome and in top shape, so I'm surprised by some of the comments. Also, the walk to the heart of the French Quarter is just 10-12 minutes, so very easy to access. Taxis everywhere as well. Appreciated the good complimentary coffee in lobby each morning and nice gym with good equipment. I only have one objection: breakfast prices are too steep!! The buffet is almost $30. Highly recommend the Windsor Court as a treat place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyable Xmas stay at Windsor Court Hotel in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: simom6
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 (parents and 3 adult children) were so happy to spend time in a city we had never visited. The Windsor Court Hotel made Xmas perfect for us. The suites are as large as our apartment in NYC and very graciously appointed. Although some furnishings were old that was part of the charm for us. The suite was cleaned each day and robes and slippers laid out for that special touch. Everyone on staff went out of their way to make this a Christmas worth remembering.

Reviews.Title: “DESPERATELY NEEDS UPDATING”
Reviews.Author: China2002
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Court needs to be updated and cleaned up.The rooms are large and comfortable but the carpets were worn, the kitchenette was about 30 years old, the bedskirts were hanging off, the sheets weren't clean and the mirrors were all covered in dust. The manager was helpful, however, there wasn't much he could do since all the rooms were the same.The concierge desk had 2 employees during our stay, neither was able to give us advice on restaurants other then a printed list. We found this especially suprising since every person we met in the city gave us a long list of their favorites. Other then a great location in a great city I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, About What You'd Expect”
Reviews.Author: beachedwhale75
Reviews.Content: Not too much wrong with this place. Great room with very little noise and a comfy bed. The TV remote didn't work but we didn't really care. If you are in New Orleans to watch TV you are in the wrong city. Room service was fast and high-quality, especially for late-night. Only complaints - had to call housekeeping for shampoo (twice). Also the concierge tried to steer us away from a restaurant (August) that ended up being one of the best I've ever been to - instead he recommended the hotel restaurant, which we thought was a kinda cheesy thing to do. But not a big deal. The walk to/from the quarter seemed long, but usually welcomed as a way to "walk off" the preceding debauchery.

Reviews.Title: “We love this wonderful hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Jackietfl
Reviews.Content: This was our first time back to the Windsor Court since the big storm. We were so pleased that this grand hotel has not lost any of it's charm. Our suite on the club level was all we could have hoped for. The housekeeping service and all the staff were superior as is fitting for a hotel of the quality. We love the location. It is possible to get anywhere either by foot or public transportation. TIP: YOU MUST GO TO THE WWII museum and do watch the movie. The American Sector Restaurant at the theateris a must! Thanks WCH for a most enjoyable stay. I can not wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back after renovation”
Reviews.Author: ijustwannahavefun
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large, but in need of refurbishing. Carpet worn, upholstery worn. Went to the bar for dinner and loved it. Staff was friendly. This is a quiet hotel, so it was the perfect location for us. You can still walk to French Quarter and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL 5 STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Aussiegal15
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this lovely hotel for 4 nights at the end of November. This was our firstt visit to New Orleans and the Windsor Court was a great introduction to this interesting city. We had a lovely suite which overlooked the front of the building. The bed was just so comfortable and the feather pillows were fabulous. We had a delightful breakfast each morning in the Grill Room and after the first morning the staff knew our names. We also ate in the Grill Room (which is the main restaurant) once and had a delicious meal and we had drinks and snacks in the Polo Club Lounge, again everyone was interested in where we had come from and nothing was too much trouble. The Hotel was beautifully decorated for Christmas which added to the ambience of this elegant hotel run by the Orient Express Company.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, dirty, curiously over rated”
Reviews.Author: Rex1NewYork
Reviews.Content: Why does this place rank so highly, so consistently? Our room was dank, shabby, and reeked of cigarette smoke (non-smoking room). When I notified housekeeping I was told that it would take hours to relocate us to a clean room, but they would be happy to send up an Atomizer to clear the air. It never came. I bought a scented candle ($20) in the gift shop. I am really not a picky person, but his happened to me pre-Katrina as well. I only returned because I assumed my bad experience then (actually it was much worse and I wrote management then directly) was a fluke. Sadly, it wasn't. On a happier note, New Orleans as a tourist destination is back and nearly as wonderful as ever.

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of paradise in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: vikster127
Reviews.Content: A gracious respite from the bawdy streets of the French Quarter, this hotel was everything you could ask for in a romantic get away. We had a spacious, beautifully appointed suite with a wonderfully comfortable bed. The hotel staff was exemplary, from the concierge to the housekeepers. We would come back here anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Warm Southern Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: saint22
Reviews.Content: We visited New Orleans for my birthday and we booked a three night stay at the Windsor Court Hotel. It was a truly wonderful experience. I arranged through the hotel concierge for airport transfer and our driver was ready for us when we arrived. We had a stretch limo and arrived at the hotel in the early evening. Check-in was extremely gracious. Our room was a Club Level Full Suite on the 21st floor with an amazing view of the Mississippi River. The room was beautifully appointed in a feminine style and the marble bathroom setup was spacious and luxurious. We were hungry after our journey so we went to the Club Level Lounge on the 22nd floor to dine. The food buffet was outstanding and we had a tapas dinner with cocktails and soft drinks. Even my fussy two year old enjoyed the dinner. Michael in the Lounge was friendly , warm and did a great job making us feel welcome. After dinner we retired to our room. The bed was extremely comfortable and there was no street noise from below. The next morning we had an early breakfast at the Club Lounge and the breakfast spread was just as impressive and delicious as dinner had been the night before. Service was again warm and friendly. The Club Level Concierge Ryan, who was gracious and helpful, suggested a restaurant for dinner that evening and gave us a map to help us explore the city. We visited the Cafe du Monde, Jackson Square, the French Market, the Riverwalk, the Aquarium of the Americas. We also took a carriage ride through the French Quarter and a ride on the Natchez Steamboat. After that full day exploring the city we returned to the hotel. We needed a cab to go to dinner so the doorman whistled aloud for a cab out on the street to proceed inside the hotel courtyard. Our doorman asked us where we were going and told the cab driver the name and address of the restaurant in a tone of voice that said, these are our people, take good care of them. It was at that moment that I knew that this was a truly great hotel. After dinner, it was a beautiful evening and we decided to stroll back to the hotel. The next day, after another wonderful breakfast in the Club Lounge, we took the St. Charles Streetcar out to the Audubon Zoo. The zoo was amazing and the kids loved it. Afterwards, we rode the streetcar back and arrived at the hotel in the mid afternoon. My six year old son and I went down to the pool on the 4th floor and enjoyed sitting in the hot tub. We had a blast talking and laughing. It was my birthday so we dressed for dinner and again our wonderful doorman whistled for a cab for us and we proceeded to Comander's Palace for dinner which was fantastic in every way. After returning to the hotel, we got the kids in bed and I went up to the Club Lounge and had a cocktail and printed out our airline boarding passes for our flight the next day. Checkout was again gracious and warm and our driver was in the lobby to take us to the airport. This time the car service sent a super stretch limo that my son was amazed with. As we rode to the airport, I gazed out the window reflecting on our fantastic experience in New Orleans. We arrived at the airport and departed for home. The Windsor Court Hotel was excellent in every way. It was beautiful and the staff was warm, courteous, friendly and professional. I highly recommend a stay at this truly wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Excellent, Excellent”
Reviews.Author: drewdc02
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at the Windsor Court, My friends and I visit New Orleans each year in November. By far, the Windsor Court is the finest hotel we have visited during our many trips to New Orleans. Our suite was beautiful, spacious, well maintained with a beautiful view of the river. The staff was extremely attentive especially Michael and Jerry in the club lounge. They both answered our many questions, and put us in the direction of many off the beaten path sights. The Windsor is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect-Perfect-Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Kittenfish9
Reviews.Content: We recently had a superior experience at the Windsor Court Hotel. We stayed in a full suite on the 21st floor with Club Level amenities. From making reservations months ago to final check-out,it was absolutely perfect for my family! Check-in was so easy,quick,and friendly. I was thrilled to learn that our suite was ready because we checked in about 4 hours early. We were entranced by the beautiful and sedate lobby,and we were quite impressed with the ultra speedy elevators. I was blown away by the fabulous view of the river from our room.I sat by the expansive bay windows in the bedroom for a long time each night enjoying the view! Our suite was HUGE and gorgeous. The living room and bedroom furniture was elegant. The wallpaper was cheerful and bright. We utilized the refrigerator in the kitchen area for the bottled water and soft drinks provided by the Club Lounge-very handy. The dressing area between the bedroom and beautiful marble bathroom was such a great size. It contained the large closet with safe,and also a nice vanity area with sink. We loved having that extra sink! The bathroom was also beautiful with plenty of space for your stuff. The bathtub/shower combo was very large-great shower! We were so spoiled by the staff in the Club Lounge. Really-is there a better staff in New Orleans? No request was too big or too small. We just loved having the option of eating a light breakfast overlooking the river scene,and being able to come back in the evening for another light meal if we were too tired to go back out.I agree with a previous review- Michael in the Club Lounge is fabulous! Oh-the swimming pool area has got to be one of the nicest in town. The pool itself is very large compared to other hotel pools in town.My daughter and I went swimming one night-the pool was nicely heated and the hot tub was divine!It was a beautiful evening. We had a fabulous time in the French Quarter,in the Garden District, and on a swamp tour,but our favorite part of the entire trip was our stay at the Windsor Court. We were sad to check out,but delighted to learn that we could come back later in the day to utilize the club lounge as we had a late flight out. This was much nicer than waiting around at the airport. Other things we loved-the beautiful,quiet courtyard at the front of the hotel-provided a nice separation from the noise of the city.We also enjoyed strolling around the hotel admiring their extensive art collection. Housekeeping was super! I can't wait to return. Thank you Windsor Court for providing my family with a superior quality vacation experience!

Reviews.Title: “Michael makes it”
Reviews.Author: nutmegger08
Reviews.Content: We just came home from a 4 day business/pleasure trip to one of our favorite cities, New Orleans. This was our first time staying at the Windsor Court and it did not disappoint! We had a beautiful room on the club level over looking the Mississippi River. The room had beautiful furnishings and was clean. The best part of our stay however was the show each night in the club level lounge. All I need to say is Michael is a one man comedy routine with a New Orleans flair, plus he was able to keep every table happy with filled drinks and food! In addition he was able to reccomend a restaurant to us in the city, which we think was hands down the best meal we had there. Michael is a true asset to this hotel! We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “alas, this once fine hotel is not so fine anymore”
Reviews.Author: dobbykins
Reviews.Content: We have been frequent guests of Windsor Court for about 14 years. Our past experiences were always fabulous and we never had enough good things to say about it, form the service, to the food, to all the attention to details that they once had. Unfortunately, our recent experience was a huge disappointment. Our room had stained carpeting and the bathroom shower had cracks and no safety bars or non skid mats. The housekeeping/room service was very erratic. We asked several times for some drinking glasses and only received champagne flutes, even after specifically calling for glasses or even just plastic cups. I finally went to the drugstore and bought my own plastic cups. The beds were still unmade and the room not cleaned several days until the day's end. The thermostat for the heat/AC was very difficult to control so we were either freezing or too hot. We had to call room service multiple times to have ice delivered after waiting up to nearly an hour for it. My husband also asked for a wake-up call one day and it never came. Good thing we woke up ourselves in time. The one good thing which still remains is the quality of their restaurant, the Grill Room. The food and service in it remain outstanding. We will sadly have to find a new favorite hotel in New Orleans for our next visits.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience with a few qualifications!”
Reviews.Author: PatWisconsin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at least 7 times at the Windsor Court, including the November following Katrina. We come to New Orleans now for our anniversary. By far it is our favorite hotel in New Orleans (better then the Ritz Carlton where we have also stayed.) Our junior suite was comfortable, although the radio didn't work and we had some problems with the TV. But then, you don't come here for much time in the room! We had requested a room on a higher floor with a view of the casino. We didn't get it and no excuse was offered. Unfortunately, the housekeeping services were a bit spotty--one night no turn down service. But the staff is always very welcoming. Breakfast in the Grill Room was wonderful! We had a continental breakfast included in the room rate but the staff didn't seem to care if we ordered off the menu and just paid the difference. An extra was the array of newspapers each day and the Sunday New York Times for the asking at the front desk. The Polo Room is also very clubby and they pour a good drink. Yes, we will be back next year and as long as we can get on a plane for the trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Aldo_Nola
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a club suite for 3 nights. Club lounge at WC beats Ritz, Peabody, Shelbourne hands down--great view and good snacks and well-stocked bar. Service was spot on. The suite itself underwhemed us...it's really just a room with sitting area and not an especially large one at that. Bathroom nothing special at all. However, linens were deluxe and the bed very comfortable. Polo Lounge is great spot for drinks, people watching and snacks. Braekfast in the Grill Room is very good--try the french toast. Common areas were well-maintained and clean. The staff was on their game the entire 3 nights we stayed. If the suite were more spacious or offered 2 separate areas we'd easily rate this 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: cvh7002
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Court Hotel was everything we hoped it would be. The service was exceptional and our room was lovely. Everyone made you feel welcome and comfortable in the quiet beautiful surroundings of their hotel. I would recommend this hotel and we will stay there again when we visit New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Horrible Room”
Reviews.Author: KnitterAnnapolis
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Junior Suite, Room 1006. Unmentionable stain on chair in living area, mildew on falling down drapes (held to the rod with rusty safety pins), mildew on outside shower curtain, uncarpeted hole in closet. The worst part was putting on the robe that was left on the bed during turndown and finding a lighter in the pocket. I don't smoke, and was traveling alone. The lighter worked, so either the robe was never washed, or it was a very sturdy lighter to have gone through the wash and still worked. The staff was great though, especially Adam, the concierge. I should have asked for a different room, but was too tired at checkin to fuss. I am also very itchy, but have not confirmed bedbug presence. Wouldn't surprise me though, given the state of the room. It REALLY needs updating.

Reviews.Title: “Windsor put the icing on the cake for first "big easy trip"”
Reviews.Author: TravandKim
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Windsor Court on our first trip to New Orleans. We usually take a couple of vacations a year--one to Mexico and one somewhere else. We will certainly be coming back to New Orleans and the Windsor. Three days were not enough to see the town and enjoy the luxury of the hotel. Requested a junior suite with a high river view. The room and view were excellent. Small balconey to see river, Harah's, Hilton, Lowe's, Westin and others. The rate for the room was certainly higher than most hotels but the package we selected included breakfast and valet parking. Great value. Great hotel. Great location. Great town.

Reviews.Title: “80th Birthday Celebration a Success”
Reviews.Author: someonespeanut
Reviews.Content: We recently celebrated my mother's 80th birthday in New Orleans. Our stay at the Windsor Court was stellar thanks to the staff who made us all feel welcomed . The only thing bad about the visit was that we all couldn't stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: culpe10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Windsor Court Hotel in August. The service was top notch. The room, which was an upgrade at check-in, was very spacious - about the largest suite I've seen. Shortly after checking in, the front desk called to see if we needed anything or had any questions. At night, the bed was turned down with robes, slippers, and pralines at hand. The only criticism was that some of the furniture was a bit worn. But, the hotel seemed to be in the process of updating those items. I would not hesitate to stay at the hotel my next time in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: mvf906
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hotels all over the world and I would put this hotel at the top of my top ten. Could not fault a thing (apart from not having a coffee machine in the room ! ) The staff were fantastic, especially the concierge, Jackie, who was excellent and the hotel felt like a 5 + star not a 4

Reviews.Title: “What a Beautiful hotel and great Staff, they go above and beyond your needs.”
Reviews.Author: GiGi9033
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Windsor Court for pre- wedding festivities. The Staff went out of their way to get us a suite that would accomodate our Bride and 8 bridesmaids to get ready for the wedding day . We stayed on the Club level which was an added bonus for us. In the morning there is breakfast and in the evening a cocktail hour with delicious snacks. My daughter and her new husband were also spending their wedding night there. They made the room a romantic setting like something you see in the movies... rose petals and champgne. Needless to say it was dream week-end for this new couple.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel to be pampered”
Reviews.Author: JacksonTraveler59
Reviews.Content: We spent my 50th birthday at the Windsor Court Hotel in New Orleans. We stayed on the club level in a recently refurbished junior suite. We have been to this hotel many times. The service is exceptional. Club has nice accoutrements, personal service and good food and beverage. We wholeheartedly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great pool, but their service is troublesome.”
Reviews.Author: YuliaG
Reviews.Content: Went to Windsor Court Hotel with a thought in mind to spend a relaxing weekend together. It was big mistake. Their '4 star 'service made our stay in this hotel a dissapointing one. There's no tag 'Do Not Disturb' available in this hotel, hence the serving personnel allows themselves to endlessly ring to your door with different suggestions of some services, we never asked for. After having refused several times in the evening, the morning after we were awaken by a ring on the door. Also, I'd like to point out, that after 1,5 ring to your door, whoever it is, the door to your room is being unlocked by a key, not waiting for a guest to open the door or, at least, to say something through the door. And after this unexpected morning 'alarm' we had to explain ourself 4 times to 4 different maids ringing on the bell , that we are not checking out till 1 PM. Our stay was horrible, if this is 4 star hotel, then let me argue with you! No privacy at all! Don't go there if you are planning a romantic weekend or a pleasant surprise for your loved ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, first class in every aspect.”
