Reviews.Author: MEGDAVE
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Court was recommended to us by American express versus the W next door, they hit the mark. A wonderful hotel just a block or so from the quarter. We've stayed in multiple hotels in the area and the Windsor Court surpasses all. A fabulous suite overlooking the river, great food, exceptional service. Definitely a must stay hotel while visiting NOLA. Our only regret is we are only here for one night. A special thanks to AMEX for the recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Just as advertised ... great room, great service, great food”
Reviews.Author: travelinlight58
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at the Windsor Court. I have been to New Orleans over 20 times. This is the best hotel I have stayed at in NOLA. Key Points: Great, Friendly Service - I usually stay at Hiltons, Starwood Hotels, Marriotts, etc. I find the service at many of these hotels to be OK, but I am many times left with the feeling that the service doesn't match the accommodations. That was not the case at the Windsor Court. The service was always profession and helpful. The staff went out of there way to be of assistance. Great Room - Stayed in one of the 800+ sq foot suites. Nice room. Had a fridge, microwave and a stove. The furnishings were a little dated, but the size of the room was great. I should note, that the rate I got was $240 which included full dinner for two at the Grill Room ... so I could handle the older furnishings for such a great rate. Great food. The Grill Room was excellent. Again, the room rate included the suite AND dinner for two at the Grill Room. Had steak & lobster one night and Shrimp the next. Both meals were really good. Great location. Just steps away from the French Quarter and a block from canal street and the streetcar. Across the street from Harras Casino. I would recommend this hotel, especially if you can get the rate with the meal included.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get any better”
Reviews.Author: Michael965
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Windsor Court Hotel the second week of July. I was very impressesed with not only the hotel, but the employees of the hotel. Everyone that worked there was very professional and very nice. We waited a little longer to get checked in, but it was really not a problem as Harrahs Casino was right across the street. We ate dinner in the hotel restaurant the nite we checked in and it was....well...exceptional. The food was cooked just right and the service was outstanding. We did have an issue with our computer/internet, so we called down to the front desk and they sent their on site computer guy up to our room. He was very knowledgable and got me working in no time. Come to find out it was a browser problem with my macbook. Over all the stay was VERY nice and everything we expected. Already have reservations for next year at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Old world atmosphere and service”
Reviews.Author: oldarmy1952
Reviews.Content: A real 5 star facility. Across a side street from Harrah's casino A short ten minute walk to the French Quarter Superb dining in the grill room Club level is extra nice. Nightly complimentary 'snacks' and bar enough for an evening, but there are too many great dining opportunities to not go out... K Pauls, Bacco for their bar-b-qued shrimp, Emerils, Mothers.... and on and on...All within walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: GreatTrips4Us
Reviews.Content: ...and I've stayed in some fabulous hotels! My husband was in town on business. Our son and I came along for fun. We LOVED the Windsor Court. We were there 3 nights; but, during that time, I felt like they knew us - we have never received such individualized attention. We loved the room. Supposedly, virtually all of their rooms are suites. Ours had a sitting room, separated from the bedroom by double french doors. It was quite lovely on our balcony overlooking the Canal Street area and the Mississippi River. The hotel restaunt, "The Grill" was wonderful! The best food we could find in New Orleans. I would definitely stay there every time I travel to New Orleans. I wish every city had a Windsor Court hotel! (By the way

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ChristianFamily
Reviews.Content: Windsor Court provided New Orleans charm, an outstanding stay, service, and food. I would recommend this hotel to any traveler wanting central access without the craze that comes with staying on Canal or in the Quarter. I was accompanied by my wife on a recent business trip to New Orleans. Having my wife with me, I spent a lot of time researching nearby hotels. While there were several to pick from at the end of Canal central to the Warehouse District and French Quarter, Windsor Court stood out from the pack. We were always greeted enthusiastically. The staff was extremely helpful (especially Elliot and Darcy). Breakfasts were great. We had an end of hall suite ##17 that was exceptional. It looked like it may have been a 1 bedroom apartment at some point given the kitchen area, oversize bathroom, huge living area, large bedroom, separate vanity area, and two balconies that had partial views of the river. No complaints. While the Windsor Court doesn't have a spa, it is conveniently located near several spas (e.g. Loew's). The pool area was a nice break from a hot afternoon. I heard repeatedly from locals that the Windsor Court is one of the finest hotels in the city. We agree.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the country”
Reviews.Author: Dorothy040
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. It is elegant and beautiful and a must stay if you travel to New Orleans. It is very hot in New Orleans in the summer, but we had a wonderful visit and were treated very well. We inquired about the good places to eat, and the staff went out of their way to offer recommendations and information about the Louisiana culture. We hope to visit the Windsor Court again soon.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely go back to the Windsor Court!”
Reviews.Author: TiciaAnn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a wonderful suite on the Club level and were mesmerized by the panoramic views of the Mississippi. The accommodations were spacious, elegant and best of all, homey and comfortable. The service was first class all around but was superior at the Club level where the staff greet and treat each guest as a VIP. My husband and I have had occasion to stay elsewhere in New Orleans over the past 40+ years. Suffice it to say that we keep coming back to the Windsor Court and have never been disappointed. We celebrated an early 41st anniversary with complimentary Chandon champagne awaiting us in our room at the Windsor Court and can't wait to return to celebrate #42!

Reviews.Title: “Windsor Court”
Reviews.Author: Kaufin
Reviews.Content: We choose the Windsor Court due to having visited the public rooms (beautiful) and dining room (outstanding). In today's connected world having wireless internet access is very important to me. I called the hotel and asked specifically if they had wireless access and they answered in the affirmative. It is also mentioned on their website. The connectivity throughout the hotel was awful and the staff seemed resigned to the wireless system not working. I was given an offsite 800 number to call and I think they were probably in India. Other guests also seemed to be having trouble. The bell staff and front desk were very pleasant and the breakfasts were excellent. The location is ideal; however, when I had to go outside the hotel to get on my computer I feel this is not the kind of hotel I wish to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service, superb food and great location”
Reviews.Author: rushstuart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from an holiday weekend at the Windsor Court Hotel. We could not have been more pleased with the location, room, service, and food. The service from the onset was exceptional with any and everyone extending every effort to insure that we enjoyed our visit. The view (you must ask for a river view from the 14th floor up) was great and the room was quite spacious with the bed so comfortable that it was hard to force oneself out of bed in the morning. I must hold my greatest praise for the food that we received for each of the two nights and three breakfasts that we had in the New Orleans Grill. The food was the best hotel food we have ever had and would stand up to the best restaurants that we have frequented on our trips. For night activities, the bar is also elegant with soothing music unlike that you get on Bourbon Street. We will definitely be using this hotel for future visits to one of our favorite cities.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: smk88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for our anniversary. The staff was nice, we were given champagne for our anniv. The lobby is very elegant and we had a wonderful, elegant lunch at the restaurant in the lobby. Because we booked through amex platinum we were upgraded to a suite; large, great view, but needed more than upgrading. The carpet had large stains, the corners of the sofa were ripped and dirty, We chose to move to the club floor for a premium because those rooms had been renovated. Much nicer but does not compare to the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service, needs a little updating”
Reviews.Author: pinklady06
Reviews.Content: We were in NoLa for Jazz Fest. Windsor Court is perfectly located just off Canal street. Easy walk to French Quarter and all the great restaurants. Most of the big name performers stay here during jazz fest...ran into Bon Jovi in the lobby! There is a great 2nd floor bar that is never crowded. The staff is beyond helpful! The rooms are spacious but are in need of updating. All the decor and furniture is a little dated and run down. That aside, great place for location and bar alone!

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: BusyTravelerG
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Windsor Court for a conference. It's in desparate need of renovation. While the room was very roomy everything in it needed to be replaced. The carpet was old and stained, the sofa had a very large stain and the bedding seemed very old as well. Oddly enough, there was no mattress pad on the bed. The bottom sheet was directly on the bare mattress. Ick. I stayed here once before about 15 years ago and found it very charming and nce. Time has not been kind to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a beautiful retreat with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: sanfrann
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed at the windsor court hotel in between the french market festival and the jazz fest, seeking some sort of a balance between those coming to new orleans to party, and those coming for the cultural sites and sounds. we found a very well-located, peaceful, and welcoming site in the windsor court. from the bellmen to the front desk to those serving in the polo lounge and the restaurant, each and every employee was friendly, genteel, and exceptionally service-oriented. we were always greeted warmly wherever we went in or out of the hotel. our room was quite large, a full suite, and included a kitchenette, large living room with desk, dining table in front of the window overlooking the Mississippi river, couch and club chair. the style was quite southern, yet cozy; no modernist touches here. the bedroom was also large, and the separate dressing room and sink area were equipped with makeup mirror and large counter for toiletries. the tvs were old-style, but not to quibble - they worked perfectly well to watch the news reports, as we were not in this city to sit in the room and watch tv! the conceirge desk gave us many dining options, and each one we checked was exactly the type of food we had requested. meanwhile, the food at the upstairs restaurant was absolutely wonderful - the appetizers all sounded so good we ended up ordering 6 of them for dinner instead of entrees, and got 6 different flavors instead of 2. our waiter here had returned to new orleans after living somewhere else and he was a perfect gentleman and also an interesting person in his own right. we were within walking distance from emeril's, herbsaint, august, and cochon restaurants, and the quarter was about 4 blocks away. we always felt safe in this neighborhood, which borders on the warehouse and cbd. i can't say enough about this wonderful place - if you are looking for up-to-the-minute, this is not it. if you don't mind elegant, this is it. i can't fail to mention the museum-quality paintings on every available wall space - they are gorgeous and the feel of a museum in your living room can't be beat. he pool area was also quite nice and with a view of the Mississippi that was thrilling in itself! out initial expectations were surpassed. are you there yet?

Reviews.Title: “Romantic hotel in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: ConDMedic
Reviews.Content: When we arrived there was this huge display of roses in bloom.. the whole lobby smelled of roses. The service was excellent, from the door man, check in, to room service. We booked a junior suite with balcony. The room was spaciuos & bright. It was nice to have french doors separating the bedroom & living room. The bathroom was also very large. Enough room for 2-people to get ready and not be on top of each other. Stocked mini bar and snacks - beer was reasonable $5 ea, but a candy bar was about $3. We ordered room service twice and both times was great ! Once for in room desert which was $10 cheese cake with fruit, then for coffee and baked goods in the morning. We woke up early and they brought our coffee right away eventhough it wasn't due for another hour. They set it up by the balcony and we had a nice morning drinking coffee and the baked goods were excellent. The buffett breakfast was a bit pricy at $28 p/p, and we heard people complaining about the service as we walked up. So we went down to The Court of Two Sisters on Royal St. The breakfast is the same price, good service, great food, and a live jazz band ! Our Server even gave us a lesson on how to eat crawfish. Overall the hotel was beautiful, clean and exactly what I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Good But Uneven Experience”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler016
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 12th trip to JazzFest; we've stayed in almost every 4 and 5 star hotel in NOLA. Our stay at the Windsor Court had both highlights and lowlights. Despite it looking very grand, the preponderance of green marble, old fashioned sofas, and library-quiet atmosphere rendered the lobby slightly stuffy and outdated. It is an almost hilarious contrast with its next door neighbor, the W (where we stayed last year), where they try almost too hard to be hip. Location is great, and the pool and gym were both very nice. Our junior suite was spacious, clean and comfortable, the bed was heavenly, but oddly, only 2 pillows for a king bed. Furnishings were a little tired, but still nice enough. Bathroom was very average (my towels at home are better) with low water pressure - a real bummer when trying to rinse off the Fairgrounds grit. Our biggest disappointment was we could not get full closure of the drapes, no matter how I tried to gerry-rig them. As a result, we awoke every day at sunrise, because sun was streaming in our room through the openings in the drapes - not a good thing in such a late-night town. I asked for eye masks, and the front desk replied they had none. This may not be a problem for many, but it was a huge problem for us. We have not experienced this problem at any other hotel we have stayed at in NOLA. We dined at the hotel twice, for breakfast and for brunch. The breakfast menu was creative and delicious. Service was great, and the meal was delivered promptly. The brunch menu was equally adventurous and delicious. Unfortunately, it took almost 2 hours for them to serve the three courses we ordered. The room was not busy - we could really not understand why the service was so insufferably long, and no one bothered to explain or apologize for the ridiculous delay. My overall impression of the hotel is that it is geared to the 60+ traveler who is early to bed, early to rise, has nothing but time on their hands, and likes traditional, clubby, quiet, and slightly stuffy surroundings. I would recommend, but only to someone who fits the above description.

Reviews.Title: “No big deal, just not what you expect from 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: c4pet0wn
Reviews.Content: We were considering the W but based on reviews from T.A we decided to go with the Windosr Court. Upon first arrival I was already questioning this "4 star" rating of this hotel. We checked in with the front desk and we not directed to the elevators nor instructed on how to get to our hotel room. This is comon practise at ANY other hotel but I guess the Windsor Court is exempt. The hotel agent who checked us in simply returned to the phone call he was on when we arrived at his desk. No big deal, just not what you expect from 4 stars. The hotel is beautiful, its location is great and innitial appearance of our room was very nice. Valet service was speedy and the concierge was helpful. Thats about as postive as this review gets. The room was clean upon entering but upon closer inspection (room corners, counter tops and carpet all revealed left behind memiors from travelers past. We would have liked one king bed but were presented two doubles (this was noted in the reservation and is acceptable) however one of the two beds was missing its top cover??? The 2nd completed bed had the obligatory folded robe and slippers so how house keeping missed this is beyond me. No big deal, just not what you expect from 4 stars. Right before leaving to hit the town we decided to have a drink in our room. I grabbed the ice bucket and headed down the hall on my quest to fine the elusive ice machine. This hotel has in room Ice service. No big deal, made the call and in room ice service was promised "right away". 40 mins passes and we are still iceless. Finally it showes up in a giant sack which is handed to me.(side note: The next day I made the mistake of calling for ice again, 30 mins pass AGAIN with no ice. I walked downstairs and offer to pickup the ice myself to stress my dissapointment. I was promised ice and two cups immediately. The door bell rings, ICE (CHECK) Cups (NOPE) No big deal, just not what you expect from 4 stars. Upon leaving the room that night we discovered the toilet was non functional. This was remedied with a call and was repaired upon our return that evening, That same night we tried room service wich was prompt, courteous and tasty. The next day we went and did our day trips and returned to a clean room but out plates were still there from the night before. I missed the note stating to call to have your plates picked up which I then did before we left our room that evening to hit the town once again. Upon our return that night the plates were STILL there. No big deal, just not what you expect from 4 starts. The next morning is where I realized just how poor housekeping was. Our "plastic" drink cups were STILL not replaced nor were the stir straws. Shampoo and body wash were not replaced either, I was left filling the 3/4 empty ones from the day before with water to make ends meet and have a cleansing shower. Our minibar was not restocked either. No big deal, just not what you expect from 4 starts. Our last night we pre-cleaned and organized our items to make it somewhat easier for the housekeeping staff to get their job done. We left and called the frot desk to have them send up housekeeping while we were at dinner. We took our time at dinner, 2.5 hrs, and we returned to the same room untouched room. So our checkout morning consisted of stale sheets, 1 fresh towel to share, no shampoo and no body wash. BIG deal and NOT what you expect from 4 stars. This stay at the WindSORE Court hotel was not 4 starts unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Very Charming, Elegant, Comfortable and Fun!”
Reviews.Author: RhondaHR
Reviews.Content: We had a group come out for an annual get-together. Most of us had never been to NOLA for Mardi Gras so it was hard to fall asleep with all the bands marching by past midnight. But "when in Rome"...right? So it added to the mystique. Our rooms had beautiful French style decor, the beds were sooo comfortable and the towels nice and soft. Perfect relaxing end to an adventure filled day. Our lounge bartender, Michael, was THE ABSOLUTE HIGHLIGHT of our trip. We saw him every night and his accent (dialect?) was marvelous. Now we were really experiencing New Orleans. He also spoke French and was so courteous with our group. We felt really special! Oui Oui!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: james zito
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel a great deal and like to stay in very nice hotels. Windsot is one of our favorites. Everything about it is 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, Tired dirty rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Travelsouth1
Reviews.Content: I just stayed for the weekend in room 1415. I booked a suite for a friends wedding. The staff was very nice and the location is great and quiet. The suite is huge and much like an apartment but in need of a good cleaning and remodel. Everything is tired and dingy. Draperies were torn from the rods in two places and did not work well. There was black mold growing in the shower grout, and the linens on the HARD bed were way past use. The bedspread no longer matches the shams and the walls were actually dusty. TVs with built in VCR are past having a clear picture and shockingly out of date. NOLA always has a certain shabby chic appeal, but The Windsor Court has just become shabby and not in a good way. I hate the fact that a hotel with such a reputation has been let go to the point that its just sad. The meeting rooms of the Windsor Court hint at its past glamour, but the rooms tell the tarnished truth.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a true gem.”
Reviews.Author: Trudyrand
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Windsor Court for 2 nights including my birthday. They gave us a lovely room overlooking the Mississippi River with a fruitbasket for the occasion. The bartender, Roger, is considered one of the best in the world and the honor is well-deserved. And Adam, a concierge, is one of the friendliest and most helpful we have ever encountered (this includes some of the finest New York hotels). While we have stayed in other hotels in New Orleans, the Windsor Court is now our favorite, by far.

Reviews.Title: “Stop reading reviews and go already!”
Reviews.Author: ValleyMD
Reviews.Content: One thing that becomes evident on this site is that if you read enough reviews on anywhere, you'll never go. So stop reading reviews now--you have found the best place to stay in New Orleans. It's nice to see another positive recent review from an LA guy, since I think New Orleans is nothing less than LA's next Las Vegas with better food. I'm not some hotel shill you see all over the place here. See my review of the hotel Wynn a few months ago--I have recently been to both Las Vegas and New Orleans, and I can tell you New Orleans as a destination wins hands down. And if you like to gamble, Windsor Court has Harrah's RIGHT ACROSS THE STREET. Wow, all that and high tea (Thursday through Sunday). And when you go to N.O., you want to stay in the Windsor Court. The hospitality, the room, the location, even the pool were all top notch, better than Wynn. They can't do enough for you. These guys "get it." See, New Orleans is actually in decent economic shape, with an unemployment rate that would make Schwarzenegger envious, but I don't see the national prominence yet. Its influence is regional. The way this town is going to recover its big, national tourism reputation is one guest at a time, one family at a time. Convince enough of us that there isn't Mississippi mud running through the streets, and we'll tell our friends and neighbors, never mind the whole internet. I think they understand this at Windsor Court. I can tell you, the central portion of N.O. is pretty much as I left it in 1998. Except for Antoine's and K-Paul's (neither of which I particularly miss), the place is back to baseline. Muffaletta at Central? Check. Camellia Grill? Check. Cafe du Monde? Did it ever close? Emeril's? DItto. Palace Cafe? Check. By the way, the kids had a pretty good time in New Orleans, and we felt safe in the city. The place was crawling with cops. Nice job, NOPD. Children's Musem, Insectarium, trying new foods, streetcar, Audubon Park, Tulane campus were highlights for the family. Also, WC has a decent pool, heated nice n' toasty and also saltwater(!), but no waterslide, so go to Orlando for that, last time I counted there's like a billion of them over there. In fact, if you have the kind of kid that will only stay in a hotel with a water slide, then you really shouldn't come to New Orleans. Ever. You know, Uptown looked pretty good also. Audubon Park is as nice as I've ever seen it. Ok, a minor nit--I would have liked working internet access in the room--it was supposedly free, but I couldn't get it to work. I haven't had much luck with "free" internet at any hotel, really, so no major loss. I thought the room was lovely, comfortable, nicer than my house, clean, and well-designed. It's also a terrific value right now, with rooms to be had for $209 for this coming weekend and the famous French Quarter Festival. We checked while we were there, because we were considering extending our stay a few days! Shh, don't tell anyone! Honestly, people, New Orleans really isn't "about" free in-room internet, or what kind of TV you have in your room, or a microwave. You really want a microwave in your room? With Palace Cafe less than 500 yards away? Why did you come to New Orleans? Ok, guys, renovations are not on the agenda, so forget the marble bath and separate shower. There is a bidet, which I suppose could be used as a shower, if you are so inclined. Did you read the New York Times this week? A lot of these fancy joints will be fortunate to stay open in the next year or two. I am hoping very strongly that Windsor Court is one of the survivors. It really is a different level of hotel than you are used to, possibly unique in all the country. You should really go--now stop reading reviews already!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with an exquisite staff”
Reviews.Author: emacstudios
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed only a couple of nights and I have to say that the staff is impeccable. They are so friendly and cater to your every need. Although we had access to the Club Lounge, the morning and evening concierge were simply delightful to talk to. Very helpful and extremely courteous. The gentleman serving the drinks and food in the evening went out of his way to make my wife and I's time there very special. Everything there was certainly "A+" material. I did have ONE problem. When the reservation was placed, it should have been for a room with a King sized bed. Unfortunately we ended up with 2 Double Beds. Even though the hotel ran out of rooms with King beds (they were all booked up), we still made the best of it. My wife and I can't wait to go back. Thanks for the wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Windsor Court is a Solid Four Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lovz2Travel
Reviews.Content: Windsor Court is the best hotel in New Orleans, yet it has not reached the mark of a five star hotel. The concierge, front desk, bell men, and restaurant waiters/waitresses exhibit true overall southern hospitality. The layout of our full suite was very good (and comfortable) and the value was excellent. The location was close to French quarter and local attractions, yet far enough to get some quite. However, considering that it is the only hotel in New Orleans with four mobile stars I was expecting some more details. For example I was expecting higher quality bath towels, separate tub and shower, and higher quality toiletries (such as the molton brown that was used in the public restrooms). Accent pillows on sofas or on needs (as shown online) would have been a nicer touch. Overall we had a wonderful experience and would highly recommend this property to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “They Lie!!!”
Reviews.Author: EATON1
Reviews.Content: I stopped staying at The Windsor Court because the rooms were shabby and outdated and the bathroom had only a tub with no serarate shower and poor lighting. I returned because they boast that the top floors have been renovated. Well, that's a BIG LIE!!! Maybe they slapped on a coat of paint. There was NO upgrade to the bathroom/dressing area, the old outdated kitchen was still in place, the cushions on the sofa were very stained. It was still the same outdated suite that I had before. How can a hotel get away with saying they have renovated the rooms? Also, on this 'club level' the quality and quantity of food/snacks was very poor. Why pay extra for almost nothing? Do Not Like Being Deceived!!!

Reviews.Title: “by far the best hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: utex1983
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Windsor Court to conclude a 25th Anniversary trip. Everything was superb, including the surprise bottle of champagne provided by the General Manager. It is convenient to Jackson Square, the River, Harrah's, Mothers, the Quarter, the Garden District--by far the best hotel we've ever stayed at (we started our vacation with a night at the Ritz-Carlton). Our Junior Suite was HUGE and very nicely appointed. I wish we had stayed their the whole trip!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the World”
Reviews.Author: Bolderite
Reviews.Content: I stay at hotels all the time, and have stayed at the Ritz, Hyatt, Four Seasons, etc. all over the U.S. and many worldwide. This was my best hotel experience ever. The suite was enormous and beautiful, and less expensive than at the generic Sheraton down the street. The complimentary health club and pool were wonderful, with first rate equipment and an impeccably clean locker room with steam and sauna and fully equipped showers with robes and slippers and razors etc. We did three packages offered by the hotel, one each night. One included dinner for two, an incredible bargain and the best food we had in this city known for great food. The second package included tix to a jazz club, with a great show. The third was for a delicious breakfast, served in the room in style. But the best part was the staff. Everyone knew us by name, knew we were celebrating a birthday, and treated us like visiting royalty. The concierge fixed us up for meals and a tour and local info. The art was like a museum ($8million in artwork -- the restaurant has a book describing it all). Usually a hotel is a place to stay. This one is a place to experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, rooms need a little TLC....”
Reviews.Author: naport44
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a conference. Location was great with beautiful views of the MS river and within walking distance of French Quarter. The hotel was managed well, and had great service but for the cost of the rooms they could use a little TLC. Sofa's were stained, bathroom was far from 4 star like and needed to be gutted. The kitchenette's were quite old with appliances I hadn't seen since the 60's. Overall it's a quaint place but for the price their are much better options in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “If you like European Hotels, you'll love WINDSOR COURT”
Reviews.Author: SugarLadies
Reviews.Content: We wanted a four day R&R in peace and selected Windsor Court because we had been there before and enjoyed the European feel of the hotel. Our trip was booked by American Express Platinum and we had an automatic upgrade to a full suite when we arrived as Windsor Court is part of their Fine Hotels and Resorts! The 4:00 p.m. checkout that goes with the Am. Ex. program was really an extra delight! Many of the staff remembered our names from our last visit and several made a point to go out of their way to welcome us back. Since it was our Anniversary, we were treated to delicious chocolate covered strawberries! I've read some of the other evaluations, and noted their discussion about the "dated" furniture! Our home is filled with 100 yr. plus antiques, so I presume we are more comfortable at Windsor Court because our lives have always been filled with antiques. In addition, we very often stay at the Waldorf Astoria Towers in New York, and find that the Windsor Court has the same European feel! The Grill Room was outstanding! The entire staff goes out of their way to be sure that you are happy! We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star facility, but still very good”
Reviews.Author: JoeVirginia
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Court is an average facility with above average staff. It simply hasn't been updated in some time. The guest rooms are good size, but curtains, beds, TV's, lighting carpets, etc. are all aging. A Quasar TV?, haven't seen one of those in a very long time. The beds were not that comfortable compared to 5 star facilities I've stayed out. Everything had a 1980's look and feel to it. The staff is very good and every touch point was positive. Housekeeping was excellent, front desk and concierge very helpful and valet guys did a fine job. Had breakfast in the restaurant a couple of times and while expensive, it was also excellent. The location is very good. If you are used to the 5 star accommodations of a Ritz Carlton, Four Seasons, etc, you might be underwhelmed by the Windsor Court. But if you can get past the somewhat dated rooms, you will enjoy your stay very much. I gave it a 4 star since the staff was so good.

Reviews.Title: “Windsor Court Respite”
Reviews.Author: Annetta_9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently had a very comfortable and enjoyable stay at the Windsor Court Hotel, New Orleans, LA. This was our second stay at this hotel. I booked our room (a junior suite) directly with the hotel, and the agent was extremely helpful and thorough in explaining all of the room/suite options and rates. Even though we had a full suite our previous stay, which was fabulous, I opted for the junior suite this time because they all have balconies, whereas some of the full suites have bay windows instead. My requests and expectations were fully met, and we had a very nice suite on the 18th floor that had two balconies with great views overlooking the city. The large dressing area, spacious closet, robes, and slippers were all greatly appreciated, and the bed rated high on the comfort scale compared to many hotels. We had dinner at the hotel in the Grill Room, and upon making our dinner reservation were questioned about the occasion. My husband mentioned that we were belatedly celebrating our anniversary. When we arrived for dinner, the hostess greeted us and wished us a happy anniversary. Also, a complimentary plate of dessert goodies with "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate was an unexpected and delightful bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marssl
Reviews.Content: I had a suite and it was easily the largest hotel room I have ever had. The room had a separate living area and a full kitchen. The decor was very nice and had the feel of a Garden District mansion. Location is good and is across the street from the casino and a few blocks from the Quarter. I can't point to any faults other than the price tag. I thought it was a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Windsor”
Reviews.Author: DenverPilate
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Windsor Court Hotel in December 2008. The staff, the food, the accommodations, and the decorations were fabulous. We were particularly fond of the Polo Club Lounge. A very cozy, lively, and comfortable location for a late lunch, a drink before dinner, or after dinner drinks. My wife left her scarf in the lounge one night, a staff member locked it up, and upon our inquiry at least 24 hours later, the staff graciously returned it. An excellent location, an easy walk to the French Quarter, but away from the late and early morning noise of the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great employees!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gidget53
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I were in New Orleans for my nephew's graduation from the New Orleans Police Academy the end of December. We chose the Windsor Court b/c of past memories with our parents - they loved to have tea there!!!!! It is also a great location - easy to get to the French Quarter and the Garden District. We were not there long and did not get to try the restuarant or lounge (or have tea), but did have room service for breakfast one day and it was delicious. The hotel and staff are trying very hard to return everything to it's pre-Katrina status. It was decorated beautifully for the holidays. We had a corner room with two very comfortable beds and it was huge. Very quiet. We loved it, but the best part were the employees. They could not have been any friendlier or more accomodating - from check-in, to bell staff to concierge to housekeeping. I inadvertently left all my jewelry out in our room one day and have to admit I was very nervous about it; when I realized it. When we returned, it was all there safe and sound and had not been touched. I think that says a lot about the quality of people they have working there. We will definitely go back, the next time we are in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobLongmeadow_MA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited New Orleans for the first time in December and wanted to stay in what we thought would be the best hotel in town, well situated for the sights we wanted to see. The Windsor Court was a perfect choice. This is near the French Quarter in a nice part of the city, and our room offered a view of the Mississippi River. As New Englanders, we found the welcomes in New Orleans unsurpassed, whether in restaurants or shops, and every staff member of the hotel was as helpful and welcoming as possible. Everyone should visit New Orleans post-Katrina, as it is a testament to the love and dedication of people who have suffered great loss and fought back with great pride. This hotel is as good as any hotel, anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “BEST Birthday Stay EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: wnbamiamisol
Reviews.Content: American Express had originally booked the Ritz Carlton for my 5-day birthday stay in New Orleans. After seeing some current photos taken by a Trip Advisor reviewer, I asked AmEx to book me into a different hotel. The choice of the Windsor Court could not have been better! Upon my early arrival, Ashley on the front desk greeted me enthusiastically and was genuinely interested in my birthday celebration trip! She had upgraded me from a Junior Suite to a Full Suite (I didn't know it at this point) and as the room was not ready said they would store the luggage and call me on my cell phone the moment it was ready. This was fine as we had a full day's activities planned. In the early afternoon, the call came as promised. However, we didn't complete the check in for a couple hours because we were having too much fun snacking on raw oysters in the French Quarter. When we did arrive back at the hotel, I was again cheerfully greeted and told my luggage would be brought up immediately. I was pleasantly shocked to see we had been upgraded to a FULL suite. The luggage arrived within 5 minutes (you know at some hotels it can take an hour). Shortly afterwards, the door bell rang and a bottle of Veuve Clicquot had been sent by the hotel management as birthday cheer! Again, a super pleasant surprise! Throughout our stay, staff (restaurant, bellmen, concierge) kept asking how the birthday trip was going and giving me birthday wishes on the exact day. Everyone seemed to really enjoy working at the hotel and the feeling was passed on to the guests. This was a huge positive. I don't think I need to describe the room, other than to say it was super clean and everything was in working order and really, the bedding was luxurious! I fell asleep quickly and easily each night. The marble floors and walls in the bath were opulent. The shower was hot and strong. It's probably a shame we didn't spend more time in the room! Our city view was fantastic! The main restaurant, The New Orleans Grill, was a bit pricey for breakfast, but absolutely excellent. On our last morning there, the staff even came by to say "goodbye" and "safe trip." They also offered to pack snacks and fruit for us for the drive! Our dinner there (the first night) was excellent. Service was attentive, friendly and neither rushed nor pesty. It was reasonably priced for a wonderful array of appetizers shared by the two of us. Our stay at the Windsor Court made us genuinely feel welcome in New Orleans. I can't wait to return and would not consider staying at any other hotel. The Windsor Court hotel is absolutely the top hotel I have stayed in in North America and Europe ( That includes the former Plaza NYC and Hotel Sacher in Vienna)

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen20
Reviews.Content: Not sure where all the rave reviews come from. We stayed on the club level and it was certainly NOT the Ritz. Rooms were ok, bathrooms were poorly lit with horrible, dirty white rugs and toilet mats. Mirror was peeling. The club lounge was lacking the extra attention to cleanliness you find at a Four Seasons or Ritz. Tables were not cleaned well and plates, utensils were dirty. Staff was very friendly and accomodating and the location is great - But the finer touches just aren't there.

Reviews.Title: “The Windsor Court for the Holidays- was a treat!”
Reviews.Author: moria70125
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had family in town for Thanksgiving and they were staying at the Windsor Court. We decided, as a treat, to stay there as well. What a wonderful time we had! The staff was great - very attentive and friendy. Always ready to lend a hand or answer a question. The hotel itself looked lovely, especially with all of the beautiful Christmas decorations that went up during our time there. The rooms are so big! Well, ours was a suite...and it was the size of a small apartment! Having tea at the Windsor Court is a must. They sell out over the Christmas season, so we were lucky to get in right before the rush! Thanksgiving in the restaurant was quite an experience. I mean that in a good way! And we got drift that there is a new chef there. I don't know if that's true, but I can tell you that the food was wonderful. And there is an energy in the restaurant I haven't seen in a while. While we are locals, I can't wait until we have an excuse to go back! I know my family is already making plans to come back to New Orleans for NEXT Thanksgiving.

Reviews.Title: “Windsor Court still shines”
Reviews.Author: betsy921
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many large, small, & boutique hotels in new orleans and many years ago, i had the good fortune to stay at the windsor court. my experience was so wonderful that i have always hoped to return. i recently had that opportunity and was extremely pleased with my stay. the staff from top to bottom could not have been more helpful, kind and courteous. my room was large, airy and comfortable. the property is conveniently located to the french quarter, riverwalk, and the harrah's, in case you're a gambler. my business colleagues stayed right next door at the W and each day brought a new litany of horrendous complaints about their hotel. the windsor court may not be the new, sexy, hot property, but i, for one, will take good service, and the pleasurable experience of the wonderful older hotel any day.

Reviews.Title: “Our Fantastic Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: lisadavid66
Reviews.Content: After previously spending a very romantic and fun weekend on our first weekend trip as a couple, we decided that we wanted to return to the Windsor Court for our honeymoon stay. It is such a easy place to make reservations. They have outstanding service and they make you feel like you are royalty, which we all know were not. We love the room service breakfast, its so convenient. You just fill out the menu, place it on your door and then wow! your meal arrives very punctually. Now, the service is great, but wait till you taste the meal. It is absolutely delicious. The staff is very friendly and courteous no matter what your doing or where you are in the hotel. We look forward to staying with you again in the future. Thank you for making our honeymoon very special. David & Lisa Gaudet

Reviews.Title: “Key to why the ratings are so incongruous”
Reviews.Author: manahatta
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a suite. It's large, like it's promised. It is clean and the staff are very courteous. However: * The furnishings are cheap * The "wet bar" is a crappy kitchenette that has been poorly converted into a half-ass mini-bar that is very ill-equipped. * I had repairmen come to my room 3 times in the first day because so many things were broken (toilet, internet jack, curtains) * The TV is at least 15 years old, and that pretty much represents the feel of the whole place. If you want a large suite, this place will do. If you want luxury -- which is what I wanted -- this hotel sucks horribly. I kick myself for not going with the standard hotel I stay in: the Ritz-Carlton, which was the same price. Why does the property have great ratings? Well, apparently, if you stay on the Club Floor it's not a run down has-been hotel. If only I knew. But honestly, give me the Ritz. The hotel amenities weren't that nice, either. Basically, what I am saying is: avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for any occasion! Always first class service............”
Reviews.Author: bacpriddle
Reviews.Content: We have made it a tradition to celebrate our wedding anniversary at the Windsor Court, in New Orleans, every year. The food, service and accommodations are always first class. All of the staff go out of their way to add special little touches, recognizing the special celebration, which makes it even more special. The restaurant is outstanding and we always begin the evening with a martini, in the bar, which has a wonderful atmosphere. Highly recommended........................

Reviews.Title: “so wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ldgp
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Jr suite with a beautiful view of the river, the room was great and the service was 5 stars. You know you are in a wonderful place when you get turn down service and fresh linens without having to ask, also room service was very prompt with fresh coffee in the morning and desserts with CafÃ© Au Lait in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but space for improvements”
Reviews.Author: Batta83
Reviews.Content: The location, the size of the rooms and the amenities of this hotel are excellent, particularly in this city where hotel quality can be a problem. Nevertheless, at least my stay was not of the five star quality that you would like from a hotel who sees itself in the tradition of the orient express. On the first day my room was not made up when I returned at 4 p.m. and I had to call housekeeping to remind them. They also needed several calls to finally pick up my laundry. Finally, the furniture in the lobby and in my room wase quite worn out and many chairs had significant damage (e.g. the armrests); the bathtup also showed significant wear and tear and I certainly did not want to sit in it. In concluson a major renovation project is needed. I am not a picky person, but with the image that this hotel is projecting (4 star AAA rating and so on), they did not live up to all expectations. Nevertheless, it is probably one of the best places in New Orleans and I certainly would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I Love Windsor Court Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aaheartsvacay
Reviews.Content: It was the most wonderful hotel experience. Everyone was so polite and helpful. Check-In was super fast, they even let us check in before 3pm. The room we stayed in was spacious, had a pool view which was awesome! The beds were so comfortable. I didn't want to leave this hotel. I definitely will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: emjmp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. Our stay was great. The staff was very nice and helpful. The location of the hotel is fantastic. Very close to the French Quater and the Riverwalk.The lounge and the restaurant were fabulous. I highly recommend this hotel and I will definitely be coming back

Reviews.Title: “The City is BACK beautifully in this jewel of a hotel in the HEART of the city!”
Reviews.Author: brumfamily
Reviews.Content: O! The views! The Stars staying at the Windsor Court! THE FOOD INSIDE and outside of the hotel! No one has food like New Orleans! NO one! It's incredible! Oysters like silk! Wait Staff like the best private homes in Europe! Saks is down the street and so is the Aquarium! Perfect for our family! Drinks in the Club level at the Windsor Court then on to fun in the city! The precise location for all of the sights and sensations of N.O.L.A.! Don't miss Frenchman Street.. Val Kilmer having brunch at Marginy Brasserie.....Incredible JAZZ!!! and did i mention FOOD? Luke, John Besh's little German number is down the street..with fresh shrimp and amazing grits; get the Abita Pecan Ale......don't miss Commander's Palace and James Beard Foundation winner Donald Link's Cochon for the most authentic roasted red fish and the most amazing oyster & bacon sandwich! The Windsor Court is our DESTINATION for all we ADORE in New Orleans! Thank you Lord for bringing it BACK!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: Star2
Reviews.Content: We went to New Orleans for the weekend from Florida.Can I say I had mixed emotions from the reviews however It turned out to be quite terrific. When we arrived It was dark and the courtyard is beautiful with the lights shining up to the trees.The valet guys were cordial and helpful.Our check in was conducted at the desk of the asst. manager and he was very pleasant and efficient. So some of the reviews were negative about the decor and in need of renovations.It felt like a quick trip to Europe to us.The hotel and rooms are nice ,old, but very clean and felt like we were in New Orleans(If that has a feel) Our rooms were 601-603.They are across the hall from each other(and at the end of the hall) but have a common area in the middle that has a main door that closes off.We left our room doors open and It felt very roomy for us to all walk about.The actual room we had has a separate living,bedroom and butler pantry.Maybe It was just me but I loved It.We stay in world class hotels all year long but I really did enjoy tha ambience of this place.We used the workout room and the equiptment was new and clean with an attendant on site.They had cold bottles of water , fruit and towels.The grill was delicious for breakfast and we had drinks in the lounge one evening.The afternoon tea looked like fun with alot of people dressed up and having a great time.However we didnt partake. Seriously overall It was great.Yes It could use new furniture but the hotel is miles better than others in the area,and the staff go out of their way to accomodate.As I always end my reviews :You can have the best product in the world,but If you cant back It up efficiently and effectively you dont have a darn thing.They do It right.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best!”
Reviews.Author: mulehouse
Reviews.Content: This hotel is incredible!! the staff, the furnishings, the amenities are all over the top. If you are lucky enough to stay on the Club level you will feel as if you are a guest in the home of royalty...from the breakfast to the cocktails and appetizers, it is absolutely wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “the ultimate experience”
Reviews.Author: barbuserLongIsland
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from our third stay at the Windsor Court Hotel. As always, it was fantastic. This was our first stay in a full suite. The experience was incredible. It also included continental breakfast in either the Grill Room or room service. We have been to New Orleans many times and have stayed at various hotels, but none (including the Ritz Carlton) even come close the the Windsor Court. The staff is out of this world. We had a leak in our shower (which did not bother us) but was obviously reported by the housekeeper. It was not fixed and when we told that to the front desk staff, they immediately offered to move us to another room. We told them that under no circumstances did we want to be moved as we "loved our room". They laughed and said that they had equally beautiful rooms and they would be happy to relocate us. Again, we said, "no thank you!! The staff could not have been nicer. This was our first trip back since Katrina. We were a little apprehensive about what we would find (and, our friends are using us as their scouts) but we felt like we were immediately taken back into pre Katrina (with a few things here and there that were bordered up) and were so excited to return to the city we love. We now look forward to our next trip to New Orleans. We got a great deal at the Windsor Court and hope that we might be as lucky the next time we want to go. Once you stay in a suite in this hotel you DO NOT want to stay anywhere else!! PS thanks to the Windsor Court - my husband I were celebrating our wedding anniversay and we were sent up a bottle of champagne - just what we would expect from this classy operation. Can't wait to return!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Prior to my visit, I read some the reviews on TripAdvisor and had some misgivings about the comments about dated and deteriorated rooms. I have absolutely no complaints. My "room" (booked by Harrah's located across the street) was upgraded to a suite. Suite does not do justice, I stayed in what is really a one bedroom apartment. You enter into an about ten by ten foyer, past a small kitchen to a full living room with a small dining table next to a balcony. The bedroom has another balcony and a king sized bed. There is a dressing room with vanity and combination wood wardrobe/closet. Normal bathroom. The room is not modern but is tastefully done. I saw no evidence of deterioration. The staff was friendly and professional. I only ate one breakfast there in the Grill Room. Pricey, but very good. The hotel is every bit as good as Loews Resorts, JW Marriot, W, etc.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Accomodations in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveler777
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Windsor Court Hotel for business related purposes. I think this hotel certainly deserves it's rating as the best hotel in New Orleans. I drove to the property and was immediately met by both bellstaff and valet staff who immediately took care of my luggage and parked my car. Check-in was very fast and handled very professionally by the well trained reception staff. The elevators are extremely fast and whisked us up to our 18th floor suite. I stayed in one of the 800 sq. ft full suites. It had a magnificent view of the Mississippi River, Aquarium, Riverwalk, and the adjacent Harrah's casino. The beautiful suite included a small kitchenette, full living area, french doors opening to a huge bedroom, king bed, separate powder and bath areas. It even included a TV that was remotely controlled that rose up at the foot of the bed allowing for up close viewing. The bath was all marble and included a bidet. The hotel has an excellent restaurant onsite called the New Orleans Grill. It serves excellent breakfast, lunch and dinner. There is also a traditional afternoon tea served on certain days. The Polo lounge is also a great place to sit back and relax in the evening. Paul McCartney even played an impromtu performance at the piano the last time he stayed here. I see why the President, celebrities and other high profile people choose this property when they stay in New Orleans. The fantastic staff, great location, and wonderful rooms make it one of the best in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with southern charm.”
Reviews.Author: jckspann
Reviews.Content: I normally stay on Bourbon Street with a balcony, but defaulted to the Windsor Court when I was unable to get a room. What a great break because from now on I'll visit Bourbon and soak up the luxury of the Windsor Court.

Reviews.Title: “Eh at the Windsor”
Reviews.Author: BeccaGrim
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were not blown away by the Windsor Court Hotel in New Orleans. The rooms were really poorly done and the staff was completely inept. They were late with our room and then late again with a room my family had booked for the next night. They were not friendly or apologetic and we had to wait for everything we asked for. The grounds were very beautiful and the concierge was actually top notch but we won't be staying there again. We will stay at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Windsor Court was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityVisitor
Reviews.Content: Our three night stay was wonderful. We were in a suite on the 11th floor with balcony. Room was huge, beautifully appointed and comfortable. We travel often and this was one of the best, right up there with European hotels of 5 star quality. The entrance and all areas were meticulous. Shined floors. The pool was clean and maintained. The rooms quiet. The staff was always helpful. The best place to stay in New Orleans. I would recommend this hotel and stay here anytime I return to N.O.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably bad!”
Reviews.Author: honestlou
Reviews.Content: I had looked at the Trip Advisor reviews that were overwhelmingly positive-- enough so for me to disregard the few negative comments. When I saw that Frommer ranked it the best hotel in the city, and maybe the nation, that sealed the deal and I booked a room for three nights for an anniversary get-a-way. The staff was very professional and courteous, but when we got to the room we were shocked! SHOCKING is the only way to describe it. The carpet had many obvious stains, and was coming up at the seams. The bed had a permanent 'body' indention and looked like the mattress had never been turned in 30 years. I am not exaggerating. The chrome was substantially worn off of the bathroom fixtures. I called the front desk and told them that the room was unacceptable. They did not sound surprised, and as our luggage had not been brought up yet, they said that the bellman would bring a key to a new room. My wife went down to the lounge to hide. As we were leaving the first room I asked the bellman, "not to put too fine of a point on it, but do you have a room that has been remodeled in the last 10 years?" He replied "none of our rooms have ever been remodeled." I think this is true. When we got to the new room, it was better as far as having no major stains on the carpet, which was still glued down, and the bed looked better. I stayed in the room and my wife came up. The bathroom fixtures were still worn, and it had the same 30 year old kitchenette area. As I was sitting in a chair discussing the situation with my wife, I noticed my arm feeling sticky on the arm of the chair. There was nothing obvious there, but it did bring my attention to the fact that the upholstery was mostly worn off of the arm on the chair. We looked around again and decided to leave. At the front counter, the manager on duty was very apologetic and didn't want us to leave. I agreed to go with him to look at a Club Level room, which supposedly is the only level that has been remodeled. I looked around the room, and I can't say it was remodeled. It was perhaps maintained, in the that the carpet and fixtures were better, but it still had the 30 year old kitchenette, and the furniture and fixtures appeared to be the same as in the previous two rooms. It was in better condition, and if this had been the first room we got to, we probably would have stayed in it, but at this point it was not enough of an improvement to remedy the disappoint my wife and I felt. We left the hotel and stayed in the Westin, which was close, and at least clean and well maintained. The rooms (suites) at the Windsor Court are very large, but have very old furniture and fixtures, with a very plain bath area. It's not like it has suites with large baths and jacuzzi type tubs. If you want outstanding service and a very large worn out room, then you will enjoy the Windsor Court!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious honeymoon spot”
Reviews.Author: TravelingEs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Windsor Court for a few days during our January honeymoon, and we enjoyed it immensely. Every member of the staff we encountered was kind and welcoming; we were even upgraded from a junior suite to a full suite at no extra cost because we were honeymooning. Our suite was enormous and lovely. We got a great deal by booking a "romantic getaway" package, which included breakfast in bed and dinner in the outstanding hotel restaurant. We felt completely pampered, just as we'd hoped.

Reviews.Title: “Windor Court: It's OK”
Reviews.Author: KOinCT
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Windsor Court in April for a wedding in NOLA. It definitely has a certain charm and ambience to it, but it's just not my thing. I would say I enjoy a more modern aesthetic and the Windsor Court didn't quite do it for me with all the flowery, old-school looking decor. We stayed in one of the spacious suites, but honestly, the living room is not terribly inviting, so we barely used it during our stay. There is also a small kitchen (no microwave) in the room that went unused. Frankly, when I'm on vacation, the last thing I want to see is a kitchen! Nonetheless, overall, the rooms were pretty decent. The bathroom was also very spacious and the dressing area outside the bathroom was nice as well. However, the bathroom had a strange mix of amenities - i.e. the bath products were from 2-3 different brands! Odd. Also, the beds were rock hard which did not make for very comfortable slumber. Service was also spotty. Funnily enough, we went during a weekend when the hotel was anticipating a VERY special guest, so about a week beforehand, we received a call about heightened security and keeping indentification on you at all times. That was fine. However, my in-laws (who also stayed there as guests of the wedding as well) were told during check-in that they would need to be moved to another hotel for the last night due to special circumstances. However, when my husband and I checked in later that same day, we were not told anything and when we asked about it, they assured us that we would not be moved. Nonetheless, the next day, we were in fact told that we would be moved. So, when we tried to ask details about the move, the guy at the front desk seemed clueless. They were going to move us on the day of the wedding, so getting the logistics ironed out was important because we would not even be around most of the day to move bags, check-out, etc. So, information was delayed, staff were confused - it was a bit of a mess. They finally got us straightened out and were gracious enough to comp us a room at the Loews Hotel for all the trouble. So, in that respect, they went above and beyond. As for the pros, their afternoon tea is a lovely, relaxing experience - a fun thing to do with girlfriends or loved one. The hotel is also conveniently located and actually lies a bit outside of the French Quarter so you're not inundated with noise and rowdiness. Lastly, when visiting NOLA, don't miss the charbroiled oysters at Drago's (at the Hilton). They are TO DIE FOR!

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Staff Needs MAJOR Attitude Adjustment.”
Reviews.Author: bpp63
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at the Ritz while in New Orleans, but as they were full, I contacted Windsor Court and booked 3 Suites for a one night business stay. It had been approximately 10 years since I had stayed at Windsor Court, but remembered the hotel was very nice and at the rate they were charging, approximately $750 per room on Club level, on a Sunday night by the way, I felt it should be nice. When I made our reservations, I indicated that we would require an early check-in. The morning of our check-in, I again phoned the hotel to advise them that we would require early check-in, and they said there would be no problem. We arrived at the hotel at approximately 1:30 p.m., and our rooms weren't ready until after 4:00 p.m.. So much for our early check-in. (Standard check in is 3:00 p.m.) Not only did they not have any of our rooms ready, 3 in total, but when I mentioned to the front desk person that I had specifically requested an early check-in and could he please let me know approximately what time our rooms would be ready, he told me in attitude overload with all but the head banging, "It's all up to housekeeping, we have no idea". I asked him if he could possibly phone housekeeping to let them know that we were there, ready to occupy our rooms, and could they possibly do our rooms next. He then told me, "All these people are in front of you--We have no idea when your rooms will be ready but if you have a cell phone we'll call you when they are". No, "I'm sorry Miss, but please take this voucher and have a free drink/lunch on us while we see what we can do with our housekeeping staff", or "Miss, let me give you your club level key and please feel free to go there for comfort while you wait and we'll contact you as soon as your room(s) are ready". Nothing. He was a jerk and it set the entire 24 hours off on a bad note. Once in the room, I phoned the hotel manager to complain, but I was on hold so long that I eventually just hung up in frustration. As on so many hotels, the main lobby is very nice--nice artwork, beautiful floors, traditional old money decor with great ambience. But the Suite itself, needs a facelift. Badly. (We were in Suite 2106) There were two lamps with bad bulbs, the minibar key didn't work, even the bellman couldn't get it to work and they had to send another, the carpet was soiled--both in the room and in the hallway. The countertops in the dressing room and in the bathroom were severly out of date-I practically had to bend over to touch my toes to brush my teeth in the sink, and they were very worn around the edges and around the wallpaper. The bedding, bed coverlet, was dated, although the bed was comfortable enough. To be fair, my husband did say the view was nice from the balcony, and we did get our wake up call as scheduled the next morning. We had lunch at their main grill, and it was okay, but just okay. We had a driver scheduled to pick us up from the hotel to take us back to the airport, and after two attempts to get a bellman, my husband and I drug our items ourselves, I had several large boxes, thru the lobby and to the car. Our driver kept saying to us, "I can't believe they don't have a bellman, I can't believe they aren't helping us....". Overall, with things in New Orleans as they are in the aftermath of Katrina, and as dependent as the city is on tourism, you would think that courtesy and customer satisfaction would be top on their minds to make you want to return to New Orleans. Unfortunately, nothing that Windsor Court did made me want to rush back to 'help' the New Orleans economy. It is very apparent they don't have a properly trained staff, at least not at Windsor Court, and the staff I did deal with there could have cared less about satisfying a customer. I'm sure that at some point I will return to New Orleans, but I'm also sure that it won't be to stay at the Windsor Court Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: traveltoomuchToronto
Reviews.Content: Terrific hotel, well located near the French Quarter in NO. The staff were exceptional, all well trained at asking whetehr they had met your expectations. Junior suite is very comfortable. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Over the top, outstanding, a perfect ten...”
Reviews.Author: tyoung9966
Reviews.Content: Ah, the Windsor Court is back. I was introduced to the employees once and was greeted by name the rest of the trip. Quick, friendly check-in. The signature suite was completely re-done. Huge room, living area, full-sized refrigerator, large spacious bath, new carpet, drapes, lamps, paint â€“ Molton Brown products, soft high thread-count sheets and pillows. Friendly, efficient staff from beginning to end. Great food, quick and convenient valet parking. Perfection! If you are going to New Orleans - this hotel is a must do. Trust me - I have tried all the others and there is no comparison. Perfectly situated just out of the Quarter but convenient to everything from uptown to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Just gorgeous - great service”
Reviews.Author: merz99
Reviews.Content: I booked this through the hotel's website. It was a special that was not advertised on the travel websites, and I felt better about getting the service we expected booking through the hotel itself. They arranged to have a us picked up at the airport (available when you book your room). A bit expensive but well worth it. When we arrived at 11 am, our room was not ready yet, so we went into the bar area. We met several interesting people and had a few great conversations. The entire hotel is very well done in English antiques and decor. If you are expecting a modern hotel, stay at the W. This place was like being in an old English state home. Just fantastic service as well. I will surely stay here again and again. New Orleans was charming by day and wild at night. Its good to see the city start recovering. I hope more people come back so that the small shops, musicians and great eateries can make a quick comeback.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NYJohnMark
Reviews.Content: New Orleans is definitely back in business, and I can't imagine that the Windsor Court could have been any better before Katrina. Our stay was flawless. We had a very luxurious room with a view of the sunrise over the Mississippi every morning, and our lunch at the New Orleans Grill at the hotel was wonderful--as was my first Sazerac ever. The staff was charming and gracious, and I think the room service breakfast menu was the best I've seen at any hotel ever. The hotel was in easy walking distance of everywhere we wanted to go, and I can't imagine staying anywhere else in New Orleans. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnThree
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews of this hotel seemed rather mediocre to me. So, I contacted the hotel and told them of my reservations on getting a room which was not of top quality. To further complicate the request, I was booking the least expensive, special-rate, full suite. They said they would make note of my concerns. The rate was $229 plus tax. The visit could not have been better. The suite, I counted 6 rooms, was immaculate and clearly of recent construction or renovation. It overlooked the Harrah's Casino and on to the Mississippi River, an eastern view which provided a beautiful sunrise on a crisp clear day. We were on the 14th floor which is not listed as one of the special "Club" floors, which I believe puts this suite square in the category of a regular room. There was a small pantry kitchen, in which a Manhattanite would be comfortable, an entry space and a nice living room with floor to ceiling sliding glass doors onto a small balcony, a bedroom with two beds (also with floor to ceiling windows) , two separate dressing areas and a large bathroom. The entrance, lobby, reception areas were very attractive. We had drinks in the delightful and sophisticated Polo Bar on the second floor in the late evening. Our breakfast was in the Grill also on the second floor. Breakfast, although expensive, is almost movie-set quality, meaning a beautifully set table with flowers and a fine presentation. Of equal importance, the staff which we encountered were all cheerful and professional and you got the impression that they would almost jump through hoops to fill your requests. These rooms are worth well over what I paid and I assume are some post-Katrina slow economy rate. Take advantage of it while you can!

Reviews.Title: “Bring back the old Windsor Court!”
Reviews.Author: mkctn
Reviews.Content: i just returned from a two night stay in the Windsor Court. I echo many of the comments of other reviewers. I had stayed here a number of times in the 90's and it was a fabulous hotel. This is the first time I've been back since 2000. The rooms are still huge, the common areas are still elegant, but it's all very dated and in need of a refresh. The common areas smell moldy. The TV's are old tube TV's that just don't fit in with a luxury hotel. The shower was mildewed, and when you took a shower, even with the bathroom door closed, there was a draft that caused the thin shower liner to constantly blow toward your body and stick to your wet skin--not a pleasant bathing experience! When I asked about wireless internet they said it was broken,but that i could use complimentary wired access in the room. Unfortunately, despite a number of calls, i could never get the internet access to work. The deadbolt lock on my room door didn't work, and as a female travelling alone that made me very uncomfortable. I asked them to fix it--it never got fixed. I requested a USA Today in the morning instead of the Times Picayune--they continued to deliver the TP. All of these issues are fairly minor, but not what you expect in a luxury hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and the food was good. I hope they spend some money to update the property, because this was once a great hotel and deserves to be again. In the meantime i have to give it 3 stars. I can't compare it with other New Orleans hotels, b/c this is my first trip post-Katrina. As far as restaurants go, skip Galatoire and definitely go to August across the street from the hotel. Mothers is around the corner and is a great new orleans diner.

Reviews.Title: “Trying Hard”
Reviews.Author: TravelWarriors
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Windsor Court many times through the years before Katrina, this most recent stay is the first time we have been back since Katrina. We were somewhat disappointed that so much time has passed since the hurricane and the Hotel hasn't really updated, repaired or cleaned the common/public areas or the rooms. Our room was very worn and tattered with stains on the carpet, furniture and linens. Essentially the room didn't look like it had been attended to at all. Given that Orient Express is the owner of the hotel, we would have thought they would have helped "bring the Hotel back". Anyway, the staff throughout the Hotel did seem very interested in helping, making sure our needs were met, etc, but there is just so much that can be done when you are staying in a luxury hotel, paying a very high rate and it doesn't meet the level of quality expected. Pros: Hotel Staff are trying really hard to make the service like it was before the hurricane; located adjacent to the quarter, aquarium, and casino, very quiet,fast room service Cons: Serious need of repair and updating; pool not operational, food not what it used to be; drinks in the bar, meals in the hotel cafes/resturants was very overpriced compared to other hotels in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice”
Reviews.Author: sassygal7698
Reviews.Content: Loved our 2 night stay. Upon early arrival our room was not ready, so we enjoyed a glass of wine in the bar/lounge area on the second floor. Our room was ready shortly and we were called by the front desk. The Windsor Court provided us with a spacious corner room which featured a double balcony. While the view was not spectacular, due to the room being located on a lower floor, we found sitting on the balcony on a comfortable New Orleans evening very enjoyable. Our room featured a large living room, butlerâ€™s kitchen, large vanity with closet area, large bathroom with soaking tub, and a comfortable king sized four bed which featured beautiful French doors to separate it from the living room. The staff was pleasant and helpful, the room service prompt, and the little touches throughout the suite thoughtful. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone at any age visiting New Orleans. The location is ideal and quite and the size and features of the room for the price, compared to the basic hotel elsewhere in the city, reasonable. My only negative comment, which by no means will keep me from staying here again, but since the management does read these reviews it may help them improve the stay is that our room, the lobby, and the bar/lounge area on the second floor were dated. As discussed with my traveling partner, you can tell this hotel was designed correctly and furnished with quality carpets, furniture, and appliances. If it were not done correctly it would not have lasted as long as it has and in the decent condition it appears. All that being said, it is time for an overhaul of the suites. A more modern feel with reupholstered chairs and couches, fresh carpet, new phones, TVs, and butlerâ€™s kitchen will once again make the Windsor Court New Orleans the place to stay while visiting the Big Easy.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous rooms, below average service”
Reviews.Author: nola83
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a suite on our wedding night on the club level. The room was enormous and gorgeous, with a huge balcony, incredible view, great bed, huge dressing room, huge bathroom, etc. etc. etc... You can't find a nicer place to stay than these club level suites. The service, however, was less than desirable. We arrived at about 11:30pm. I'm not sure if the bell and door staff doesn't work this late, but we had no help with bags, umbrellas for the rain, or opening the doors with our stuff. Luckily I had checked in earlier and left our large suitcases at the front desk to be put in our room for us so it was manageable. When I checked in and left our luggage earlier in the afternoon, I had asked that a bottle of champagne be in our room on ice waiting when we arrived. I thought it would be a nice touch and surprise to arrive and toast in the beautiful room. I was told confidently that it would absolutely be taken care of (although I noticed nothing was written down). Unfortunately there was no champagne waiting for us and it never did come. Once in the room, when wanting a bottle of water, I realized that they had neither offered us a key to the mini-bar, nor told us if it was in the room somewhere or anything. We never did find the key. Our stay was short since we were leaving early for our honeymoon the next morning. Unfortunately we missed out on the complimentary breakfast, lunch, tea, and cocktails as a result. Upon leaving at 6:45am, once again we had no help with much more luggage this time. I suppose the bell staff and doormen do not work during the late evening and early morning hours. All in all it was a perfect room, but I was disappointed in the service. Not being able to enjoy the complimentary perks that come with a club level suite, I was hoping to at least be accommodated on the few minor needs/requests that I had.

Reviews.Title: “New Oleans Charm”
Reviews.Author: GeneDC
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful New year's visit to New orleans and the Windsor Court Hotel. Hotel was charming! Very accessible to french quarter and streetcar lines to the Garden District. Staff was gracious and appreciative of all patronizing the hotel. Rooms were quite spacious and comfortable.
